commit_message:
Do not log passwords

This prevents data to be leaked into the callback plugin.

Change-Id: I2c281e33c1bb6bf52198e35a78b77ea3ede1f2cf
(cherry picked from commit f6ee455f2b27d924f3ac1f7657006c43bfe6001e)

[{'created': '2018-04-22 02:03:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix lower-constraints.txt to match correct min versions

Change-Id: I2c0e28ffb722fbd7aaaf8828eb269a736a1168f9
'}, {'created': '2018-04-22 02:16:25.000000000', 'message': 'Bump min version of magnumclient

magnum-ui depends on cluster_templates which is availablel
since magnumclient 2.3.0, so the minimum dependency is wrong.

Also fixes lower-constraints.txt to match correct min versions
as the original script has a bug and proposed wrong versions
as minimum constraints.

Change-Id: I2c0e28ffb722fbd7aaaf8828eb269a736a1168f9
'}, {'created': '2018-04-22 02:39:49.000000000', 'message': 'Bump min version of magnumclient

magnum-ui depends on cluster_templates and quotas.
To satisfy this magnumclient 2.6.0 or later is required.

Also fixes lower-constraints.txt to match correct min versions
as the original script has a bug and proposed wrong versions
as minimum constraints.

Change-Id: I2c0e28ffb722fbd7aaaf8828eb269a736a1168f9
'}]
commit_message:
Bump min version of magnumclient

magnum-ui depends on cluster_templates and quotas.
To satisfy this magnumclient 2.6.0 or later is required.

Also fixes lower-constraints.txt to match correct min versions
as the original script has a bug and proposed wrong versions
as minimum constraints.

Change-Id: I2c0e28ffb722fbd7aaaf8828eb269a736a1168f9

commit_message:
Integrate a setuptools command

Add a 'build_reno' setuptools command. 'skipsdist' is removed from
'tox', because there's no reason not to run this step as part of tox.

Change-Id: I49b659948f35381a44e2fb5f91dd6bf9e8ef619e

commit_message:
Make section titles have stable anchor links

Currently some sections produce anchors like "#id1", which will change
over time as new releases are made. Instead, put in explicit references
so that each version gets an anchor based on the version number, and so
that each heading inside of the version has one based on the section
title and the release version.

Each anchor needs to be prefixed either with the title, if given, or
with another string as some people include reno inside of other
sphinx documentation and these will produce global refererences for the
sphinx build. Also, since it's one global set of anchors, each version
needs to be prefixed by title (or 'relnotes') and the section title
because otherwise in cases like reno's own docs where some versions are
included in the output twice, sphinx will produce conflicts.

Change-Id: Ia6bdaffa6d0ae286542fbb7ae12613be56bdb326

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: ID allocator to reuse an id as late as possible

With this change the label allocator will not reuse
an ID if possible to find one subsequent to the last
allocated.

Additionally, to catch potential inconsistencies,
releasing a non-allocated id will raise an exception,
rather than just log a warning.

Change-Id: Iba1f6573985a0edaff2f91909ac257a9bc464b7b
Closes-Bug: 1766239

commit_message:
Expend bash idiom to make it sh compatible in in get_all_bridges.

In some latest deployment the bash idiom are not supported anymore.
Let's make sure we are sh compatible in get_all_bridges.

Change-Id: Ib56972e3aec41621deca9261d4ab818305682831
Closes-Bug: #1766625

commit_message:
Glance policy copy is not using correct name

This is currently using the full path for the destination
which doesn't appear to be what is wanted; instead the
actual file name should be used.

Closes-Bug: 1757532

Change-Id: If85e98097a0d0e0b55d0b2993185c8591e6dd10e

messages:
[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-19 19:21:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-19 19:40:38.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

LGTM:

osboxes@osboxes:~/git/nova$ git log --oneline --no-merges 17.0.2..origin/stable/queens
2d50f6e libvirt: Report the allocated size of preallocated file based disks
c0db837 Document how to disable notifications
525ea3c ironic: Get correct inventory for deployed node
9cb96ab List instances performace optimization
f9c6643 only increment disk address unit for scsi devices
04ea910 Skip placement on rebuild in same host
757dbd1 Don't persist RequestSpec.retry
8680781 Remove the branch specifier from the nova-multiattach job
c2dc902 Add regression test for persisted RequestSpec.retry from failed resize
98eb85f libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature flags
546236e libvirt: Block swapping to an encrypted volume when using QEMU to decrypt
df90dfd Avoid showing password in log
9affdb0 Add __repr__ for NovaException
osboxes@osboxes:~/git/nova$ 

The hash is likely to change once the dependent patch merges."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-20 00:03:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-20 01:20:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

Yup bf0a0697734b204e9c64df834895d46382a2cc3c is correct.'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-04-20 02:47:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-20 06:11:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow-1

Actually, should this be 17.1.0 instead because of "98eb85f libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature flags"?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-20 13:50:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Actually, should this be 17.1.0 instead because of "98eb85f libvirt: Allow to specify granular CPU feature flags"?

No, that's not a feature. It's a bug fix with a config option that is either disabled (the default), or allowed one specific value (PCID), so it's not a feature. This is why I pushed so hard for the way that was done so we could backport it without worrying about whether or not it was backporting a feature. Note that the same bug fix is also going into stable/pike and stable/ocata.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-20 14:13:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Workflow

Okay, thanks for the sanity check.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-23 16:55:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

Looks good, will give one more day for the stable team to review.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-25 09:07:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

I'm fine approving this as Matt is on stable team"}]

installed in the image. However some of the packages in this

commit_message:
Clean python requirements from base image

openstack-base image includes a list of dependencies to be
installed in the image. However some of the packages in this
list seems not to be used by any or very few OpenStack services
according to the info found in codesearch.

This patch removes some python packages from this list as we
are in the process of cleaning dependencies in RDO.

Change-Id: I209b16cfd7dff6ce20bc2417a6079fb8597f6774
Closes-Bug: #1766493

commit_message:
Add cpu and memory_size options support for function

Allow users to specify cpu/memory_size when creating function, and
allow to update their values saved in function database.

This patch is api part of customized cpu/mem in qinling server and
is based on patch [0].

[0]: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562507/
Story: 2001586
Task: 14366

Change-Id: I7a245f93a445a00c2722238d3f94d3a960f16af4

commit_message:
bionic: enable bionic amulet test as part of a full gate recheck

Note(coreycb): This cherry-pick is split into two commits. Bionic
amulet test enablement can't land until charm-percona-cluster
bionic support lands.

Change-Id: I031202093464a0a72a5fc18b95e49a8b83def5f3
(cherry picked from commit 6fc85dc5a2058297a2d706fd204347e2112f18cb)

commit_message:
Configurable host network for inventory

This patch makes the host network configurable in the ansible inventory.
Previously, this was always hardcoded to ctlplane. In some cases, there
may be no ctlplane network (possible with deployed-server), and another
network will need to be used to connect to the overcloud nodes.

Change-Id: I132a2f2bec3d26ceeec0d8dc0eee85675b75dd04

commit_message:
Add validation for SoftwareConfig outputs

SoftwareConfig/StructuredConfig outputs aren't supported with
config-download given that Heat doesn't know what the output values will
since Ansible is applying all configuration after the stack is complete.

This validation will report a warning whenever it finds use of outputs on
these resource types.

After config-download is the default and the Heat driven method is no
longer supported, we can switch this warning to an error.

Change-Id: I44d5ee3bab3d05ab0a59261d15ea915c75b35713

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 20:57:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix changes regex

Previously if the number of patchsets was greater than 9 (meaning two
digits) the regex to try and capture the repo name was not properly
trimming all the numbers. Rather than requiring specific counts of
numbers, we should just trim any numbers from the ZUUL_CHANGES.

This could be seen by trying
ZUUL_CHANGES=openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements:master:refs/changes/72/521172/11
which would result in tripleo-puppet-elements1 which then would not be
matched by the tripleo-puppet-elements repo.

Change-Id: I4ad8b377c4b12a97d2d04859f5d05f8a8137be9d
Closes-Bug: #1766350
'}]
commit_message:
Fix changes regex

Previously if the number of patchsets was greater than 9 (meaning two
digits) the regex to try and capture the repo name was not properly
trimming all the numbers. Rather than requiring specific counts of
numbers, we should just trim any numbers from the ZUUL_CHANGES.

This could be seen by trying
ZUUL_CHANGES=openstack/tripleo-puppet-elements:master:refs/changes/72/521172/11
which would result in tripleo-puppet-elements1 which then would not be
matched by the tripleo-puppet-elements repo.

Change-Id: I4ad8b377c4b12a97d2d04859f5d05f8a8137be9d
Closes-Bug: #1766350

commit_message:
don't let tox_install.sh error if there is nothing to do

If we end up with an empty package list, return without erroring.

Change-Id: Id66aaf4bcb8c40ab720303a3ca92a46f92642369
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0c555a4126570604a68e8dc113b1ea89f611c710)

commit_message:
Update undercloud install directories

We're working on renaming the directories we're creating during the
containerized undercloud installation. So we need to make sure we
capture them.

Depends-On: I0cf206e8ceeecfca17dd99a83b8c2eaa50e66712
Change-Id: I16f19a121212d989e1184103054eb890ec4b9297
Related-Bug: #1761810

commit_message:
Use only update/upgrade ansible queue instead

Related tripleo-common change:
https://review.openstack.org/562995

To avoid race between tripleo queue and ansible queue
we need to use inly ansible queue for update and upgrade

Change-Id: I39b5a1a154b10683ac0de85afd6bbadc3491192a
(cherry picked from commit 3b197c09911997e0f7ff127deff892e064a58786)

commit_message:
Remove all usage of keystoneclient

A lot of keystoneclient has been long deprecated and is slated
for removal. This change removes two usages of keystoneclient
and replaces them with similar functionality in keystoneauth.

Change-Id: I0128a7bb42b0d691600fdd03aac287633c8b2451

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 00:46:57.000000000', 'message': 'Remove EPEL for RDO of RHEL

Since Ocata, it has been recommended to disable EPEL when using RDO
because of breaking backward compatibility.

https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/install-guide-rdo/environment-packages.html

There seems to be no special reason to use EPEL in case of RHEL.

Change-Id: Iadc351dac518c03163811aab4dfeee7ad0457687
Signed-off-by: Minho Ban <mhban@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Remove EPEL for RDO of RHEL

Since Ocata, it has been recommended to disable EPEL when using RDO
because of breaking backward compatibility.

https://docs.openstack.org/ocata/install-guide-rdo/environment-packages.html

There seems to be no special reason to use EPEL in case of RHEL.

Change-Id: Iadc351dac518c03163811aab4dfeee7ad0457687
Signed-off-by: Minho Ban <mhban@samsung.com>

commit_message:
Remove atomic timer from nova.bind_actions method

Method `_bind_actions` creates an inner rally entity for further
launching different kind of actions.
It is redundant to calculate how much time takes initialization of one
inner class + calling several inner methods. It takes ms.

Change-Id: Id5224138e3dcdd6815e7ee00ae5b16200fb7f2d9

commit_message:
Enrich integration with ironic networking features

The mac key in nodes_json is deprecated, replaced with
"ports" key. New ports key is list of dicts holding a
richer data set matching the properties of ports in the
Bare Metal service api. In addition to mac address the
physical_network and local_link_connection can be
defined for Bare Metal ports when registering nodes.

* address: (mandatory)
  The physical address (mac address) of the port.
* physical_network: (otional)
  Defaults to: ctlplane
* local_link_connection: (optional)
  This data enables the possibility for automatic
  configuration of switches via neutron plugins. e.g
  ML2 vendor plugins. Defaults to: None

Implements: enrich-ironic-networking-integration
Change-Id: I74d4178dbb0cfe8c934ce15e3e7c9bb1c469de10

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 09:41:29.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Add a debug log entry before / after invoking migrate()

The guest.migrate() is running in an async background thread, so it is
useful to see exactly when it runs relative to other threads.  And the
existing message: "Starting monitoring of live migration" is a bad one
to rely on because there's no guarantee libvirt has been told to start
migration yet.

So add a debug log entry before and after issuing the guest.migrate()
call.

Change-Id: Ia7d5de5b0ee4f5d88b5101d2258336adf573a350
Suggested-by: Daniel Berrang (discovered via debugging a Nova live
              migration bug)
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: Add a debug log entry before / after invoking migrate()

The guest.migrate() is running in an async background thread, so it is
useful to see exactly when it runs relative to other threads.  And the
existing message: "Starting monitoring of live migration" is a bad one
to rely on because there's no guarantee libvirt has been told to start
migration yet.

So add a debug log entry before and after issuing the guest.migrate()
call.

Change-Id: Ia7d5de5b0ee4f5d88b5101d2258336adf573a350
Suggested-by: Daniel Berrang (discovered via debugging a Nova live
              migration bug)
Signed-off-by: Kashyap Chamarthy <kchamart@redhat.com>

commit_message:
dashboard: use new neutronclient

This change updates the call to neutronclient to use
the BGPVPN methods natively defined in python-neutronclient,
rather than the ones defined by the dynamic extension to
neutronclient from networking-bgpvpn (which are deprecated).

Also removes use of mox at the same time.

This change also makes the lower constraint job use
neutron, horizon, networking-odl and networking-bagpipe
from git, which is required to unbreak the CI right now.

Change-Id: I7d399466f6577e4dd55b1a0fa5a92aab15e6eebb
Partial-Bug: 1761691

subject: Add the start and end time for CONTINUOUS audit
messages:
[{'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2018-03-09 02:39:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2018-03-09 02:43:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 13111, 'date': '2018-03-13 07:10:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2018-03-14 02:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2018-03-14 02:22:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2018-03-21 08:43:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(6 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24872, 'date': '2018-03-21 10:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2018-03-22 03:01:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(5 comments)'}, {'account_id': 24501, 'date': '2018-03-28 09:44:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

We should foresee such scene.
The load of the data-center reduces during night, so the users would like to do server_consolidation during 22:00-8:00; while the load would boom in the day, then the users would like to do workload_balancing during 10:00-20:00.
It is in cycles every day. An audit not just execuates in specific priod but also in cycles every day. 

It seems an upper and independent usage. I think it's better to add a new component in Watcher to schedule the audit execuate time."}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2018-04-03 11:39:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 21692, 'date': '2018-04-03 11:40:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2018-04-10 11:35:52.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> We should foresee such scene.
 > The load of the data-center reduces during night, so the users
 > would like to do server_consolidation during 22:00-8:00; while the
 > load would boom in the day, then the users would like to do
 > workload_balancing during 10:00-20:00.
 > It is in cycles every day. An audit not just execuates in specific
 > priod but also in cycles every day.
 > 
 > It seems an upper and independent usage. I think it's better to add
 > a new component in Watcher to schedule the audit execuate time.

You may reach this use case by using cron syntax, that would allow you set whatever cycle you want."}, {'account_id': 19055, 'date': '2018-04-10 13:01:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Add the start and end time for CONTINUOUS audit

This spec proposes to add the audit start and end time
for CONTINUOUS audit.

subject: Fix project where cold migrated instance is in
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 03:38:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix project where cold migrated instance is in

Spec says an instance coldly migrates to admin project,
but actually migrates to service project.
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I7d5335d999b4d3cc7e32c2b3efc4c05aa9b7a4bf
'}]
commit_message:
Fix project where cold migrated instance is in

Spec says an instance coldly migrates to admin project,
but actually migrates to service project.
This patch fix it.

Change-Id: I7d5335d999b4d3cc7e32c2b3efc4c05aa9b7a4bf

commit_message:
Make charm agnostic of underlying init system

Replace charm custom init control functions with `service_pause`
and `service_resume` functions from charm-helpers.

Change-Id: I235af30a19294316f65fba0e13fe10ae50164a42
Closes-Bug: #1765215
(cherry picked from commit edc18d4937807dbe2934580449182d65cd642f53)

[{'created': '2018-04-24 08:30:22.000000000', 'message': 'Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Change-Id: I9d5b2d5139ed61ff9d7f116c33e3e145362b46e1
(cherry picked from commit dc4f54a6e3e34047cf831ba35a04283ca2f96fe7)
'}]
commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: I9d5b2d5139ed61ff9d7f116c33e3e145362b46e1
(cherry picked from commit dc4f54a6e3e34047cf831ba35a04283ca2f96fe7)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-18 15:47:05.000000000', 'message': 'devstack: Fix octavia api lb kubelet iface access

Without this patch, with SDNs that apply SG to the ovs internal ports
would get blocked by the fact that the traffic from the API LB to the
member is not allowed. This can be easily reproduced with setting the
ml2/ovs firewall driver to openvswitch instead of hybrid.

Change-Id: I0fdb09e705328c4da4fc302dc80f9aa2a2730aad
Closes-bug: #1765082
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

commit_message:
devstack: Fix octavia api lb kubelet iface access

Without this patch, with SDNs that apply SG to the ovs internal ports
would get blocked by the fact that the traffic from the API LB to the
member is not allowed. This can be easily reproduced with setting the
ml2/ovs firewall driver to openvswitch instead of hybrid.

Change-Id: I0fdb09e705328c4da4fc302dc80f9aa2a2730aad
Closes-bug: #1765082
Signed-off-by: Antoni Segura Puimedon <antonisp@celebdor.com>

[{'created': '2018-04-18 06:40:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix ipc_mode comparison in the latest docker

In old docker, if you do not specify ipc_mode, the default value is empty,
but in the latest docker, such as 17.09.0, if not specified, the default
is "IpcMode": "shareable", which will cause all containers to be deleted
and re-create when to redeploy or upgrade. This commit solves the
problem.

Change-Id: Ia8269b9c8066880e4aee23d6fdea8d9c04c41e44
Closes-Bug: #1747586
(cherry picked from commit 193ce726c242556416556869ed48c86e14b22632)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix ipc_mode comparison in the latest docker

In old docker, if you do not specify ipc_mode, the default value is empty,
but in the latest docker, such as 17.09.0, if not specified, the default
is "IpcMode": "shareable", which will cause all containers to be deleted
and re-create when to redeploy or upgrade. This commit solves the
problem.

Change-Id: Ia8269b9c8066880e4aee23d6fdea8d9c04c41e44
Closes-Bug: #1747586
(cherry picked from commit 193ce726c242556416556869ed48c86e14b22632)

commit_message:
Fix LB member creation on Nested environment

The current LB member creation expects that an OVS bind occurred, but
for the Nested environment the Overcloud do not OVS bind.

This commit fixes the issue by checking whether a configuration option
is enabled to OVS bind and so use the IP address of the port created,
otherwise will use HOST_IP.

Change-Id: Id851ea0a0eebe141ba3f97466faa6d98856d5229
Closes-Bug: #1762894

[{'created': '2018-04-23 08:42:00.000000000', 'message': 'Added missing pki volume for keystone.

When we authenticate against a FreeIPA, we have to inject its CA in a
specific location.

Keystone wants it here: /etc/pki/ca-trust/source/anchors/ca.crt.pem

This patch mounts the system anchors in the container.

Change-Id: I5cf028d9424a253f8b5d66d818a091508b9486d7
Closes-Bug: #1766178
'}, {'created': '2018-04-23 08:56:54.000000000', 'message': 'Added missing pki volume for custom CA.

commit_message:
Added missing pki volume for custom CA.

Some services want the CA to be in the anchors directory. Just mount it
everywhere.

Change-Id: I5cf028d9424a253f8b5d66d818a091508b9486d7
Closes-Bug: #1766178

commit_message:
Allow Keystone config in init_config for http check

Now the user will be able to configure one, default Keystone for all
services in `http_check.yml` instead of providing them one by one for
every instance.

Setting Keystone config in every instance is marked as depreciated.

Story: 2001843
Task: 12610

Change-Id: If52b52efab6cc14a7df583b1dc2596b04e6813bc

commit_message:
Add required-projects config for docs job

Horizon plugins needs horizon master for own master development.
So we should install horizon master into every test environment.
This patch adds requred-projects and adds horizon into it for docs job.
In other job on CI infra and local, tox runs, so horizon installation
would be done in "commands" on tox.ini.

Change-Id: I01ae64131a25cd7f73c3a21ee7868f53f3e559fd

commit_message:
stop using tox_install.sh

Duplicate the dependencies that are listed in extras and place them in
a test-requirements.txt file so we can install them using the
constraints list.

In order to add the new requirements file, we have to make the constraints
and requirements match each other and the global settings.

Change-Id: I4dae402fe37015f0f512d5e9a6426d5f39526347
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix healthcheck script for neutron-api service

Current script expects neutron-api to run with mod_wsgi
Update to point to bind_host:bind_port and proper defaults

Closes-Bug: #1761122
(cherry picked from commit 1621bdbe4b13c0a80137cb6b39cfdd540caf673e)

Thanks Luk for testing. The paste looks good (Step2_Execution resource got deleted), so i'm removing WIP."}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2018-04-17 08:53:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6796, 'date': '2018-04-17 08:55:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

I like the idea but I guess it needs some manual testing?'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-04-18 02:20:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I tested this patch for the ffu workflow and running overcloud deploy with ffwd-upgrade-converge.yaml still triggers the ceph-ansible workflow which fails because it uses the regular ceph-ansible playbooks not the ones needed for upgrade. 

This is the command that I ran after running the ansible playbooks for ffu upgrade/deploy:

#!/bin/bash
openstack overcloud deploy \
--timeout 100 \
--templates /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates \
--stack QualtiyEng \
--libvirt-type kvm \
--ntp-server clock.redhat.com \
--control-scale 3 \
--control-flavor controller \
--compute-scale 2 \
--compute-flavor compute \
--ceph-storage-scale 3 \
--ceph-storage-flavor ceph \
-e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/storage-environment.yaml \
-e /home/stack/virt/internal.yaml \
-e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/network-isolation.yaml \
-e /home/stack/virt/network/network-environment.yaml \
-e /home/stack/virt/hostnames.yml \
-e /home/stack/virt/debug.yaml \
-e /home/stack/virt/docker-images.yaml \
-e /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates/environments/lifecycle/ffwd-upgrade-converge.yaml \'}, {'account_id': 8042, 'date': '2018-04-18 09:00:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Right indeed i see the issue -- the converge done via `overcloud deploy` command actually does a stack update, while what we expect with the new CLI/workflows is that `overcloud (update/upgrade/ffwd-upgrade) converge` command will only do a plan update. After this users *must* proceed with upgrading Ceph, they must not run a normal `overcloud deploy` yet, or what you described above will happen.

If we wanted to replicate the new way of converge, we'd do `overcloud deploy --plan-update-only`.

The current state of converge that works for you could be considered broken, because it leaves Ceph no-opped."}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-04-18 15:43:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Code-Review

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Right indeed i see the issue -- the converge done via `overcloud
 > deploy` command actually does a stack update, while what we expect
 > with the new CLI/workflows is that `overcloud (update/upgrade/ffwd-upgrade)
 > converge` command will only do a plan update. After this users
 > *must* proceed with upgrading Ceph, they must not run a normal
 > `overcloud deploy` yet, or what you described above will happen.
 > 
 > If we wanted to replicate the new way of converge, we'd do
 > `overcloud deploy --plan-update-only`.
 > 
 > The current state of converge that works for you could be
 > considered broken, because it leaves Ceph no-opped.

Thanks, trying with overcloud deploy --plan-update-only"}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-04-19 03:44:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18851, 'date': '2018-04-19 03:55:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-16 16:33:38.000000000', 'message': "No-op Mistral workflow resources for update/upgrade/ffwd

So far we haven't been disabling workflows for update/upgrade. We
should disable them by default as they could have the potential to
disrupt the update/upgrade/ffwd procedure.

The main example of a thing we deploy via the workflow resources is
Ceph. We decided no-opping ceph-ansible for the main
update/upgrade/ffwd upgrade steps is the safest path forward and we'll
update/upgrade Ceph it after the main procedure is finished.

Change-Id: I34c7213ab7b70963ad2e50f7633b665fad70bde5
"}, {'created': '2018-04-23 10:48:06.000000000', 'message': "No-op Mistral workflow resources for update/upgrade/ffwd

So far we haven't been disabling workflows for update/upgrade. We
should disable them by default as they could have the potential to
disrupt the update/upgrade/ffwd procedure.

The main example of a thing we deploy via the workflow resources is
Ceph. We decided no-opping ceph-ansible for the main
update/upgrade/ffwd upgrade steps is the safest path forward and we'll
update/upgrade Ceph it after the main procedure is finished.


Change-Id: I34c7213ab7b70963ad2e50f7633b665fad70bde5
"}]
commit_message:
No-op Mistral workflow resources for update/upgrade/ffwd

So far we haven't been disabling workflows for update/upgrade. We
should disable them by default as they could have the potential to
disrupt the update/upgrade/ffwd procedure.

The main example of a thing we deploy via the workflow resources is
Ceph. We decided no-opping ceph-ansible for the main
update/upgrade/ffwd upgrade steps is the safest path forward and we'll
update/upgrade Ceph it after the main procedure is finished.


Change-Id: I34c7213ab7b70963ad2e50f7633b665fad70bde5

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Iff00524bc3eb0fe1070aee7584885465cacd2393
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

'}, {'created': '2017-11-10 19:06:42.000000000', 'message': 'Support separate oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notification

This commit introduces oslo.messaging services in place of a single
rabbitmq server. This will enable the separation of rpc and
notifications for the continued use of a single backend (e.g.
rabbitmq server) or a dual backend for the messaging communications.

This patch:
* add oslo_messaging_rpc and oslo_messaging_notify services
* add puppet services for rpc and notification
  (rabbitmq and qdrouterd servers)
* add docker services to deploy rpc (rabbitmq or qdrouterd)
  and notify (rabbitmq or shared)
* remove rabbit parameters from core services
* update resource registries, service_net_map, roles, etc.
* update ci environment container scenarios
* add environment generator for messaging
* add release note

Depends-On: I03e99d35ed043cf11bea9b7462058bd80f4d99da
Needed-By: Ie181a92731e254b7f613ad25fee6cc37e985c315
Change-Id: I934561612d26befd88a9053262836b47bdf4efb0

commit_message:
Support separate oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notification

This commit introduces oslo.messaging services in place of a single
rabbitmq server. This will enable the separation of rpc and
notifications for the continued use of a single backend (e.g.
rabbitmq server) or a dual backend for the messaging communications.

This patch:
* add oslo_messaging_rpc and oslo_messaging_notify services
* add puppet services for rpc and notification
  (rabbitmq and qdrouterd servers)
* add docker services to deploy rpc (rabbitmq or qdrouterd)
  and notify (rabbitmq or shared)
* retains rabbit parameters for core services
* update resource registries, service_net_map, roles, etc.
* update ci environment container scenarios
* add environment generator for messaging
* add release note

Depends-On: Ic2c1a58526febefc1703da5fec12ff68dcc0efa0
Depends-On: I154e2fe6f66b296b9b643627d57696e5178e1815
Depends-On: I03e99d35ed043cf11bea9b7462058bd80f4d99da
Needed-By: Ie181a92731e254b7f613ad25fee6cc37e985c315
Change-Id: I934561612d26befd88a9053262836b47bdf4efb0

[{'created': '2018-03-26 12:58:12.000000000', 'message': 'Always hard link http boot contents for Ironic

... just in the case it is running containerized undercloud.
The --http-boot path (defaults to /httpboot) is the source of the link
and /var/lib/ironic/httpboot (defined in constants) - is the destination.

The future fix is deprecate --http-boot and always use the bind-mounted
path for containerized Ironic.

commit_message:
Alter default http boot path for containerized Ironic

Containerization is a default choice from now on.
Alter the --http-boot path defaults from /httpboot to
/var/lib/ironic/httpboot as it is configured via puppet
and t-h-t.

Change-Id: I9ec403eba10488a51ac40348e76dd47c1b7b9c2b
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

[{'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-04-04 09:31:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-04-12 04:58:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-04-12 04:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-04-16 12:09:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-04-17 08:13:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-04-17 13:33:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

this comes with some security tradeoffs - is there a strong reason to move away from sockets?'}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-04-18 02:38:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> this comes with some security tradeoffs - is there a strong reason
 > to move away from sockets?

hmm..it listens only on local loopback address (if you look at netstat -ntl results on any worker nodes, you'll see many other services use this way as well), and this is default in openstack. external sdn controller based drivers like sona or odl need this as well for setting ovsdb passive mode. we can still use socket with value overrides."}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-04-23 14:29:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 6678, 'date': '2018-04-24 02:02:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 23928, 'date': '2018-04-24 23:01:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22477, 'date': '2018-04-25 02:49:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

commit_message:
openvswitch: allow setting ovsdb connection using vsctl

Also changed neutron agents to use default, ptcp:6640:127.0.0.1.

Change-Id: Id43c376851f0c408da4684c219dc79ef4a1c157b
Closes-Bug: 1761117

[{'created': '2018-04-11 18:54:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix lower-constraints

In the course of switching over to lower-constraints, the lower
constraints got out of sync with the requirements. This change fixes the
constraints using the script mentioned in
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129056.html

Change-Id: Iae317fa745862ebde4115ca8e77a26c6c9be20ac

commit_message:
Fix lower-constraints

In the course of switching over to lower-constraints, the lower
constraints got out of sync with the requirements. This change fixes the
constraints using the script mentioned in
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129056.html

Change-Id: Iae317fa745862ebde4115ca8e77a26c6c9be20ac

subject: Adds PyMySQL dependency to test-requirements
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-06 08:26:23.000000000', 'message': 'Adds PyMySQL dependency to test-requirements

test-requirements does not have PyMySQL dependency, ImportError is raised when
running ironic-inspector locally from virtualenv with database connection schema
configured as mysql+pymysql.

It would be good to have either in development or when deployed standalone.
This patch add PyMySQL to test-requirements, the minimum version is set to which
ironic in use.

Change-Id: I1557ea955966b0a906da7fd395cb25ea67ef4516
'}]
commit_message:
Adds PyMySQL dependency to test-requirements

test-requirements does not have PyMySQL dependency, ImportError is raised when
running ironic-inspector locally from virtualenv with database connection schema
configured as mysql+pymysql.

It would be good to have either in development or when deployed standalone.
This patch add PyMySQL to test-requirements, the minimum version is set to which
ironic in use.

Change-Id: I1557ea955966b0a906da7fd395cb25ea67ef4516

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 20:55:34.000000000', 'message': 'Make sure that the wheel build task fails if the wheel build fails

Due to the use of the pipe in the shell command the return code is
always zero even when the wheel build fails. This results in some
very obscure failures down the line which do not make it obvious
that the failure to build the appropriate wheel was the root cause.

In this patch we ensure that the shell will fail if the pip command
fails by setting the bash pipefail option.

Change-Id: Id539515557b439824e39ea2f693f62b913d5bdda
(cherry picked from commit 22914931395ac05cd03fcd9f92c7467061578927)
'}]
commit_message:
Make sure that the wheel build task fails if the wheel build fails

Due to the use of the pipe in the shell command the return code is
always zero even when the wheel build fails. This results in some
very obscure failures down the line which do not make it obvious
that the failure to build the appropriate wheel was the root cause.

In this patch we ensure that the shell will fail if the pip command
fails by setting the bash pipefail option.

Change-Id: Id539515557b439824e39ea2f693f62b913d5bdda
(cherry picked from commit 22914931395ac05cd03fcd9f92c7467061578927)

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: I6b07be9b7912ff226991552b9be6dc9999416b56
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add bindep.txt file

Bindep is a tool for checking the presence of binary packages needed
to use an application / library. It started life as a way to make it
easier to set up a development environment for OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: I1a6cfa255a6473febf0fb7b7d4f1bf8ca32d02c2
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/563717
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Do not use a transaction for get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath()
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 748, 'name': 'Armando Migliaccio', 'email': 'armamig@gmail.com', 'username': 'armando-migliaccio'}, {'_account_id': 1131, 'name': 'Brian Haley', 'email': 'haleyb.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-haley'}, {'_account_id': 5756, 'name': 'Terry Wilson', 'email': 'twilson@redhat.com', 'username': 'otherwiseguy'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23804, 'name': 'Daniel Alvarez', 'email': 'dalvarez@redhat.com', 'username': 'dalvarez'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-04-18 08:14:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-04-19 10:46:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-04-19 14:06:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2018-04-23 15:15:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

In general, ovsdbapp theoretically should be used w/o accessing anything directly internal to a backend outside of a Command object. Since there is now only one backend it doesn't *really* matter right now--if there ever was a new/better backend it would just make it unusable without some refactoring.

I'm ok with this change, just pointing out the theoretically possible but probably not that likely future implications. Is there something in ovsdbapp that you think could be changed to make accessing the internals less necessary? Is there a change where you could imagine if we were using ovn-nbctl/sbctl as a theoretical backend that the locking code would need to change since those would do a new transaction each time?"}, {'account_id': 8788, 'date': '2018-04-24 09:28:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 6773, 'date': '2018-04-24 09:51:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Hi Terry! 

 > In general, ovsdbapp theoretically should be used w/o accessing
 > anything directly internal to a backend outside of a Command
 > object. Since there is now only one backend it doesn't *really*
 > matter right now--if there ever was a new/better backend it would
 > just make it unusable without some refactoring.
 > 

The problem here is that by using a Command we also should start a transaction to execute that command. I believe that for cases like get_*()'s or db_find()'s a transaction is useless because it won't go to the server anyway. The resources should be found in the in-memory replica of OVSDB. Is that assumption correct ?

 > I'm ok with this change, just pointing out the theoretically
 > possible but probably not that likely future implications. Is there
 > something in ovsdbapp that you think could be changed to make
 > accessing the internals less necessary? Is there a change where you
 > could imagine if we were using ovn-nbctl/sbctl as a theoretical
 > backend that the locking code would need to change since those
 > would do a new transaction each time?

Maybe a bit radical, but I don't see the advantages of maintaining these two backends, is there any advantage of using the ovn-nbctl/sbctl CLIs in the backend over IDLs ? If there's none, why not deprecate one and focus in having a good support for the other in ovsdbapp."}, {'account_id': 23804, 'date': '2018-04-24 09:54:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2018-04-24 16:38:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> The problem here is that by using a Command we also should start a transaction to execute that command. I believe that for cases like get_*()'s or db_find()'s a transaction is useless because it won't go to the server anyway. The resources should be found in the in-memory replica of OVSDB. Is that assumption correct ?

This is correct for the python-ovs IDL-based backend.

> Maybe a bit radical, but I don't see the advantages of maintaining these two backends, is there any advantage of using the ovn-nbctl/sbctl CLIs in the backend over IDLs ? If there's none, why not deprecate one and focus in having a good support for the other in ovsdbapp.

There aren't currently two backends for OVN-related stuff, and the ovs-vsctl-based backend I never moved over into ovsdbapp and left to deprecate in the neutron tree. There has occasionally been talk about people how the python-ovs stuff is a bit complicated and that having copies of the db in-memory per connection, etc. is bad. So, I left the ability of ovsdbapp to have different backends in case we some day wanted to fix those issues with something more traditional req/response related ala sqlalchemy.

networking-ovn has always been tied directly to the IDL backend, though as I was converting things over to use ovsdbapp I was trying to get away from that just because it isn't really the "right way" to use ovsdbapp. So, while the transaction isn't "necessary" for the idl-based backend, it would be necessary for some other theoretical backend.

I'm willing to work under the assumption that further backends might not exist and that if they do we can put off the work of refactoring networking-ovn, but I did want to people to be aware of the tradeoff and how ovsdbapp should theoretically work. :)'}, {'account_id': 5756, 'date': '2018-04-24 20:49:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 9656, 'date': '2018-04-24 22:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-18 08:14:18.000000000', 'message': "Do not use a transaction for get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath()

The OVSDB monitor for the Northbound database is invoking
set_port_status_up(), this method will invoke another function
called _wait_for_metadata_provisioned_if_needed() which
will then invoke get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath(). The
get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath() starts a transaction in the OVSDB
Southbound database but, if the IDL for the Southbound database doesn't
have a valid lock [0] it will raise an exception which will prevent the
port status to be marked as UP.

Since the get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath() is just reading from
the Southbound database we do not need to use a transaction for it and
just look for the row we want directly from the in-memory replica of the
Southbound database.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/networking-ovn/blob/df880435d3a7e98aaa8a0ba3a0a9b81286129586/networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py#L285

Closes-bug: #1762933
Change-Id: I650c19164d619a9318b25f48dc113774f8ba67ed
(cherry picked from commit 974d0176dac4ac68edf9af848aadf04d86b2da65)
"}, {'created': '2018-04-19 10:46:25.000000000', 'message': "Do not use a transaction for get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath()

The OVSDB monitor for the Northbound database is invoking
set_port_status_up(), this method will invoke another function
called _wait_for_metadata_provisioned_if_needed() which
will then invoke get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath(). The
get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath() starts a transaction in the OVSDB
Southbound database but, if the IDL for the Southbound database doesn't
have a valid lock [0] it will raise an exception which will prevent the
port status to be marked as UP.

Since the get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath() is just reading from
the Southbound database we do not need to use a transaction for it and
just look for the row we want directly from the in-memory replica of the
Southbound database.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/networking-ovn/blob/df880435d3a7e98aaa8a0ba3a0a9b81286129586/networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py#L285

Closes-bug: #1762933
Change-Id: I650c19164d619a9318b25f48dc113774f8ba67ed
(cherry picked from commit 974d0176dac4ac68edf9af848aadf04d86b2da65)
"}]
commit_message:
Do not use a transaction for get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath()

The OVSDB monitor for the Northbound database is invoking
set_port_status_up(), this method will invoke another function
called _wait_for_metadata_provisioned_if_needed() which
will then invoke get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath(). The
get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath() starts a transaction in the OVSDB
Southbound database but, if the IDL for the Southbound database doesn't
have a valid lock [0] it will raise an exception which will prevent the
port status to be marked as UP.

Since the get_logical_port_chassis_and_datapath() is just reading from
the Southbound database we do not need to use a transaction for it and
just look for the row we want directly from the in-memory replica of the
Southbound database.

[0] https://github.com/openstack/networking-ovn/blob/df880435d3a7e98aaa8a0ba3a0a9b81286129586/networking_ovn/ovsdb/ovsdb_monitor.py#L285

Closes-bug: #1762933
Change-Id: I650c19164d619a9318b25f48dc113774f8ba67ed
(cherry picked from commit 974d0176dac4ac68edf9af848aadf04d86b2da65)

there is TON of good stuff in here.  LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-04-24 04:03:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

Wrong parameter name in the deployment_guide.. it's replicator_workers not replication_workers.. I found that out the hard way when creating a new SAIO to test this patch :)

So should be correct."}, {'account_id': 15343, 'date': '2018-04-24 04:06:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Published edit on patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1179, 'date': '2018-04-24 18:09:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2

Best I can tell tim just fixed the doc thing Matt found (great job Matt!)

I guess I had been referencing the example config and saw an update to the doc tree w/o checking it - whoops!  Oh well, Matt saved us!

Still LGTM.'}, {'account_id': 7233, 'date': '2018-04-24 23:08:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

Thanks Tim, looks great, works in all my tests. Nice work!'}]

"replicator_workers" setting to a positive value N will result in the
replicator using up to N worker processes to perform replication
tasks.

At most one worker per disk will be spawned, so one can set
replicator_workers=99999999 to always get one worker per disk
regardless of the number of disks in each node. This is the same
behavior that the object reconstructor has.

Change-Id: I6802a9ad9f1f9b9dafb99d8b095af0fdbf174dc5
'}, {'created': '2018-03-23 21:22:25.000000000', 'message': 'Multiprocess object replicator

Change-Id: I6802a9ad9f1f9b9dafb99d8b095af0fdbf174dc5
'}, {'created': '2018-04-12 23:01:54.000000000', 'message': 'Multiprocess object replicator

Add a multiprocess mode to the object replicator. Setting the
"replicator_workers" setting to a positive value N will result in the
replicator using up to N worker processes to perform replication
tasks.

At most one worker per disk will be spawned, so one can set
replicator_workers=99999999 to always get one worker per disk
regardless of the number of disks in each node. This is the same
behavior that the object reconstructor has.

Worker process logs will have a bit of information prepended so
operators can tell which messages came from which worker. It looks
like this:

  [worker 1/2 pid=16529] 154/154 (100.00%) partitions replicated in 1.02s (150.87/sec, 0s remaining)

The prefix is "[worker M/N pid=P] ", where M is the worker's index, N
is the total number of workers, and P is the process ID. Every message
from the replicator's logger will have the prefix; this includes
messages from down in diskfile, but does not include things printed to
stdout or stderr.

Drive-by fix: don't dump recon stats when replicating only certain
policies. When running the object replicator with replicator_workers >
0 and "--policies=X,Y,Z", the replicator would update recon stats
after running. Since it only ran on a subset of objects, it should not
update recon, much like it doesn't update recon when run with
--devices or --partitions.

Change-Id: I6802a9ad9f1f9b9dafb99d8b095af0fdbf174dc5
'}, {'created': '2018-04-24 04:06:41.000000000', 'message': 'Multiprocess object replicator

commit_message:
Multiprocess object replicator

Add a multiprocess mode to the object replicator. Setting the
"replicator_workers" setting to a positive value N will result in the
replicator using up to N worker processes to perform replication
tasks.

At most one worker per disk will be spawned, so one can set
replicator_workers=99999999 to always get one worker per disk
regardless of the number of disks in each node. This is the same
behavior that the object reconstructor has.

Worker process logs will have a bit of information prepended so
operators can tell which messages came from which worker. It looks
like this:

  [worker 1/2 pid=16529] 154/154 (100.00%) partitions replicated in 1.02s (150.87/sec, 0s remaining)

The prefix is "[worker M/N pid=P] ", where M is the worker's index, N
is the total number of workers, and P is the process ID. Every message
from the replicator's logger will have the prefix; this includes
messages from down in diskfile, but does not include things printed to
stdout or stderr.

Drive-by fix: don't dump recon stats when replicating only certain
policies. When running the object replicator with replicator_workers >
0 and "--policies=X,Y,Z", the replicator would update recon stats
after running. Since it only ran on a subset of objects, it should not
update recon, much like it doesn't update recon when run with
--devices or --partitions.

Change-Id: I6802a9ad9f1f9b9dafb99d8b095af0fdbf174dc5

commit_message:
Stop verifying updated driver in creating task

When a driver of a node is updated, the new driver is passed for
creating a task. If a new driver is a hardware type, the new hardware
type is validated with existing interfaces stored in database even
if requesting to update interfaces together. This causes an error if
the new hardware type doesn't support an existing interface.

Now that a hardware type and interfaces are validated before creating a
task for locking a node when the node is updated, it is not necessary
to verify an updated driver in the task creation.

Change-Id: I3445d6c33660be535babcf3e300ac4ba1b86ae4f
Story: #2001832
Task: #12595

commit_message:
use sub-resource API extension support

Now that neutron-lib supports sub-resources [1], there's no need for
extension classes to override get_extended_resources to add their
own sub-resources.

This patch removes those methods from the bgpvpn and
bgpvpn-routes-control extensions classes.

(commit message shamelessly stolen from
Ibb66246091fd84e18c56009f5fcb8fdea3aff6b7, thx boden)

[1] I8ae11633962a48de6e8559b85447b8c8c753d705

Change-Id: I2e9901bfced81f680ba078dcbcdbbeb816d79ce0

commit_message:
heat: use BGPVPN API method from neutronclient

With this change, heat code will use the BGPVPN API
methods from neutronclient, instead of the ones dynamically
added to neutronclient by the networking-bgpvpn module.

This allows the heat plugin to be installed in an environment
where networking-bgpvpn is not installed.

Partial-Bug: 1761691
Change-Id: Ibea29481662994c8b560bda45d4db534e924d42a

[{'created': '2018-03-20 13:10:31.000000000', 'message': 'Fix placement calls in placement client

Based on the placement api-ref fix the alreayd implemented placement API
calls in the placement client of neutron-lib.

Fixed/changed parts:
- Add version header to create_resource_provider
- Change create_inventory to update_resource_provider_inventories, as
the http request is a PUT not a POST, and add exception to handle the
case when the rp is not found.
- Fix the failing unit tests, and cover the negative case for
update_resource_provider_inventories.

Change-Id: I336c57e734f91795038c5ba9074970d1f5522da2
Related-Bug: #1578989

commit_message:
Fix placement calls in placement client

Based on the placement api-ref fix the already implemented placement API
calls in the placement client of neutron-lib.

Fixed/changed parts:
- Add version header to create_resource_provider
- Change create_inventory to update_resource_provider_inventories, as
the http request is a PUT not a POST, and add exception to handle the
case when the rp is not found.
- Change update_inventory to update_resource_provider_inventory, to make
the method name in sync with placement API ref.
- Fix the failing unit tests, and cover the negative case for
update_resource_provider_inventories.

Change-Id: I336c57e734f91795038c5ba9074970d1f5522da2
Related-Bug: #1578989

Remove tox_install.sh

Fully removing tox_install.sh as it is no longer needed with zuulv3.

Closes-bug: #1766500

Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ensure that pip.conf templates variables properly

When a user provides values other than the defaults for
upgrade/pre, they may not format it in a way that pip
interprets properly. To ensure that we template the
conf file correctly, we ensure that it's interpreted
as a boolean, then make it lower case as is expected by
pip.

Change-Id: I91590665cd2d878b6b5ef92d1118610bb4a3fd84
(cherry picked from commit b9d90b5e81bcb27766bec04bb6f3794078506f82)

commit_message:
Debian uses uwsgi for nova-placement-api

Do not attempt to configure apache for nova-placement-api in the
case of Debian, as everything is handled by the package that uses
uwsgi instead of apache.

Needed-By: I081542bfca7f5d4f3c0d8493c0b7c90d782a3e1f
Change-Id: I2808e73576fc90c6c9d5c0c1c020998a521924f2

commit_message:
api-ref: document sorting parameters for l2

API users can use the 'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' to do the sorting
on list result. This patch add documentation of these two parameters
for l2 networking resources, including port, segment, and trunk.

Depends-On: I325396bb0256196ee6c6fc42cc812a0c75ae3827
Change-Id: I7f3b9811c8b72dfbee87335ff0a56fae3148c366
Partial-Bug: #1749024

[{'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-02-13 17:52:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-02-13 17:58:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2018-02-13 21:22:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-02-14 15:37:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2018-02-15 14:46:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-02-21 14:25:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

This looks reasonable to me if Rabi is persuaded... I am by no means a gabbi expert.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-03-26 15:28:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-03-26 18:11:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 17887, 'date': '2018-03-27 13:56:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 13134, 'date': '2018-04-12 14:00:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

LGTM, so long as there are no side effects from listing the tests in this situation. Deferring to Rabi.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-04-12 14:49:11.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Though I've a different opinion on usefulness of the patch, I'm no way blocking this:) If majority feels that it's really going to add value to user, lets land it."}, {'account_id': 13134, 'date': '2018-04-12 14:57:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Q: Are there already other was to list the tests in this situation? Or, is there a reason listing tests would be unwarranted here?'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-04-12 18:58:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

For the orchestration tests, I do not know of another way to list the tests other than calling the Gabbi driver.build_tests() method.  If anyone knows of a better way to do it, please let me know.'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-04-13 03:52:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

> Q: Are there already other was to list the tests in this situation? Or, is there a reason listing tests would be unwarranted here?

You can list the api tests when you configure the plugin (correctly). This is trying to handle the case where you install the plugin and not configure it and still be able to list the api tests. I think this is gabbi limitation (not to list tests without a live host/wsgi intercept) and may be fixed in gabbi? However, if this helps users in some way I'm ok with it."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-13 17:37:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(5 comments)

I submitted a pull request to gabbi to allow listing unconfigured tests and just skipping them at runtime, so we'll see what cdent has to say about it: https://github.com/cdent/gabbi/pull/243

If that avenue doesn't work out then I am OK with this change, although there are a couple of tweaks (see inline) that I'd like to see first."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-16 14:27:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

New Gabbi release 1.42.0 contains my patch.'}, {'account_id': 13134, 'date': '2018-04-16 14:31:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5: -Code-Review

Sounds like the change really belongs in Gabbi then. If that's the case, I support that as well."}, {'account_id': 13134, 'date': '2018-04-16 14:32:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-04-16 20:50:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Thank you, Zane! I've tested the new Gabbi version (1.42.0) and it works well. I am going to abandon this commit, but I have a new commit that updates the minimum gabbi version to 1.42.0 in the requirements.txt. If the core team could take a look at that commit, it would be appreciated!"}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-04-16 20:50:58.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Abandonding this commit because a fix has been made to the Gabbi module: https://github.com/cdent/gabbi/commit/01993966c179791186977e27c64b9e525a566408#diff-aa0920de5c2971110a3663b2f9d3e513'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-17 01:15:07.000000000', 'content': 'Restored

We still need a change in the plugin to take advantage of the new option in gabbi.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-04-17 19:23:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

Zane, you are right. My earlier test with the new gabbi release was misleading - I had two versions of tempest running in my environment and it produced a false positive result. My apologies. 
 
Most of this patch is still required, because the call to keystone (get_endpoint_url) can throw exceptions if keystone cannot be reached or if the connection is misconfigured (wrong password, for ex), so there has to be code to handle these exceptions. But now, in the case of keystone not available, we don't have to create dummy endpoints/hosts with the new gabbi change; instead, we can pass an empty string."}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-04-18 14:22:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-04-18 14:22:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-18 19:58:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)

Gabbi change is currently not working due to bug 1529047.'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-18 21:31:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I think https://github.com/zaneb/gabbi/commit/a7bd90ccb4a58c65f35ec20e885a6537dac3cf38 will fix gabbi, but I haven't tried it out so I haven't submitted a PR yet."}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-20 13:10:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

It worked for me. PR merged here: https://github.com/cdent/gabbi/pull/244
Should be fixed in 1.42.1.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-04-20 14:58:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-04-20 15:00:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-04-20 16:03:22.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-04-20 16:11:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-20 17:58:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22636, 'date': '2018-04-20 18:45:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 8833, 'date': '2018-04-24 14:32:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-02-13 17:52:01.000000000', 'message': 'Force API test listing even if auth fails

If the heat-tempest-plugin is installed, and the command
"tempest run --list-tests" is issued, the Heat API (Gabbi) tests
will not be listed if the auth_url is unreachable/mis-provisioned,
or if the key authorization-related variables are not provisioned
in the tempest.conf file. The API tests should be listed regardless
of whether or not the plugin can authenticate using keystone.

In the event that the plugin is not configured (or not configured
correctly), or if keystone is not reachable, this commit ensures
that Gabbi build_tests() is called to give the test listing. In
that case, it needs to provide some dummy values for host and
endpoint parameters of build_tests().

Change-Id: I3921f0df245d3745b95d3a312c41b9f9b15c2ba9
Closes-Bug: #1749218
'}, {'created': '2018-02-13 17:58:42.000000000', 'message': 'Force API test listing even if auth fails

If the heat-tempest-plugin is installed, and the command
"tempest run --list-tests" is issued, the Heat API (Gabbi) tests
will not be listed if the auth_url is unreachable/mis-provisioned,
or if the key authorization-related variables are not provisioned
in the tempest.conf file. The API tests should be listed regardless
of whether or not the plugin can authenticate using keystone.

In the event that the plugin is not configured (or not configured
correctly), or if keystone is not reachable, this commit ensures
that Gabbi build_tests() is called to give the test listing. In
that case, it needs to provide some dummy values for host and
endpoint parameters of build_tests().

Change-Id: I3921f0df245d3745b95d3a312c41b9f9b15c2ba9
Closes-Bug: #1749218
'}, {'created': '2018-02-14 15:37:51.000000000', 'message': 'Force API test listing even if auth fails

If the heat-tempest-plugin is installed, and the command
"tempest run --list-tests" is issued, the Heat API (Gabbi) tests
will not be listed if the auth_url is unreachable/mis-provisioned,
or if the key authorization-related variables are not provisioned
in the tempest.conf file. The API tests should be listed regardless
of whether or not the plugin can authenticate using keystone.

In the event that the plugin is not configured (or not configured
correctly), or if keystone is not reachable, this commit ensures
that Gabbi build_tests() is called to give the test listing. In
that case, it needs to provide some dummy values for host and
endpoint parameters of build_tests().

Note that even while running the tests, if the authorization
information is not present or is incorrect, the user will be able
to see the warning logs with the keystoneauth exceptions present.
However, the exceptions will not prevent a test listing from being
given to the user.

Change-Id: I3921f0df245d3745b95d3a312c41b9f9b15c2ba9
Closes-Bug: #1749218

If the heat-tempest-plugin is installed, and the command
"tempest run --list-tests" is issued, the Heat API (Gabbi) tests
will not be listed if the auth_url is unreachable/mis-provisioned,
or if the key authorization-related variables are not provisioned

In the event that the plugin is not configured (or not configured
correctly), or if keystone is not reachable, this commit combined

https://github.com/cdent/gabbi/commit/01993966c179791186977e27c64b9e525a566408

ensures that Gabbi build_tests() returns the list of api tests,
even when keystone cannot be reached due to whatever reason above.

information is not present or is incorrect, the user will be able
to see the warning logs with the keystoneauth exceptions present.
However, the exceptions will not prevent a test listing from being

"tempest run --list-tests" is issued, the Heat API (Gabbi) tests
will not be listed if the auth_url is unreachable/mis-provisioned,
or if the key authorization-related variables are not provisioned

In the event that the plugin is not configured (or not configured

with the following gabbi fix:

https://github.com/cdent/gabbi/commit/8354d545471f5a2dcdff7e5c05d298b2afd8e6ae

ensures that Gabbi build_tests() returns the list of api tests,
even when keystone cannot be reached due to whatever reason above.

Note that even while running the tests, if the authorization
information is not present or is incorrect, the user will be able
to see the warning logs with the keystoneauth exceptions present.
However, the exceptions will not prevent a test listing from being
given to the user.

Change-Id: I3921f0df245d3745b95d3a312c41b9f9b15c2ba9
Closes-Bug: #1749218
'}]
commit_message:
Force API test listing even if auth fails

If the heat-tempest-plugin is installed, and the command
"tempest run --list-tests" is issued, the Heat API (Gabbi) tests
will not be listed if the auth_url is unreachable/mis-provisioned,
or if the key authorization-related variables are not provisioned
in the tempest.conf file. The API tests should be listed regardless
of whether or not the plugin can authenticate using keystone.

In the event that the plugin is not configured (or not configured
correctly), or if keystone is not reachable, this commit combined
with the following gabbi fix:

https://github.com/cdent/gabbi/commit/8354d545471f5a2dcdff7e5c05d298b2afd8e6ae

ensures that Gabbi build_tests() returns the list of api tests,
even when keystone cannot be reached due to whatever reason above.

Note that even while running the tests, if the authorization
information is not present or is incorrect, the user will be able
to see the warning logs with the keystoneauth exceptions present.
However, the exceptions will not prevent a test listing from being
given to the user.

Change-Id: I3921f0df245d3745b95d3a312c41b9f9b15c2ba9
Closes-Bug: #1749218

subject: Revert "Install SELinux packages asynchronously"
messages: [{'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-04-23 10:56:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-23 11:00:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2\n\nAgreed - async tasks don't do retries, so we should avoid using them for network tasks."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-24 21:09:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 10:56:13.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Install SELinux packages asynchronously"

This reverts commit 5085d45d7b055da55b8eedba6d682cfedd6e6a57.

Installing packages in the background doesn't seem so stable since
sometimes we observe problems like the following one:

==> centos7: TASK [lxc_hosts : Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing] *****
==> centos7: FAILED - RETRYING: Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing (30 retries left).
==> centos7: FAILED - RETRYING: Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing (29 retries left).
==> centos7: FAILED - RETRYING: Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing (28 retries left).
==> centos7: FAILED - RETRYING: Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing (27 retries left).
==> centos7: FAILED - RETRYING: Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing (26 retries left).
==> centos7: FAILED - RETRYING: Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing (25 retries left).
...
==> centos7: fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"ansible_job_id": "350629830198.20986", "attempts": 30, "changed": false, "finished": 0, "started": 1}
==> centos7:    to retry, use: --limit @/vagrant/tests/test.retry

As such, lets revert the change and install them in the normal way.

Change-Id: I6e6a890f2fa98e9874597b69e4caf2dfd78182f4
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Install SELinux packages asynchronously"

This reverts commit 5085d45d7b055da55b8eedba6d682cfedd6e6a57.

Installing packages in the background doesn't seem so stable since
sometimes we observe problems like the following one:

==> centos7: TASK [lxc_hosts : Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing] *****
==> centos7: FAILED - RETRYING: Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing (30 retries left).
==> centos7: FAILED - RETRYING: Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing (29 retries left).
==> centos7: FAILED - RETRYING: Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing (28 retries left).
==> centos7: FAILED - RETRYING: Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing (27 retries left).
==> centos7: FAILED - RETRYING: Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing (26 retries left).
==> centos7: FAILED - RETRYING: Ensure SELinux distro packages have finished installing (25 retries left).
...
==> centos7: fatal: [localhost]: FAILED! => {"ansible_job_id": "350629830198.20986", "attempts": 30, "changed": false, "finished": 0, "started": 1}
==> centos7:    to retry, use: --limit @/vagrant/tests/test.retry

As such, lets revert the change and install them in the normal way.

Change-Id: I6e6a890f2fa98e9874597b69e4caf2dfd78182f4

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

commit_message:
log_hosts should be optional

openstack_user_config.yml.example defines log_hosts as Required, where
as it is Optional

Change-Id: I4f60478c54124a5fce940470baa54dff1232a1c4
Closes-Bug: 1763058

commit_message:
Fixing UUID coerce function for unicode non uuid form

If we use non uuid unicode user id in py27 env,
unicode error pop up when function is called.

Closes-bug: #1760918

Change-Id: Ic6b6308fb1960ec40407e6efde30137b64543e72

commit_message:
Q upgrade - fixup completion messages and --help doctext

This fixes a nit in the upgrade prepare completion message and
adds missing completion messages for run and converge. I also
added missing doctext - it is useful as it is what the operator
sees with --help

Change-Id: Ia5bc8abaf2d04bd829df85d9a4b2a8a913271af8

subject: Follow the link rabbit
messages:
[{'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2017-12-09 01:36:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 2, 'date': '2017-12-09 14:13:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Marker rabbits are good, thanks! However this will result in an additional remote call on every list even when there is nothing to do. That's gonna be the thing breaking the unittests - there are going to be sequences that are attempting to make an additional call to /servers/details - which due to requests_mock is just going to return whatever the previous value was (which would fail later validation) - thus spinning forever in a loop of "can I have another?" - and the timeouts.

When this is correct, it shouldn't need to update any existing unittests, and should only need an added unit test.

The logic in list_volumes would be preferable. That is, look in the base result dict for a servers_links top-level entity. If it's there, follow the next link.

This also goes hand-in-hand with the note on the other patch, which indicates needing to shift code around between list_servers and _list_servers. If we keep pagniation in _list_servers and the cache wrapping in list_servers, the the combo SHOULD work properly (cache the results of the pagination)

Also - we'll definitely need to add a unit test that returns a servers_links to verify thise works.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2017-12-11 18:34:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Cool, will check out list_volumes, didn't know you all had code to do some of this already..."}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2017-12-11 22:31:15.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2017-12-11 22:38:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2017-12-11 22:44:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2017-12-28 23:31:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2017-12-28 23:31:51.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2017-12-29 01:32:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2017-12-29 02:36:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-01-08 12:13:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1297, 'date': '2018-04-24 20:58:29.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Follow the link rabbit

In instances of openstack with greater than the nova
default configured result listing size 'see osapi_max_limit'
we have to actually perform some basic level of pagination
to get all the servers.

We have one cloud with 10000+ vms, and trying to list them
all isn't possible with shade currently (it always returns
1000).

This is a potential way of working through this and getting
all the servers back (by following next links).

Change-Id: I7301b6f7478b037bc88b0f5513232c47cc3b72a7

commit_message:
move n8g-odl and n8g-bagpipe as test requirements

These dependencies are optional dependencies for running
networking-bgpvpn, and real dependency for unit tests
only.

Change-Id: Ib1f06138a86b5a1cedc175477e0962bf9c05ad5d

[{'created': '2018-04-19 14:53:18.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for PXC 5.7 and xtrabackup 2.4

Bionic will ship with Percona XtraDB Cluster 5.7 and a newer
version of Percona XtraBackup; the majority of charm changes
are associated with the use of native mysql{@} units for
bootstrap and startup of mysqld.

Co-Authored-By: James Page <james.page@ubuntu.com>
Change-Id: I50c5642e11393da3bc03de0ef0b9af4c32e9a0c9
(cherry picked from commit 7d835b8674c6271f134b9a5228d904d558bad428)
'}]
commit_message:
Add support for PXC 5.7 and xtrabackup 2.4

Bionic will ship with Percona XtraDB Cluster 5.7 and a newer
version of Percona XtraBackup; the majority of charm changes
are associated with the use of native mysql{@} units for
bootstrap and startup of mysqld.

Co-Authored-By: James Page <james.page@ubuntu.com>
Change-Id: I50c5642e11393da3bc03de0ef0b9af4c32e9a0c9
(cherry picked from commit 7d835b8674c6271f134b9a5228d904d558bad428)

commit_message:
Overhaul HealthManager update threading

* Switch to ProcessPool from ThreadPool (Python threads are horrible)
* Load the health/stats update drivers correctly with stevedore
* Add logging driver

Change-Id: Icda4ff218a6bbaea252c2d75c073754f4161a597
(cherry picked from commit f9dafb9a7a521783f8dfb9df6cdcfa0368be5bc5)

'}, {'created': '2018-03-18 04:32:32.000000000', 'message': 'BIOS Settings: Add RPC object

Add BIOS Objects to expose DB operations to API:

* BIOSSetting
  + create
  + save
  + get

* BIOSSettingList
  + create
  + save

commit_message:
BIOS Settings: Add RPC object

Add BIOS Objects to expose DB operations to API:

* BIOSSetting
  + create
  + save
  + get
  + delete

* BIOSSettingList
  + create
  + save
  + get_by_node_id

This patch also adds BIOSSetting and BIOSSettingList
in expected_object_fingerprints.

Co-Authored-By: Yolanda Robla Mota <yroblamo@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I4901dd4ce018b84c92f4f58ef29a7fbc79851a25
Story: #1712032
