revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-13 07:42:24.000000000', 'message': 'Cap haproxy log level severity

With current haproxy config, emerg logs are sent to syslog when there
are no backends available. Emerg logs on most syslog setups are sent
via wall to all users.

This is rarely a wanted behavior. And it might happen quite often
at the configuration phase.

Cap logs to `alert` level. This converts `emerg` logs to `alert`,
which by default are logged to files, and prevents wall-like messages.

This fix is also suggested by haproxy docs:

https://cbonte.github.io/haproxy-dconv/1.7/configuration.html#4.2-log

Change-Id: I4c5ede6d3ef2479fb123dbb6706a7d5090b6e5ec
Closes-Bug: 1362213
'}, {'created': '2018-04-15 12:57:50.000000000', 'message': 'Cap haproxy log level severity

With current haproxy config, emerg logs are sent to syslog when there
are no backends available. Emerg logs on most syslog setups are sent
via wall to all users.

This is rarely a wanted behavior. And it might happen quite often
at the configuration phase.

Cap logs to `alert` level. This converts `emerg` logs to `alert`,
which by default are logged to files, and prevents wall-like messages.

This fix is also suggested by haproxy docs:

https://cbonte.github.io/haproxy-dconv/1.7/configuration.html#4.2-log

Closes-Bug: 1362213

Change-Id: I4c5ede6d3ef2479fb123dbb6706a7d5090b6e5ec
(cherry picked from commit 40dd211f269124bad1970daa5609d109a9c2b66b)
'}]
commit_message:
Cap haproxy log level severity

With current haproxy config, emerg logs are sent to syslog when there
are no backends available. Emerg logs on most syslog setups are sent
via wall to all users.

This is rarely a wanted behavior. And it might happen quite often
at the configuration phase.

Cap logs to `alert` level. This converts `emerg` logs to `alert`,
which by default are logged to files, and prevents wall-like messages.

This fix is also suggested by haproxy docs:

https://cbonte.github.io/haproxy-dconv/1.7/configuration.html#4.2-log

Closes-Bug: 1362213

Change-Id: I4c5ede6d3ef2479fb123dbb6706a7d5090b6e5ec
(cherry picked from commit 40dd211f269124bad1970daa5609d109a9c2b66b)

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Remove enabling of epel on ubuntu periodic kolla jobs, as it isn't
needed.

Change-Id: Iecb7729214401e058f75620904adbc3a2a0333f8
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

The 2.61 microversion relies on this policy rule to determine
if extra specs should be included directly in responses for
the flavor resource directly, specifically showing flavor details,

commit_message:
Update os_compute_api:os-flavor-extra-specs:index docs for 2.61

The 2.61 microversion relies on this policy rule to determine
if extra specs should be included directly in responses for
the flavor resource directly, specifically showing flavor details,
updating the description of a flavor, and creating a new flavor.

Change-Id: I8d8bc5c74f9eb9a4c36418d36990cf6db78af061
Closes-Bug: #1763741

subject: Optimize final workflow context evaluation with a batch request
messages: [{'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-04-24 09:03:58.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-04-24 09:59:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-04-24 10:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-24 09:03:58.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize final workflow context evaluation with a batch request

* Evaluation of the final workflow context was an extremely
  memory expensive operation in case if we had a lot of task
  executions (which are last in their branches) to process
  and their inbound context were big (at least a few MB each).
  Mistral had to fetch the entire collection of completed
  tasks in order to do all required processing.
  This patch addresses this problem by using a batch query
  approach in conjunction with python generators that allow
  GC to destroy bathes of task executions that have already
  been processed.
  According to the tests (based on test_big_on_closures in
  test_direct_workflow.py module) memory footprint is reduced
  by 3 times (from 1.5 GB to 0.5 GB when the number of tasks is
  500 and each inbound context has 40000 entries) whereas the
  total test run time increased only by ~1%.

(cherry picked from commit 62d1003ee0b78eb610dac1632d303e51f8c3932f)

Change-Id: Ibee00718522e0fad977dbea335cec66956c752f2
'}, {'created': '2018-04-24 09:59:46.000000000', 'message': 'Optimize final workflow context evaluation with a batch request

* Evaluation of the final workflow context was an extremely
  memory expensive operation in case if we had a lot of task
  executions (which are last in their branches) to process
  and their inbound context were big (at least a few MB each).
  Mistral had to fetch the entire collection of completed
  tasks in order to do all required processing.
  This patch addresses this problem by using a batch query
  approach in conjunction with python generators that allow
  GC to destroy bathes of task executions that have already
  been processed.
  According to the tests (based on test_big_on_closures in
  test_direct_workflow.py module) memory footprint is reduced
  by 3 times (from 1.5 GB to 0.5 GB when the number of tasks is
  500 and each inbound context has 40000 entries) whereas the
  total test run time increased only by ~1%.

(cherry picked from commit 62d1003ee0b78eb610dac1632d303e51f8c3932f)

Change-Id: Ibee00718522e0fad977dbea335cec66956c752f2
'}]
commit_message:
Optimize final workflow context evaluation with a batch request

* Evaluation of the final workflow context was an extremely
  memory expensive operation in case if we had a lot of task
  executions (which are last in their branches) to process
  and their inbound context were big (at least a few MB each).
  Mistral had to fetch the entire collection of completed
  tasks in order to do all required processing.
  This patch addresses this problem by using a batch query
  approach in conjunction with python generators that allow
  GC to destroy bathes of task executions that have already
  been processed.
  According to the tests (based on test_big_on_closures in
  test_direct_workflow.py module) memory footprint is reduced
  by 3 times (from 1.5 GB to 0.5 GB when the number of tasks is
  500 and each inbound context has 40000 entries) whereas the
  total test run time increased only by ~1%.

(cherry picked from commit 62d1003ee0b78eb610dac1632d303e51f8c3932f)

Change-Id: Ibee00718522e0fad977dbea335cec66956c752f2

commit_message:
Add '__task_execution' structure to task execution context on the fly

* Previously we stored the data structure describing the current
  task execution (id and name) in the inbound task execution context
  directly so that it'd be saved to DB. This was needed to evaluate
  YAQL/Jinja function task() without parameters properly. However,
  it's not needed, we can just build a context view on the fly
  just before evaluating an expression.

Closes-Bug: #1764704
(cherry picked from commit 6b7b58ed6c9dcad1a4db07586ea299bf01661523)

Change-Id: I9ea71cdc169c0c6f537429c75b5f1bd4079b87bf

commit_message:
Replace virtualenv-tools with a script

virtualenv-tools has a bug which gets triggered in gates: it can't
change the shebang of a virtualenv python bin/ files if they
were generated with a virtualenv script whose shebang ends with
python2 instead of python.

Because we can't modify virtualenv-tools, we use shell scripts
instead.

Change-Id: I62ae0b1f406f102fcb184913c5a6de54bb84c4c2
Partial-Bug: #1741634
Partial-Bug: #1764470

subject: Don't include trust IDs in Alarm action output
messages: [{'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-04-24 16:17:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 2813, 'date': '2018-04-24 16:53:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2018-04-24 17:46:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-24 16:17:41.000000000', 'message': "Don't include trust IDs in Alarm action output

It was originally envisaged that we would allow users to specify trust
IDs in trust+*:// alarm action URLs, and only create trusts internally
when none was specified. This made storage of trust IDs in the username
field of the URL part of the API interface, and it made sense that the
user would have access to the IDs both for trusts they had created
themselves and those created internally.

However, this proved to be a security hole that was closed by
cb90d3ad472bba8d648803ca94a9196dff97f0e8, and now we forbid users from
passing in a trust ID. Any trust IDs that appear in the URL were created
internally.

This causes issues when updating alarms because aodhclient uses a
read-modify-write pattern to do so. The action URLs output from a GET
may contain trust IDs, while the input to a PUT is forbidden from
containing them. This means the data is not round-trippable, so updates
even to unrelated fields fail.

Since storage of the trust ID in action URLs is purely an internal
implementation detail at this point, scrub it out of data returned by
the REST API. This means the output of e.g. a GET will match the
original input data, as the user probably expects, and can be fed back
into a PUT successfully.

Change-Id: I230c0d80a9440c7d002b9a623048ef715a9df743
Closes-Bug: #1737186
Related-Bug: #1649333
(cherry picked from commit 92182de328d1f088c5f5a68326d2b207b21e06ea)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't include trust IDs in Alarm action output

It was originally envisaged that we would allow users to specify trust
IDs in trust+*:// alarm action URLs, and only create trusts internally
when none was specified. This made storage of trust IDs in the username
field of the URL part of the API interface, and it made sense that the
user would have access to the IDs both for trusts they had created
themselves and those created internally.

However, this proved to be a security hole that was closed by
cb90d3ad472bba8d648803ca94a9196dff97f0e8, and now we forbid users from
passing in a trust ID. Any trust IDs that appear in the URL were created
internally.

This causes issues when updating alarms because aodhclient uses a
read-modify-write pattern to do so. The action URLs output from a GET
may contain trust IDs, while the input to a PUT is forbidden from
containing them. This means the data is not round-trippable, so updates
even to unrelated fields fail.

Since storage of the trust ID in action URLs is purely an internal
implementation detail at this point, scrub it out of data returned by
the REST API. This means the output of e.g. a GET will match the
original input data, as the user probably expects, and can be fed back
into a PUT successfully.

Change-Id: I230c0d80a9440c7d002b9a623048ef715a9df743
Closes-Bug: #1737186
Related-Bug: #1649333
(cherry picked from commit 92182de328d1f088c5f5a68326d2b207b21e06ea)

[{'created': '2018-04-13 01:57:17.000000000', 'message': 'Check for PXE-enabled ports when creating neutron ports

The function "add_ports_to_network" will create neutron ports for each
PXE-enabled port on task.node to boot the ramdisk. But there is no
check to see if there are any PXE-enabled ports. If there aren't, no
neutron ports will be created and things will fail further down the
pipeline. To fail sooner with an appropriate message, we raise an
exception if there are no PXE-enabled ports for the node.

commit_message:
Check for PXE-enabled ports when creating neutron ports

The function "add_ports_to_network" will create neutron ports for each
PXE-enabled port on task.node to boot the ramdisk. But there is no
check to see if there are any PXE-enabled ports. If there aren't, no
neutron ports will be created and things will fail further down the
pipeline. To fail sooner with an appropriate message, we raise an
exception if there are no PXE-enabled ports for the node.

Story: 2001811
Task: 12546
Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <rloo@oath.com>
Change-Id: I96c21e7d842ad929161a0d298a342fdf4a1275e2
(cherry picked from commit 804349e9be514bc3f0f76f9a2acb48ef7fed3023)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 07:57:01.000000000', 'message': '[RBAC] Fix setting network as not shared

In case when network was shared with specified project
by RBAC rule and it was also set as "shared" there was
a bug which forbid to set such network as not shared even
if only projects which still used network was owner and
project with specified RBAC rule.

This patch fixes it by adding additional check in
NeutronDbPluginV2._validate_shared_update() in such case.

Change-Id: I6ab05a8f0ece454f5bef8ba978af05f5fa1354d8
Closes-Bug: #1764330
(cherry picked from commit 7aa941cc09aef8efe54f5bac111248d296e9c8ef)
'}]
commit_message:
[RBAC] Fix setting network as not shared

In case when network was shared with specified project
by RBAC rule and it was also set as "shared" there was
a bug which forbid to set such network as not shared even
if only projects which still used network was owner and
project with specified RBAC rule.

This patch fixes it by adding additional check in
NeutronDbPluginV2._validate_shared_update() in such case.

Change-Id: I6ab05a8f0ece454f5bef8ba978af05f5fa1354d8
Closes-Bug: #1764330
(cherry picked from commit 7aa941cc09aef8efe54f5bac111248d296e9c8ef)

Limit Galera SSL to TLSv1.2 ciphers

When 'galera_use_ssl' is enabled, only allow TLSv1.2 supported cipher
suites.

Change-Id: Ifd2686ce64a92614b1dac5b8a5819461bf6d9d90

commit_message:
[DNM] MariaDB: use 'unsafe defaults' to ease slow builders

  *** ENABLES EXPERIMENT GATES TO SEE IF THIS HELPS HERE ***

Try to use asynchronous IO where possible to improve performance.

This patch is *not* suitable for merging as-is because whilst this
change is fine for development/testing it would negatively affect
production.

Also a small tweak to avoid DNS weirdness in some cases.

Change-Id: Ibb150fe38ee0343dd99e2ccb68a2d98da01c940f

subject: Release Cinder Queens 12.0.1
messages:
[{'account_id': 4523, 'date': '2018-04-10 15:51:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-10 16:04:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 17130, 'date': '2018-04-11 06:10:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7198, 'date': '2018-04-11 18:54:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

We have backported quite a bit.  Makes sense to do a release.'}, {'account_id': 21561, 'date': '2018-04-13 18:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-18 10:33:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Two things stand out as potential "features":
- 3PAR: Add `force detach` support
- Allow configuring tpool size

So I wouldn't mind waiting for the stable maint team review on this one...'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-18 10:40:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I can comment on the two patches.

For the 3PAR one, that is poorly worded. It wasn't well documented for driver maintainers that the expected driver behavior for detach was to remove all detachments when no connector was passed in. So this is a bug fix for that driver where they would error out assuming the connector would always be provided when in fact it could sometime be None.

The configuring tpool size one addresses a bug with a change to eventlet threading in the backup service. This was originally using the default thread pool size of 20. It was found for RBD and possibly other backup drivers, this was too restrictive a size due to the way they proxy calls."}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-04-18 12:11:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

LGTM then, still waiting a couple more days for stable team review'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-23 16:52:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Will give one more day for the stable team to review.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-04-24 17:59:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1

Waited past designated stable Monday review day.'}]

for collectd.

commit_message:
Fix newline stripping in upgrade template.

Too much new lines are stipped when scripts for OC upgrade
 are generated. This results in non-functional scripts, e.g.:
--playbook upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml 2>&1echo "Runing major upgrade ...

Change-Id: Iaf70649f5f9c6dec7b97badf6fce5b047a9bb6c2
(cherry picked from commit cf86a8e053d1a5a6d1e3ffbccf8bed9032385306)

commit_message:
Fix ansible config download dir

With the merging of Ie00f71b12f56262985c47810be0e80402e9e558e we lost
the tempfile creation as part of config download. So we need to handle
the directory creation for the undercloud config download bits.

Depends-On: I0cf206e8ceeecfca17dd99a83b8c2eaa50e66712
Change-Id: Ib11ea3b166111cb5bfba8bc4ecbbdd65c646fb4d
Closes-Bug: #1765843

commit_message:
Allow uploading big files to swift (5GB)

This patch enables the swift upload for big files (+5GB)
in TripleO.
Also, adds support to the undercloud backup CLI to upload
big backups to swift.

Change-Id: I80163c8df15377dd3b5a44b5439a23223d8cccee
Depends-On: Iff73833f1d470750862873f70a4a9aaba50bd164
Closes-Bug: 1761412

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-18 09:11:01.000000000', 'message': "Fixing tempest containerized script

Run tempest containerized creates a script, that requires the
public_net_id set inside the script, before it was being set in the
cleanup-network script, which doesn't export properly the variable,
causing error.
Also, since docker run as root, the  tempest_container.sh creates the
tempest files as root, so we need to use sudo to cleanup the

commit_message:
Fixing tempest containerized script

Run tempest containerized creates a script, that requires the
public_net_id set inside the script, before it was being set in the
cleanup-network script, which doesn't export properly the variable,
causing error.
Also, since docker run as root, the  tempest_container.sh creates the
tempest files as root, so we need to use sudo to cleanup the
directories.

Change-Id: Ie5723df5e791dbe9572b7d3e5b7b71506563d11c

commit_message:
only increment disk address unit for scsi devices

We were erroneously incrementing the disk address unit attribute for
non-scsi devices, which resulted in inconsistent disk device naming and
addresses when SCSI devices were used along with non-SCSI devices (like
configdrive devices).

Also, we ensure that we assign unit number 0 for the boot volume of a
boot-from-volume instance.

Co-authored-by: Mehdi Abaakouk <sileht@sileht.net>
Closes-bug: #1729584
Closes-bug: #1753394

Change-Id: Ia91e2f9c316e25394a0f41dc341d903dfcff6921
(cherry picked from commit 2616b384e642b6eb58eef7da87b6e893f25a949e)
(cherry picked from commit f9c66434eea245ae05a449059391515376f5a456)
(cherry picked from commit b255e16bd93d9891caff8ffc84b8d7bc2991f90a)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 22:23:03.000000000', 'message': "Don't persist RequestSpec.retry

During a resize, the RequestSpec.flavor is updated
to the new flavor. If the resize failed on one host
and was rescheduled, the RequestSpec.retry is updated
for that failed host and mistakenly persisted, which
can affect later move operations, like if an admin
targets one of those previously failed hosts for a
live migration or evacuate operation.

This change fixes the problem by not ever persisting
the RequestSpec.retry field to the database, since
retries are per-request/operation and not something
that needs to be persisted.

Alternative to this, we could reset the retry field
in the RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method
but that would be slightly overloading the meaning
of that method, and the approach taken in this patch
is arguably cleaner since retries shouldn't ever be
persisted. It should be noted, however, that one
advantage to resetting the 'retry' field in the
RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method would
be to avoid this issue for any existing DB entries
that have this problem.

The related functional regression test is updated
to show the bug is now fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): This patch has to pull some changes
from two other patches to make live migration work
in the fake virt driver: ce893e37f and b97c433f7.

Change-Id: Iadbf8ec935565a6d4ccf6f36ef630ab6bf1bea5d
Closes-Bug: #1718512
(cherry picked from commit 6647f11dc1aba89f9b0e2703f236a43f31d88079)
(cherry picked from commit 8fb1c25fa9df4fd7515f8ed3c4b02eabed00838f)
(cherry picked from commit b585ca48b986776caef7a5db8e207bbdd748233e)

Alternative to this, we could reset the retry field
in the RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method
but that would be slightly overloading the meaning
of that method, and the approach taken in this patch
is arguably cleaner since retries shouldn't ever be
persisted. It should be noted, however, that one
advantage to resetting the 'retry' field in the
RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method would
be to avoid this issue for any existing DB entries
that have this problem.

The related functional regression test is updated
to show the bug is now fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): This backport also includes change
I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892 squashed
into it in order to not re-introduce that bug. On
Ocata it must be adjusted slightly to pass a string
rather than list to _wait_for_migration_status
since I752617066bb2167b49239ab9d17b0c89754a3e12 is
not in Ocata.

NOTE(mriedem): This patch has to pull some changes
from two other patches to make live migration work
in the fake virt driver: ce893e37f and b97c433f7.

Change-Id: Iadbf8ec935565a6d4ccf6f36ef630ab6bf1bea5d
Closes-Bug: #1718512
(cherry picked from commit 6647f11dc1aba89f9b0e2703f236a43f31d88079)
(cherry picked from commit 757dbd17cf37aecea005dfdc954bf50bbddedd95)
(cherry picked from commit 878e99d1f82fbeec840b2dbab8e40c27127d88ba)

commit_message:
Don't persist RequestSpec.retry

During a resize, the RequestSpec.flavor is updated
to the new flavor. If the resize failed on one host
and was rescheduled, the RequestSpec.retry is updated
for that failed host and mistakenly persisted, which
can affect later move operations, like if an admin
targets one of those previously failed hosts for a
live migration or evacuate operation.

This change fixes the problem by not ever persisting
the RequestSpec.retry field to the database, since
retries are per-request/operation and not something
that needs to be persisted.

Alternative to this, we could reset the retry field
in the RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method
but that would be slightly overloading the meaning
of that method, and the approach taken in this patch
is arguably cleaner since retries shouldn't ever be
persisted. It should be noted, however, that one
advantage to resetting the 'retry' field in the
RequestSpec.reset_forced_destinations method would
be to avoid this issue for any existing DB entries
that have this problem.

The related functional regression test is updated
to show the bug is now fixed.

NOTE(mriedem): This backport also includes change
I61f745667f4c003d7e3ca6f2f9a99194930ac892 squashed
into it in order to not re-introduce that bug. On
Ocata it must be adjusted slightly to pass a string
rather than list to _wait_for_migration_status
since I752617066bb2167b49239ab9d17b0c89754a3e12 is
not in Ocata.

NOTE(mriedem): This patch has to pull some changes
from two other patches to make live migration work
in the fake virt driver: ce893e37f and b97c433f7.

Change-Id: Iadbf8ec935565a6d4ccf6f36ef630ab6bf1bea5d
Closes-Bug: #1718512
(cherry picked from commit 6647f11dc1aba89f9b0e2703f236a43f31d88079)
(cherry picked from commit 757dbd17cf37aecea005dfdc954bf50bbddedd95)
(cherry picked from commit 878e99d1f82fbeec840b2dbab8e40c27127d88ba)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-10 21:41:25.000000000', 'message': "Add regression test for persisted RequestSpec.retry from failed resize

Commit 74ab427d4796d8a386f84a15cc49188c2a60f8f1 in Newton added
code to persist changes to the RequestSpec during a resize since
the flavor changes.

That change inadvertantly also persisted any failed hosts during
the resize that are stored in the RequestSpec.retry field during
a reschedule.

The problem is that later those persisted failed hosts are rejected
by the RetryFilter, which can be confusing if an admin is trying
to live migrate or evacate the instance to one of those specific
hosts.

This adds a functional regression test to show the failure, which
will be fixed in a separate change that then modifies the assertions.

NOTE(mriedem): There are two changes in this backport:

1. The functional test needed to change slightly to disable the
   DiskFilter since 2fe96819c24eff5a9493a6559f3e8d5b4624a8c9 is
   not in Ocata.

2. The test needs to use 'api_post' directly on the API client for
   the confirmResize call since the check_response_status kwarg
   wasn't in post_server_action until 8dd11ca1b34e1ed58b4 in Pike.

Change-Id: Ib8a23db838b0bbf2cfb8123cf6aaa39d00ff0640
Related-Bug: #1718512
(cherry picked from commit 89448bea577b30c40ce39185d14fe14f9c61a0c2)
(cherry picked from commit c2dc902e39eb345ebf674ad47422f1e72ec170e6)
(cherry picked from commit 004e9acf99964ac78f85d3efbd0a04404bd9a3ef)
"}]
commit_message:
Add regression test for persisted RequestSpec.retry from failed resize

Commit 74ab427d4796d8a386f84a15cc49188c2a60f8f1 in Newton added
code to persist changes to the RequestSpec during a resize since
the flavor changes.

That change inadvertantly also persisted any failed hosts during
the resize that are stored in the RequestSpec.retry field during
a reschedule.

The problem is that later those persisted failed hosts are rejected
by the RetryFilter, which can be confusing if an admin is trying
to live migrate or evacate the instance to one of those specific
hosts.

This adds a functional regression test to show the failure, which
will be fixed in a separate change that then modifies the assertions.

NOTE(mriedem): There are two changes in this backport:

1. The functional test needed to change slightly to disable the
   DiskFilter since 2fe96819c24eff5a9493a6559f3e8d5b4624a8c9 is
   not in Ocata.

2. The test needs to use 'api_post' directly on the API client for
   the confirmResize call since the check_response_status kwarg
   wasn't in post_server_action until 8dd11ca1b34e1ed58b4 in Pike.

Change-Id: Ib8a23db838b0bbf2cfb8123cf6aaa39d00ff0640
Related-Bug: #1718512
(cherry picked from commit 89448bea577b30c40ce39185d14fe14f9c61a0c2)
(cherry picked from commit c2dc902e39eb345ebf674ad47422f1e72ec170e6)
(cherry picked from commit 004e9acf99964ac78f85d3efbd0a04404bd9a3ef)

commit_message:
Telemetry services need to access to Storage

Gnocchi stores data in Swift or Ceph. So when composable roles are used
it needs to access to the Storage network to connect to them.

Closes-bug: #1766507
Change-Id: I11f4ec4a91a9240bde6d504a84351185ed5a6997
(cherry picked from commit 39f5b64394310e19720021785a26e302b926eded)

commit_message:
Telemetry services need to access to Storage

Gnocchi stores data in Swift or Ceph. So when composable roles are used
it needs to access to the Storage network to connect to them.

Closes-bug: #1766507

Change-Id: I11f4ec4a91a9240bde6d504a84351185ed5a6997
(cherry picked from commit 39f5b64394310e19720021785a26e302b926eded)

commit_message:
Correct branch used in tripleo-upgrade installation.

STABLE_BRANCH variable omits the 'stable/'
section of the branch name. However, the
tripleo-upgrade role is branched out using
that structure. So when installing the
oooq requirements it will try to download
queens or pike branch, which won't be found.
It should be stable/pike or stable/queens
instead.

Change-Id: I93fe1d3a285a2d9ec40c4245ea012a66e6584a30

commit_message:
undercloud: workaround for containers

Until https://review.rdoproject.org/r/#/c/13508/ is merged,
we need to manually update openstack-heat-agents before running the
undercloud upgrade when containerizing it.
This is technical debt and it'll be reverted.

Change-Id: I052dfbb95ffaca953d0749eb8a9ecfadcafd3002

commit_message:
Bump Ceph container image from 3.0.1 to 3.0.3

Ceph contaimer image version 3.0.3 added support for RHEL. This change
bumps the version we're testing in CI (CentOS) from 3.0.1 to 3.0.3.

The new image was tested via I7e50d1c0d9483cc1462ec13b430ff16f9f4adb2c

Change-Id: I1ffb9e058ab1dbab8718a75ce1bc015633c69327
(cherry picked from commit 2bdd048c6c395707eeca429e1ab641decff2664c)

[{'created': '2018-04-23 15:32:16.000000000', 'message': 'Fix openstack-nova-consoleauth service upgrade check

When running the FFU workflow the openstack-nova-consoleauth
service gets stopped before running the upgrade tasks so the
task for disabling the service is ignored. This change fixes
the nova_consoleauth_enabled command to check if the service
is enabled instead of active.

Change-Id: If1e0f43c1962496b68c1c982db86a6dec58e05c5
Closes-bug: 1765997
(cherry picked from commit b1d0ed091076f33bec7cbbeb32dbe27fcda417db)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix openstack-nova-consoleauth service upgrade check

When running the FFU workflow the openstack-nova-consoleauth
service gets stopped before running the upgrade tasks so the
task for disabling the service is ignored. This change fixes
the nova_consoleauth_enabled command to check if the service
is enabled instead of active.

Change-Id: If1e0f43c1962496b68c1c982db86a6dec58e05c5
Closes-bug: 1765997
(cherry picked from commit b1d0ed091076f33bec7cbbeb32dbe27fcda417db)

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: Idd9ea75ad31d46093e85a05619fe33c85f4c9ed9
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

(6 comments)

The release note is wrong, and this isn't cleaning up tokens for evacuate, resize/cold migrate, or shelve offload where the host changes. I guess in the case of evacuate where we rebuild on a new dest host, you'd have to remove the tokens using the migration object to tell what the original source host was, and there is also a cleanup routine for evacuated instance if a source host comes back up after instances were evacuated off of it, and you'd probably want to cleanup there as well.

This is also talking about the database backend config, which isn't yet available in this patch."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-01-04 19:43:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 18:

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-06-03 15:57:24.000000000', 'message': 'Add periodic task to clean expired console tokens

Console auth tokens and related connection information
will be stored in the database. Each compute manager will
be responsible for cleaning up expired tokens related
to instances it manages.

This patch adds a periodic task to the compute manager
to do the cleanup. Later patches in this series will
add the code to put console auth tokens in the database.

Change-Id: I66762703709340a2f5c68dcd6802993c9a68c263
partially-implements: blueprint convert-consoles-to-objects
'}, {'created': '2016-06-03 16:56:44.000000000', 'message': 'Add periodic task to clean expired console tokens

Console auth tokens and related connection information
will be stored in the database. Each compute manager will
be responsible for cleaning up expired tokens related
to instances it manages as well as cleaning up when
instances are deleted or moved.

This patch adds a periodic task to the compute manager
to cleanup expired tokens. It also adds token cleanup
for instances when deleted or migrated.

Later patches in this series will add the code to put
console auth tokens in the database.

The consoleauth server will be deprecated. During the
deprecation period tokens will be stored in both the
consoleauth server and the databaes but console
proxies will chose which to use for authorization.

Change-Id: I66762703709340a2f5c68dcd6802993c9a68c263
partially-implements: blueprint convert-consoles-to-objects

commit_message:
Add periodic task to clean expired console tokens

Console auth tokens and related connection information will be stored
in the database. Each compute manager will be responsible for cleaning
up expired tokens related to instances it manages as well as cleaning
up when instances are deleted or moved.

This patch adds a periodic task to the compute manager to cleanup
expired tokens. It also adds token cleanup for instances when they are
deleted or live migrated. TODOs have been added to add token cleanup
for other move operations such as resize, evacuate, and shelve offload.
They are not changed as part of this patch series because for now, we
are keeping parity with existing behavior. Changing the behavior will
be a separate future patch.

Later patches in this series will add the code to put console auth
tokens in the database.

The consoleauth server will be deprecated. During the deprecation
period tokens will be stored in both the consoleauth server and the
databaes but console proxies will chose which to use for authorization.

partially-implements: blueprint convert-consoles-to-objects

Change-Id: I66762703709340a2f5c68dcd6802993c9a68c263

[1], update puppet-openstack-integration for the same.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558436/

Fixed a bad doc reference.
Added sudo help and setup
Added ssh key help
Couple other minor nits.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 05:43:02.000000000', 'message': 'Excise deprecated or removed LDAP options

Some of the LDAP configurations were deprecated in N- or O-release
have been since removed, namely the option to allow for write operations
in LDAP.  This is causing some issue with more recent releases of
keystone as discovered in [0]. This patch set removes them from the

commit_message:
Excise deprecated or removed LDAP options

Some of the LDAP configurations were deprecated in N- or O-release have
been since removed, namely the option to allow for write operations in
LDAP.  This is causing some issue with more recent releases of keystone
as discovered in [0]. This patch set removes them from the example to
avoid the errors for more recent releases without impacting N- or
O-releases as they were already deprecated at that point.

Also, this adds in a configuration sample that bootstraps an LDAP
domain by default.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/561751/

Change-Id: Ie8f23cd61dad1860a41422264945c169f0488729
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
bionic: ensure crmsh package is installed

pacemaker no longer Recommends crmsh so explicitly install it
for all Ubuntu series as its required for charm operation.

Note(coreycb): This cherry-pick is split into two commits. Bionic
amulet test enablement can't land until charm-percona-cluster
bionic support lands, and charm-percona-cluster bionic support
can't land until this crmsh commit lands.

Change-Id: I06e0dcfec0a787f85655c89bf36e18253c75de2e
(cherry picked from commit 6fc85dc5a2058297a2d706fd204347e2112f18cb)

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: I3ca7975f233ea9a564778446c9e34aea615df56f
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Amphora agent should recognise Oracle Linux
messages:
[{'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-03-01 01:09:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-03-01 10:38:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I have yet to actually test this (and I actually can't at the moment since diskimage-create script is yet to be updated for this).

This is missing the following:
1. Tests, update: 
   - octavia/tests/functional/amphorae/backend/agent/api_server/test_server.py
   - octavia/tests/unit/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/test_osutils.py
   - octavia/tests/unit/amphorae/backends/agent/api_server/test_plug.py
2. update dib-elements for support this distro
3. update diskimage-create.sh"}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-03-01 17:57:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is it really necessary to update DIB to get this simple change through? That would be a lot more work - probably more than I'm willing to take on. I made my image semi-manually, basically following the steps that diskimage-create.sh does. I used the RDO openstack-octavia-amphora-agent package. I had to hack that one-line change in to make the agent work. It seemed like a very simple thing to fix.

I took a quick look at the existing tests. Only one of those three files mentions "fedora". I can add "oracle" to that one.

This proposal doesn't change any functionality, and clearly isn't going to affect anyone not running Oracle Linux.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-03-06 00:05:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

I think we would want that if we start adding things for a distro to these files. It's actually easier than you'd think -- you just need to add the appropriate things to the elements in pkg-install and some of the pre/post scripts. do a grep for like "ubuntu' or "centos7" to see which files would maybe need some oracle stuff.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-03-12 16:32:59.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

Eh, I'm starting to think maybe if Oracle is really just a RHEL based distro with a bit of custom dust on top, then probably this is fine. It is a remarkably non-trivial task to make a brand new base element for an OS, as it turns out. :/"}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-03-12 18:43:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-03-13 12:45:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-03-14 16:57:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-03-14 23:21:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-03-18 08:32:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

They way I see it, this makes things incomplete for this distribution and can look misleading to newcomers. The patch commit msg suggests that Oracle Linux is supported, but operators will have to manually hack their way to use it (as opposed to the other distributions)

All other supported distributions have the list of things I mentioned in my comment to PS#1 (such as dib-elements and diskimage-create.sh support) so I don't see why this one should be any different.

I added Michel to hear his opinion on this. Perhaps a release note would do here."}, {'account_id': 6579, 'date': '2018-03-18 08:33:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

s/They/The'}, {'account_id': 10273, 'date': '2018-03-19 15:30:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

Yeah I'm really not sure. I do feel like you're right, that if we can't build it with DIB, it's kinda weird to include stuff for it... But, I also do feel like the work necessary to get the image stuff working with an Oracle image could be a little ridiculous.
Actually, my curiosity is about whether DIB could build the Oracle amp if we just told it to build RHEL and overrode the base image that it uses (which is possible to do with an ENV variable, I believe). If that works, then maybe that would be easy to formalize inside our create-diskimage script? Just take in `oracle` and set the necessary vars and pretend to be RHEL after that?"}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-03-19 15:52:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I was under the impression that DIB was *one convenient way* to make an amphora image. I didn't know it was *the only way*. I thought that this would be a simple one line - nay, one *word* - code-change that wouldn't impact anyone else, so it'd be really simple. I was wrong."}, {'account_id': 23561, 'date': '2018-04-24 16:51:07.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Molehill got made into a mountain'}]

commit_message:
Fix Cinder's default db purge cron settings

Change the CinderCronDbPurgeAge default value to 30 so that it matches
the default value in puppet-cinder.

Closes-Bug: #1761749
Change-Id: I00e1b257067bb4bff955f65ca8256092470a5cdc
(cherry picked from commit d3bbadd012b33f937c1cc8155c13553f28614187)

commit_message:
Increase timeout for rake job

The default of 30 minutes does lead to timeouts on some smaller nodes and
larger cookbooks.

Change-Id: I2db0b355f666fe5fb61bce3788255ddc1e7a6f3f

commit_message:
Refactor libvirtd.conf creation

Replace the hardcoded bloated template with a variant of our standard
template that only includes the values that are really needed.

This will allow deployments to override the default values and for
example deploy libvirtd with TLS authentication according to [0].

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/OSSN/OSSN-0007

Change-Id: Ib7b305670f525bbf975ec33ed070e2d960347ef4
(cherry picked from commit ad3d1c3c652a2cbaa7aa6dd8d8cff347095c5909)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-24 10:55:42.000000000', 'message': 'cleanup attribute leftovers that are not used anymore

* removed all unused attributes
* removed vmware specific configuration option that can be set in a
wrapper cookbook (and was not maintained for quite some time)
* removed caseswitch for nova user and group since we currently only
support debian and rhel
* moved all libvirtd related config options to specific attribute file
in preparation for further refactoring

commit_message:
cleanup attribute leftovers that are not used anymore

* removed all unused attributes
* removed vmware specific configuration option that can be set in a
wrapper cookbook (and was not maintained for quite some time)
* removed caseswitch for nova user and group since we currently only
support debian and rhel
* moved all libvirtd related config options to specific attribute file
in preparation for further refactoring

Change-Id: I42a0bbcd03a570b9d6d24ba32ed2cafacc33ec76
(cherry picked from commit ad88dc2a782b648cac1ace2806222d781c0bce85)

commit_message:
fix docs/links for 1.14.0 release

This patch addresses the following issues in prep for the neutron-lib
1.14.0 release:
- Updates the tox linkcheck target to get it working.
- Removes the glob for modules/* in doc/source/reference/index.rst as
this causes local build errors when not finding anything with the glob.
- Fixes any issues found by running the linkcheck tox target.

Change-Id: I0e96068cd7b6733adc35503b40500b80692cfd6d

commit_message:
Add sos element to Red Hat family images

sosreport is a tool that collects information about a system.

The sos plugin for Octavia can gather information of installed packages,
log and configuration files for Octavia controller components and
amphora agent. The result is a generated report that can be used for
troubleshooting. The plugin redacts confidential data such as passwords,
certificates and secrets.

At present sos only installs in Red Hat family images as the plugin does
not support other distributions.

Change-Id: I5131a4cfdedd8b78fb673b4264ef1d7a1d613972

commit_message:
Remove any old client actions that no longer exist

Some clients have removed old deprecated client calls. The mapping.json
still contained references to these causing lots of spurious error
logging.

Change-Id: I64bab08ae4800969dc28d477c1de5bea836af9d1
Closes-Bug: #1744962
(cherry picked from commit b03e64120cf8e891eba6e0f07733ebfe121b00a9)

commit_message:
dashboard: declare use_mox=True explicitly

As announced before [0], horizon test helper is no longer set up
by default after Rocky-1 [1]. Dashboard tests which still
depends on mox must declare use_mox=True.

[0] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128486.html
[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129648.html

Change-Id: I508c9b8b7087a90fa0b13742aa00982ef6b5d666

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-22 23:08:55.000000000', 'message': "Don't include trust IDs in Alarm action output

It was originally envisaged that we would allow users to specify trust
IDs in trust+*:// alarm action URLs, and only create trusts internally
when none was specified. This made storage of trust IDs in the username
field of the URL part of the API interface, and it made sense that the
user would have access to the IDs both for trusts they had created
themselves and those created internally.

However, this proved to be a security hole that was closed by
cb90d3ad472bba8d648803ca94a9196dff97f0e8, and now we forbid users from
passing in a trust ID. Any trust IDs that appear in the URL were created
internally.

This causes issues when updating alarms because aodhclient uses a
read-modify-write pattern to do so. The action URLs output from a GET
may contain trust IDs, while the input to a PUT is forbidden from
containing them. This means the data is not round-trippable, so updates
even to unrelated fields fail.

Since storage of the trust ID in action URLs is purely an internal
implementation detail at this point, scrub it out of data returned by
the REST API. This means the output of e.g. a GET will match the
original input data, as the user probably expects, and can be fed back
into a PUT successfully.

Change-Id: I230c0d80a9440c7d002b9a623048ef715a9df743
Closes-Bug: #1737186
Related-Bug: #1649333

commit_message:
Don't include trust IDs in Alarm action output

It was originally envisaged that we would allow users to specify trust
IDs in trust+*:// alarm action URLs, and only create trusts internally
when none was specified. This made storage of trust IDs in the username
field of the URL part of the API interface, and it made sense that the
user would have access to the IDs both for trusts they had created
themselves and those created internally.

However, this proved to be a security hole that was closed by
cb90d3ad472bba8d648803ca94a9196dff97f0e8, and now we forbid users from
passing in a trust ID. Any trust IDs that appear in the URL were created
internally.

This causes issues when updating alarms because aodhclient uses a
read-modify-write pattern to do so. The action URLs output from a GET
may contain trust IDs, while the input to a PUT is forbidden from
containing them. This means the data is not round-trippable, so updates
even to unrelated fields fail.

Since storage of the trust ID in action URLs is purely an internal
implementation detail at this point, scrub it out of data returned by
the REST API. This means the output of e.g. a GET will match the
original input data, as the user probably expects, and can be fed back
into a PUT successfully.

Change-Id: I230c0d80a9440c7d002b9a623048ef715a9df743
Closes-Bug: #1737186
Related-Bug: #1649333

Remove fedora-26 / debian-jessie from testing

We no longer have access to these nodes for testing. As a results,
remove them from stable/queens.

commit_message:
Add support for multiple WSGI script aliases

This patch adds a new parameter named custom_wsgi_script_aliases
to the openstacklib::wsgi::apache class. This can be used to specify
extra WSGI script alias statements for the apache::vhost resource
which is merged with the default one calculated using $path,
$wsgi_script_dir and $wsgi_script_file.

This is the final piece to be able to move keystone::wsgi::apache
over to using openstacklib::wsgi::apache.

Change-Id: I31096140a6f355ec99496053fb06ce6c73094180

commit_message:
Gate with containerized deployment and OpenShift

Use case where Kuryr is deployed containerized and the cloud platform
was OpenShift is broken at the moment. This commit adds a gate testing
that use case to the experimental queue.

This patch sits on top of 3 fixes that fix the use case.

Change-Id: I8ef488c1197c69f3a0ed8c2522ef8ff226bf8c8a

commit_message:
Add namespace handler

This commit adds a base namespace handler. Follow up patch sets will
make use of it to implement actions on namespace creation/deletion.

Partially Implements: blueprint network-namespace

Change-Id: I503b32f2a981ea661c55625d24b14231a0a0e0f8

[{'created': '2018-01-08 20:00:48.000000000', 'message': "add tests for _get_trees_matching_all() with trait

Adds functional tests for the _get_trees_matching_all() function that
include a required trait in addition to resource amounts. The
functionality is yet to be implemented, so the test asserts currently
incorrect behaviour but is well-commented so reviewers should be able to
figure out what the scenario we're trying to isolate is.

Change-Id: Id1463f2e6fbb80eea9241dd1f6e22b6b99c4ee54

commit_message:
tests for alloc candidates with nested and traits

Adds functional tests for the AllocationCandidates.get_by_filters()
function that includes a required trait in addition to resource amounts
and the deployment has nested resource providers.

The functionality is yet to be implemented, so the test asserts
currently incorrect behaviour but is well-commented so reviewers should
be able to figure out what the scenario we're trying to isolate is.

Change-Id: Id1463f2e6fbb80eea9241dd1f6e22b6b99c4ee54
blueprint: nested-resource-providers-allocation-candidates

commit_message:
Test case: traits don't sync if first access fails

Introduce a test case for the cited bug, demonstrating that, if the
first access to the traits table raises an exception, the table doesn't
get populated.

Change-Id: I345add7ea0e16a73ccf354910aff14f63b2dbbe7
Related-Bug: 1760322

commit_message:
Use 'Default' as the value of domain name in install guide

The Manila install guide use default in some place as the value of
user_domain_name and project_domain_name, whereas the Keystone
install guide, which people would be consulting earlier, instructs
the installer to use 'Default'.  Since the name is case-sensitive,
this is causing problems for first-time installers of OpenStack.

Ref: https://bugs.launchpad.net/keystone/+bug/1229093

Change-Id: I1cf4345abd3ae8923f8d1fbd0706737494745d84
Closes-bug: #1766475

commit_message:
Testing curl succeeds from pod to the service

Refactoring test_service so it's possible to use
several tests in TestServiceScenario class, like:
1) Connectivity to the service from the machine running the test
2) Connectivity to the service from another pod
3) Connectivity to the service from VM (following patch)

Change-Id: I928aaafff1e75a98f33b94ee31c8ad9bc775ba2a

subject: Revert "Force pip install update of PasteDeploy"
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 4690, 'name': 'melanie witt', 'display_name': 'melwitt', 'email': 'melwittt@gmail.com', 'username': 'melwitt'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]

[{'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-14 00:20:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-14 00:22:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-14 00:24:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-14 05:36:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-14 11:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1

LGTM'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-14 11:41:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: -Code-Review

Oh wait, it is possible to configure devstack to not run with the UCA via the ENABLE_UBUNTU_CLOUD_ARCHIVE flag - maybe instead of the revert this should just take that into account and if ENABLE_UBUNTU_CLOUD_ARCHIVE is True, which is the default, then don't do the workaround."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-14 11:42:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-16 15:24:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> Oh wait, it is possible to configure devstack to not run with the
 > UCA via the ENABLE_UBUNTU_CLOUD_ARCHIVE flag - maybe instead of the
 > revert this should just take that into account and if
 > ENABLE_UBUNTU_CLOUD_ARCHIVE is True, which is the default, then
 > don't do the workaround.

What? This workaround was added in order to handle the Pike UCA. The ceph packages pull in python-paste and python-pastedeploy as dependencies and the version of python-paste from the Pike UCA did not satisfy upper-constraints, so devstack upgraded it via pip (when it was originally installed via apt-get), causing the original ImportError where pastedeploy installed by apt-get could not find paste installed by pip.

We shouldn't have this workaround at all (to force a pip update of one package) but it was the best we could come up with at the time for the situation.

Now that we have the Queens UCA, the python-paste and python-pastedeploy versions coming from it are satisfying upper-constraints, so devstack isn't touching them, which is good.

I'd like to get rid of this workaround since we are finally able."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-17 16:50:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

We are by default using the Queens UCA if ENABLE_UBUNTU_CLOUD_ARCHIVE is True, which it is by default. But it is possible to configure localrc to set ENABLE_UBUNTU_CLOUD_ARCHIVE=False, which would then cause the problem again. So it seems until devstack on master is using a base version of ubuntu (or whatever distro) that has the pastedeploy packages with the fix, we still need the workaround.'}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2018-04-20 12:13:08.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

I did a lot of debugging to come to the same result. ;)

Not sure though what will happen on stable branches, did you test that?

Anyway I'd be in favor of fixing master first and looking at stable checks later.

See also https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-gate/+bug/1765638"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-20 15:58:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

> We are by default using the Queens UCA if ENABLE_UBUNTU_CLOUD_ARCHIVE
 > is True, which it is by default. But it is possible to configure
 > localrc to set ENABLE_UBUNTU_CLOUD_ARCHIVE=False, which would then
 > cause the problem again. So it seems until devstack on master is
 > using a base version of ubuntu (or whatever distro) that has the
 > pastedeploy packages with the fix, we still need the workaround.

It's not that theres a pastedeploy package with a fix -- it's just that pip and apt-get install packages to different places, so if one of paste or pastedeploy is installed by one package manager and not the other, they won't be able to find each other (and pastedeploy imports things from paste) [0].

Normally, they would both be installed by apt-get because that's how the ceph packages are installed and they pull in paste and pastedeploy. But if the version(s) doesn't meet the lower constraint, devstack will install with pip. And if devstack only installs one of them with pip, then the problem occurs.

[0] https://askubuntu.com/questions/828642/pip-doesnt-know-of-apt-get-installed-packages"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-20 18:36:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

Indeed reverting this makes the job fail on stable/queens:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/563175

so I need to think about this more. Maybe the best thing to do is to update the existing workaround to also force a pip install of Paste so then the two will always be in sync.'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-20 19:09:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I'm trying the pip install force update for Paste now:

https://review.openstack.org/563238

and will check the results on stable/queens here:

https://review.openstack.org/563175

and stable/pike here:

https://review.openstack.org/563174"}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-24 15:53:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Fixed instead by:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/563870'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-14 00:20:13.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Revert "Force pip install update of PasteDeploy"

This reverts commit 6e2de3845a2380ff6d981d107d396e42b4bae0ba.

Back when we updated to the Pike UCA, we had a situation where devstack pip installed a newer version of python-paste than was available in the UCA in order to satisfy upper-constraints, causing a mismatch where python-paste had been installed by pip and python-pastedeploy installed by apt-get. And so we had an ImportError where the two packages could not find each other. So we worked around that by forcing an update of PasteDeploy via pip in the ceph devstack plugin.

Now, recently we updated to the Queens UCA [0] and then the ceph job started failing again with:

  ImportError: No module named urlmap

being raised from PasteDeploy. I think this is because of our old hack creating a mismatch between apt-get and pip again since the python-paste version coming from the Queens UCA satisfies upper-constraints and is *not* being updated via pip. So, I think we need to revert this hack.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554314

Change-Id: I381dccdb2bec2b75964d5137b70fcb66fbb9f56f

commit_message:
Revert "Force pip install update of PasteDeploy"

This reverts commit 6e2de3845a2380ff6d981d107d396e42b4bae0ba.

Back when we updated to the Pike UCA, we had a situation where devstack
pip installed a newer version of python-paste than was available in the
UCA in order to satisfy upper-constraints, causing a mismatch where
python-paste had been installed by pip and python-pastedeploy installed
by apt-get. And so we had an ImportError where the two packages could
not find each other. So we worked around that by forcing an update of
PasteDeploy via pip in the ceph devstack plugin.

Now, recently we updated to the Queens UCA [0] and then the ceph job
started failing again with:

  ImportError: No module named urlmap

being raised from PasteDeploy. I think this is because of our old hack
creating a mismatch between apt-get and pip again since the python-paste
version coming from the Queens UCA satisfies upper-constraints and is
*not* being updated via pip. So, I think we need to revert this hack.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/554314

Change-Id: I381dccdb2bec2b75964d5137b70fcb66fbb9f56f

In commit 6e2de3845a2380ff6d981d107d396e42b4bae0ba we added a force pip
install update of PasteDeploy because the python-paste package from the
Pike UCA did not meet requirements constraints and so devstack pip
installed a newer version of it, causing the python-pastedeploy package
installed by apt-get to not be able to find modules in the Paste
package installed by pip. We worked around the problem by forcing a pip
install update of PasteDeploy.

Now that we've updated to the Queens UCA [0], both the python-paste and
python-pastedeploy packages installed by apt-get meet requirements
constraints, so devstack isn't pip installing either of them. But we're
still forcing a pip install update of PasteDeploy, so we end up again
with an import error when keystone tries to start:

  ERROR keystone ImportError: No module named urlmap

Closes-Bug: #1765815

[0] https://review.openstack.org/554314

Change-Id: I6b8dbb579a09af80809a33c55405fbb33e677599

commit_message:
Also force pip install update of Paste

In commit 6e2de3845a2380ff6d981d107d396e42b4bae0ba we added a force pip
install update of PasteDeploy because the python-paste package from the
Pike UCA did not meet requirements constraints and so devstack pip
installed a newer version of it, causing the python-pastedeploy package
installed by apt-get to not be able to find modules in the Paste
package installed by pip. We worked around the problem by forcing a pip
install update of PasteDeploy.

Now that we've updated to the Queens UCA [0], both the python-paste and
python-pastedeploy packages installed by apt-get meet requirements
constraints, so devstack isn't pip installing either of them. But we're
still forcing a pip install update of PasteDeploy, so we end up again
with an import error when keystone tries to start:

  ERROR keystone ImportError: No module named urlmap

Closes-Bug: #1765815

[0] https://review.openstack.org/554314

Change-Id: I6b8dbb579a09af80809a33c55405fbb33e677599

commit_message:
Apply workaround for PasteDeploy only on stable/queens

The workaround in order to fix the issue with Paste/PasteDeploy being
pulled in as system packages when installing ceph is only needed for the
Pike UCA. Assume that we only use that when devstack is running at the
stable/queens branch.

Change-Id: I0bbf04be015b777b3feb2c5e837b1f46f81cf3e9

[2] https://pypi.org/project/<package>

subject: Eliminate possible insecure usage of temp file/directory.

[{'account_id': 26782, 'date': '2018-04-18 13:05:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-04-18 14:13:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26782, 'date': '2018-04-18 14:20:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> (2 comments)

Hi, Brian!

I see three actions:
a) use a different hard-coded value, not mkdtemp() and fix tox.ini as well.

But what hard-coded value do you propose to use?

We can't use /tmp', '/var/tmp', '/dev/shm' dirs:
https://docs.openstack.org/bandit/latest/plugins/b108_hardcoded_tmp_directory.html


b) Leave this be, as it seems to be harmless.


c) Use mkdtemp() function as a default parameter. I mean that I can
use it like that:def __init__(self, resource_id, config, process_monitor,
conf_path=tempfile.mkdtemp(), namespace=None,
throttle_restart_value=None)Then then the value of the function will be persist. I mean that
this function will called only one time and we will have something
like 'hard-coded value'.The new directory will be created only after restart of an agent

So what do you propose to do, Brian?

Thank you so much!"}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2018-04-18 14:25:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26782, 'date': '2018-04-20 11:37:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-04-20 11:47:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

what about Brian's comment which suggest to just remove "None" as default value of conf_path argument and make it mandatory?'}, {'account_id': 26782, 'date': '2018-04-20 11:57:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > what about Brian's comment which suggest to just remove "None" as
 > default value of conf_path argument and make it mandatory?

And don't use tempfile?'}, {'account_id': 11975, 'date': '2018-04-20 12:06:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> > (1 comment)
 > >
 > > what about Brian's comment which suggest to just remove "None" as
 > > default value of conf_path argument and make it mandatory?
 > 
 > And don't use tempfile?

Yes, as then it's always on caller what path will be used'}, {'account_id': 26782, 'date': '2018-04-20 12:26:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 26782, 'date': '2018-04-20 15:41:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Why did you abandon this and start https://review.openstack.org/#/c/563971/ ?  They're exactly the same."}, {'account_id': 26782, 'date': '2018-04-24 14:44:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

commit_message:
Eliminate possible insecure usage of temp file/directory.

This patch is a fix for the issue B108: hardcoded_tmp_directory
found by bandit scanner.

The main reasoning for that is the need for safely creating
a temporary file or directory.

Change-Id: I7e8f1a23224ad76bc7c703f2652716da36e759ca
Related-Bug: #1759250

commit_message:
don't let tox_install.sh error if there is nothing to do

If we end up with an empty package list, return without erroring.

Change-Id: Id66aaf4bcb8c40ab720303a3ca92a46f92642369
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

The current Glance config files are a combination of copied and

commit_message:
Clean up Glance config files

The current Glance config files are a combination of copied and
generated files.  This patch makes all the files generated and
removes now unnecssary ini(un)comment statements.  It additionally
removes some ini(un)comment statements that weren't having any
effect on the previously generated files.

Change-Id: I6e4b7694e8bebb7fe6661ead034ee257c768e342

commit_message:
List PyMySQL first in installation docs

It's by far the most tested driver with oslo.db so it makes sense
to have it first in the list of driver options.

Mostly this is just to have a change to merge so the reno jobs get
run again though.

Change-Id: I5a9a05b6c3e3008cb1dfefc2df397003c2cbc7fd

commit_message:
Fail validation on new workflow_tasks

Adds a new validation to check role_data for workflow_tasks. If found,
the validation will fail. Existing templates with workflow_tasks are
excluded for now until they are fully migrated to external_deploy_tasks.

Depends-On: I0cf206e8ceeecfca17dd99a83b8c2eaa50e66712
Change-Id: I830a5cda660f5f73ca3a98f4a886abce6989daf0
implements: blueprint deprecate-workflow-tasks

commit_message:
Suppress warnings with -qq

The quiet arg (-q) is cumulative and should suppress warnings when -qq is
specified per the help text. These warnings were previously added and
did not honor -qq.

Depends-On: I0cf206e8ceeecfca17dd99a83b8c2eaa50e66712
Change-Id: Ic9fe4d7934fa6ad9c4d689a5402f43231c245ada

commit_message:
Bump Ceph container image from 3.0.1 to 3.0.3

Ceph contaimer image version 3.0.3 added support for RHEL. This change
bumps the version we're testing in CI (CentOS) from 3.0.1 to 3.0.3.

The new image was tested via I7e50d1c0d9483cc1462ec13b430ff16f9f4adb2c

Change-Id: I1ffb9e058ab1dbab8718a75ce1bc015633c69327
(cherry picked from commit 2bdd048c6c395707eeca429e1ab641decff2664c)

commit_message:
Eliminate possible insecure usage of temp file/directory

This patch is a fix for the issue B108: hardcoded_tmp_directory
found by bandit scanner.

The main reasoning for that is the need for safely creating
a temporary file or directory.

Change-Id: Ic9576d4b4c5f872e0ed14cbed5bc6715dda99c3f
Related-Bug: #1759250

[{'created': '2018-04-20 17:55:42.000000000', 'message': 'fix the python-masakariclient release model

We do not allow libraries to follow the milestone release model because
pip will not install pre-release versions by default.

Also correct the deliverable type at the same time.

Change-Id: Ia638fccff9fb9ed9cacaf3ef854a1f0e11fb6d43
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix the python-masakariclient release model

We do not allow libraries to follow the milestone release model because
pip will not install pre-release versions by default.

Also correct the deliverable type at the same time.

Change-Id: Ia638fccff9fb9ed9cacaf3ef854a1f0e11fb6d43
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Yum custom repo creation requires root

We can't assume the executing user is root, so use become.

Also uses a block to perform the RedHat-only check.

Change-Id: Ibf2da6b8086bc8e34b33f113067a213a33213161
Story: 2001898
Task: 14383

In Debian, cinder-api is using uwsgi. Use that instead of Apache.

Change-Id: I07054c0a5fb32335d3e4895fb79ce783830ca97b
'}]
commit_message:
Debian: Setup Cinder using cinder-api uwsgi

In Debian, cinder-api is using uwsgi. Use that instead of Apache.

commit_message:
Debian uses libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3

Since all of OpenStack in Debian switched to Python 3, we need to use
libapache2-mod-wsgi-py3 instead of libapache2-mod-wsgi. This definition
follows the upstream doc at:
https://forge.puppet.com/puppetlabs/apache/readme (look at mod_packages).

Change-Id: I841de2fe44c20419cb61fc1b3d0a77d38ce0c375

commit_message:
Only replace python when re-initializing the venv

We reinitialize the venv to ensure that the right version of
python is in the venv, but we do not want virtualenv to also
replace pip, setuptools and wheel so we tell it not to. If we
don't do this then virtualenv will install the latest available
version, which is not what we want.

Change-Id: I8772e90fa3ff2653836870921ee0e182150715e4
Partial-Bug: #1764470

commit_message:
Optimizing big 'on-XXX' clauses

* Fixed the implementation of data_flow.evaluate_task_outbound_context
  method so that it doesn't use copy.deepcopy() because it may be
  very expensive (both CPU and RAM) on big dictionaries.

(cherry picked from commit 4936d778e5ad1eebfd54c86f9daa249fb2ee8ab5)

Change-Id: Ida59bc25b04c05b2d16ffe10520dcb762506ed75

commit_message:
Eliminate possible insecure usage of temp file/directory

This patch is a fix for the issue B108: hardcoded_tmp_directory
found by bandit scanner.

The main reasoning for that is the need for safely creating
a temporary file or directory.

Change-Id: I84efd45351ff231286c093f67ef4627cb8edf079
Related-Bug: #1759250

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: handle vif_plug/unplug with no IP as wildcard

With this change:
- a vif plug with an IP specified should result in eventually
  removing an existing endpoint for the same MAC but without an IP

- an unplug without an IP specified should result in unplugging
  all endpoints for the same MAC (with and without IPs)

Change-Id: Iedfd656a00a29be46fd10ab23ee645c2c6cab3f1
Closes-Bug: 1765705

commit_message:
doc: update python API client documentation

The documentation was still refering to the
old methods provided by the networking-bgpvpn
dynamic extension to neutronclient instead of
the newer and more complete methods that have
been in neutronclient since Ocata release.

This change updates the documentation and examples,
and adds code to document the method for port
associations.

Partial-Bug: 1761691
Change-Id: Idd572530d64cd65cc0a606515bcf7f056c2b8745

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 12:01:31.000000000', 'message': 'Debian is using Python 3

By default, puppet-openstack attemps to install python-neutron-lbaas
which makes neutron-server fail in Debian, because LBAAS, and neutron
cannot find the LBaaS class that is normally provided by
python3-neutron-lbaas (ie: the python3 version).

Change-Id: Idf06d66eaea2daa1567288fbb0e33deae12b3d89
'}, {'created': '2018-04-23 20:14:49.000000000', 'message': 'Debian is using Python 3

By default, puppet-openstack attemps to install python-neutron-lbaas
which makes neutron-server fail in Debian, because LBAAS, and neutron
cannot find the LBaaS class that is normally provided by
python3-neutron-lbaas (ie: the python3 version).

Change-Id: Idf06d66eaea2daa1567288fbb0e33deae12b3d89
'}]
commit_message:
Debian is using Python 3

By default, puppet-openstack attemps to install python-neutron-lbaas
which makes neutron-server fail in Debian, because LBAAS, and neutron
cannot find the LBaaS class that is normally provided by
python3-neutron-lbaas (ie: the python3 version).

Change-Id: Idf06d66eaea2daa1567288fbb0e33deae12b3d89

commit_message:
Improve performance when list instances with IP filter

When list instances with IP filter, there is no need
to try to get instances from BuildRequest, as building
instances will not have IP address. Skip this db call
can slightly improve performance.

Closes-Bug: #1764685

Change-Id: Ic02206e887e3fea7752d615bbed680510c482097

commit_message:
Update ceilometerdb-size to support gnocchi and panko

If panko.conf exists, check panko.conf[database]event_time_to_live for
event database ttls.

If gnocchi.conf exists, assume no ini files need to be checked for
metric ttl as those are covered by the gnocchi archive policy.

modify overall playbook to support the reporting of multiple errors.

edit the name and description metadata to reflect changes.

Closes-Bug: #1695963
Change-Id: I4d12bfc3fdf8252aeeabe72126ab7122f40c4ae1
(cherry picked from commit e40e2021b9967599466285dfa0a8b5394cc240fa)

commit_message:
Eliminate possible insecure usage of temp file/directory

This patch is a fix for the issue B108: hardcoded_tmp_directory
found by bandit scanner.

The main reasoning for that is the need for safely creating
a temporary file or directory.

Change-Id: I10684ce06aba8b899997e209a79be255bdff27a1
Related-Bug: #1759250

commit_message:
Eliminate possible insecure usage of temp file/directory

This patch is a fix for the issue B108: hardcoded_tmp_directory
found by bandit scanner.

The main reasoning for that is the need for safely creating
a temporary file or directory.

Change-Id: I2b58cda7c3eadf3aa6f426126c603c6dec9018cd
Related-Bug: #1759250

commit_message:
Avoid tox_install.sh for constraints support

We do not need tox_install.sh, pip can handle constraints itself
and install the project correctly. Thus update tox.ini and remove
the now obsolete tools/tox_install.sh file.

This follows https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508061 to remove
tools/tox_install.sh.

Change-Id: I9298add1f77b56f19f355b19da89f9799d2415c9
Depends-On: I5a88d2068c961245b4b9ed60948532f232b859a5
(cherry picked from commit d018cd7788559221f66bdeffc4698f5aa55a0535)

Adding doc8 to test-requirements

tox -e doc was failing due to missing doc8. With this
change doc8 is added to test-requirements.txt.

Change-Id: I5a88d2068c961245b4b9ed60948532f232b859a5
Signed-off-by: csatari <gergely.csatari@nokia.com>
(cherry picked from commit bf3c423ab8ea1668ac400d0f70a69a9773af3e09)

NOTE: The two above changes have been squashed into one as they depend on
      each other to make CI pass.
Change-Id: I9298add1f77b56f19f355b19da89f9799d2415c9

Correct the string formatting in a info log message

It should be "%s," not just "%,". The error observed was something
like...

Closes-Bug: #1764696

commit_message:
Allow repo host packages to be upgraded before repo build

To cater for a situation where the repo build packages are changing,
but the repo does not yet have the package built, we need to ensure
that the install task for it can fetch from pypi (or the designated
pypi mirror). To do this we try the local repo first, then fall back
to using the designated default index which defaults to pypi.

Change-Id: Iba7e9939250b24dc64fdd1883f963d0253ddad7e

subject: Avoid tox-install.sh
messages:
[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2018-04-18 17:57:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2018-04-18 18:02:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Currently neutron-fwaas' build-openstack-sphinx-docs jobs fails on stable/* branches due to pip 10 and tools/tox_install.sh which calls a "pip install -c... -U" without package at the end of the script. This was a WARNING before but from pip 10 it's an ERROR, so the job fails with RETRY_LIMIT [1]

If we backport this patch, then the jobs should be OK, if I'm not mistaken.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic-stable/git.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-fwaas/stable/queens/build-openstack-sphinx-docs/c166cbc/'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2018-04-20 15:29:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2018-04-24 13:15:46.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

commit_message:
Avoid tox-install.sh

Instead of using tox-install.sh, we can install horizon and neutron
now directly from pypi - or use the current branch in CI system using
tox-siblings.

Update tox.ini for this change and add neutron to requirements file.

Change-Id: I29c17d51f2648e4bdef1a8c9799ca5e785aa3423

(1 comment)

Thank you for the patch!

You may want to familiarise yourself with the guidelines for writing commit messages at https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages#Summary_of_Git_commit_message_structure . For example if you update your commit message to include "Closes-Bug: #1695963" the Launchpad status will be automatically updated as the patch progresses and merges. Likewise, it's good to have a short summary of the what/why in the commit message, to help reviewers better understand the rationale for the change. In general we avoid having bugzilla references in upstream patches as they're not directly relevant to upstream, though different projects are more or less strict about this.

Thanks again! I'll let others comment on the validation itself.'}, {'account_id': 25452, 'date': '2017-06-06 14:40:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Published edit on patch set 1'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-06-06 14:59:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified+1
