commit_message:
Update ceilometerdb-size to support gnocchi and panko

If panko.conf exists, check panko.conf[database]event_time_to_live for
event database ttls.

If gnocchi.conf exists, assume no ini files need to be checked for
metric ttl as those are covered by the gnocchi archive policy.

modify overall playbook to support the reporting of multiple errors.

edit the name and description metadata to reflect changes.

Closes-Bug: #1695963
Change-Id: I4d12bfc3fdf8252aeeabe72126ab7122f40c4ae1

subject: Disable the pip version check
messages: [{'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-23 12:07:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/pike.'}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-04-24 11:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23163, 'date': '2018-04-24 12:19:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-24 12:39:06.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 6816, 'date': '2018-04-24 12:39:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2\n\nAdding votes back after rebase.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 12:07:54.000000000', 'message': "Disable the pip version check

In our logs it is frequent that the warning to upgrade the
pip version is present, but this warning is unnecessary as
we are always using a well tested version of pip.

To reduce noise, we set disable the version check. This has
the added benefit of not adding more internet access to every
pip task than is necessary.

In the template we ensure that the var is interpreted as a
boolean (in case of user error), then force it to lower case
as that's what pip prefers in pip.conf.

We also now remove the test for the self check file, as it
will no longer be present with this option implemented.

Change-Id: Ie0427d3435270836302441b92eaff7e7980d7047
(cherry picked from commit 70b8cd5737cdf2adfe69c0cea6859118c45ae878)
"}, {'created': '2018-04-24 12:39:06.000000000', 'message': "Disable the pip version check

In our logs it is frequent that the warning to upgrade the
pip version is present, but this warning is unnecessary as
we are always using a well tested version of pip.

To reduce noise, we set disable the version check. This has
the added benefit of not adding more internet access to every
pip task than is necessary.

In the template we ensure that the var is interpreted as a
boolean (in case of user error), then force it to lower case
as that's what pip prefers in pip.conf.

We also now remove the test for the self check file, as it
will no longer be present with this option implemented.

Change-Id: Ie0427d3435270836302441b92eaff7e7980d7047
(cherry picked from commit 70b8cd5737cdf2adfe69c0cea6859118c45ae878)
"}]
commit_message:
Disable the pip version check

In our logs it is frequent that the warning to upgrade the
pip version is present, but this warning is unnecessary as
we are always using a well tested version of pip.

To reduce noise, we set disable the version check. This has
the added benefit of not adding more internet access to every
pip task than is necessary.

In the template we ensure that the var is interpreted as a
boolean (in case of user error), then force it to lower case
as that's what pip prefers in pip.conf.

We also now remove the test for the self check file, as it
will no longer be present with this option implemented.

Change-Id: Ie0427d3435270836302441b92eaff7e7980d7047
(cherry picked from commit 70b8cd5737cdf2adfe69c0cea6859118c45ae878)

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: API error reporting and logging improvements

* include instance id in dataplane instance logs:
  have self._run_command use instance logger in a dataplane
  instance, so that instance id is present in logs.

* rename _log_output_error into _log_stdx_if to avoid
  matching _log_output_error when grepping for errors

* improve API error messages on IP/MAC inconsistencies

* have classes used as singleton use a short __repr_
  so that method call DEBUG logs are shorter

* have route table manager log more details in case
  of an already advertized route

* have method call logger decorator be a little less
  versbose (ommit module)

Change-Id: I6be08e84bd8ffa458cb44a7de800706a191b38d4

[{'created': '2018-04-18 19:28:36.000000000', 'message': "Raise OpenShift version to 3.9.0

OpenShift 3.7 has a bug [1] that prevents from updating metadata of pods
created without any Controller (e.g. through `kubectl apply -f
pod-def.yaml` with ServiceAccount credentials. This prevents
containerized Kuryr to apply annotations onto such pods.

As this is only fixed in 3.9 now, we'll raise default OpenShift version
in DevStack.

As our version compatibility docs say nothing about OpenShift, we can
just state that we support 3.9+ starting with next release.

Closes-Bug: 1765132
[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1383707

commit_message:
Raise OpenShift version to 3.9.0

OpenShift 3.7 has a bug [1] that prevents from updating metadata of pods
created without any Controller (e.g. through `kubectl apply -f
pod-def.yaml` with ServiceAccount credentials. This prevents
containerized Kuryr to apply annotations onto such pods.

As this is only fixed in 3.9 now, we'll raise default OpenShift version
in DevStack.

As our version compatibility docs say nothing about OpenShift, we can
just state that we support 3.9+ starting with next release.

Closes-Bug: 1765132
[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1383707

Change-Id: Ia19c5a556085c13b70ae5f6bcd8538adce261fae

commit_message:
Zuul: Remove project name

Zuul no longer requires the project-name for in-repo configuration.
Omitting it makes forking or renaming projects easier.

commit_message:
Ensure that pip.conf templates variables properly

When a user provides values other than the defaults for
upgrade/pre, they may not format it in a way that pip
interprets properly. To ensure that we template the
conf file correctly, we ensure that it's interpreted
as a boolean, then make it lower case as is expected by
pip.

Change-Id: I91590665cd2d878b6b5ef92d1118610bb4a3fd84
(cherry picked from commit b9d90b5e81bcb27766bec04bb6f3794078506f82)

commit_message:
Refactor libvirtd.conf creation

Replace the hardcoded bloated template with a variant of our standard
template that only includes the values that are really needed.

This will allow deployments to override the default values and for
example deploy libvirtd with TLS authentication according to [0].

[0] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/OSSN/OSSN-0007

Change-Id: Ib7b305670f525bbf975ec33ed070e2d960347ef4

subject: Require the (soon-to-be) Rocky version of Horizon
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-24 11:46:02.000000000', 'message': 'Require the (soon-to-be) Rocky version of Horizon

... or at least the first published tarball which will lead to Rocky.
On the other side this means forcing the usage of mox as long as
there are tests that depends on it (the switch was already flipped
in Horizon, so it needs to be enabled here).

Change-Id: I06f45be7d3f755a04653b93ec8600f36c02fd041
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Require the (soon-to-be) Rocky version of Horizon

... or at least the first published tarball which will lead to Rocky.
On the other side this means forcing the usage of mox as long as
there are tests that depends on it (the switch was already flipped
in Horizon, so it needs to be enabled here).

Change-Id: I06f45be7d3f755a04653b93ec8600f36c02fd041
Signed-off-by: Charles Short <zulcss@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Default collectd to overcloud gnocchi

This patch makes it possible to use overcloud gnocchi instance as datastore
for collectd.

Closes-Bug: #1766255
Change-Id: I122c705eed80a4ee0cefcbd077e6f03cd320d448

commit_message:
[WIP] IPMI plugin for monasca-agent

This plugin allows for monitoring power, fan speed, temperature and ambient
temperature of the target instances accessing IPMI locally.

Thanks flaviosr for the base code.

Change-Id: I8a9cc2998f790cc28353dc52fe7d28dc3b2bcb31
Co-Authored-By: Flavio Ramalho <flaviosr@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>

commit_message:
Use only update/upgrade ansible queue instead

Related tripleo-common change:
https://review.openstack.org/562995

To avoid race between tripleo queue and ansible queue
we need to use inly ansible queue for update and upgrade

Change-Id: I39b5a1a154b10683ac0de85afd6bbadc3491192a

commit_message:
Masquerading, do not persist ephemeral firewall rules

Puppet class tripleo::firewall makes an effort to not
persist ephemeral firewall rules created by neutron and
ironic-inspector. In instack-undercloud the rules are
persisted anyway because we run iptables-save when
configuring masquerading.

This changes the masquerading to also filter the rules,
similar to what we do in tripleo::firewall.

Additionally filtering of the Ironic Inspector iptables
pxe_filter rules are implemented.

Closes-Bug: #1765700
Change-Id: I0cebfe4177981958c6e1a3b4b772f0a365f79e39
(cherry picked from commit e49688be9844b9ae32e14747ad95a07be0fa142c)

commit_message:
Masqeurading: NOT persist ephemeral firewall rules

Puppet class tripleo::firewall makes an effort to not
persist ephemeral firewall rules created by neutron and
ironic-inspector. In instack-undercloud the rules are
persisted anyway because we run iptables-save when
configuring masquerading.

This changes the masquerading to also filter the rules,
similar to what we do in tripleo::firewall.

Additionally filtering of the Ironic Inspector iptables
pxe_filter rules are implemented.

Closes-Bug: #1765700
Change-Id: I0cebfe4177981958c6e1a3b4b772f0a365f79e39

commit_message:
Add bindep.txt file

Bindep is a tool for checking the presence of binary packages needed
to use an application / library. It started life as a way to make it
easier to set up a development environment for OpenStack projects.

Change-Id: Idde756a7e6abef2d4e40f02af5a446278b5efcd6
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: I2314d9517e930c9ff95c1d96af81819c3ac80e72
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

mysql databse on disk, create the required users and set their password. The

commit_message:
Reduce verbosity during mysql bootstrap

During the initial deployment, a one-time container is used to bootstrap the
mysql databse on disk, create the required users and set their password. The
script that runs that is too verbose and logs some credentials in the
container's logs and in the journal.

Use kolla_extend_start directly instead of kolla_start to stop tracing shell
commands and reduce logging to the bare minimum for troubleshooting.

Closes-Bug: #1765339

Change-Id: I90827feff0d1b9fd8badb72e68e4c8dd8db8aea5
(cherry picked from commit a246549303cf110f589af989b3d93ecf6d0e51dd)

commit_message:
Adding missing OVN Metadata service to DVR environments

Current environment files for DVR setups using OVN as a backend are
missing Metadata service. This patch is adding it for both HA and non
HA configurations.

Change-Id: I9bf016e838f193918dc74278b1aaaaa8e7919421
Closes-Bug: 1763044
Signed-off-by: Daniel Alvarez <dalvarez@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit db5de1a196ed5df59e117aab1216fb7e931af1a2)

commit_message:
Fix newline stripping in upgrade template.

Too much new lines are stipped when scripts for OC upgrade
 are generated. This results in non-functional scripts, e.g.:
--playbook upgrade_steps_playbook.yaml 2>&1echo "Runing major upgrade ...

Change-Id: Iaf70649f5f9c6dec7b97badf6fce5b047a9bb6c2

commit_message:
Create /var/log/containers on Swift storage-only nodes

This directory is missing when deploying standalone Swift storage nodes,
and thus the following Ansible task to create a link fails.

Closes-Bug: 1736109

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 12:07:42.000000000', 'message': "Disable the pip version check

In our logs it is frequent that the warning to upgrade the
pip version is present, but this warning is unnecessary as
we are always using a well tested version of pip.

To reduce noise, we set disable the version check. This has
the added benefit of not adding more internet access to every
pip task than is necessary.

In the template we ensure that the var is interpreted as a
boolean (in case of user error), then force it to lower case
as that's what pip prefers in pip.conf.

We also now remove the test for the self check file, as it
will no longer be present with this option implemented.

Change-Id: Ie0427d3435270836302441b92eaff7e7980d7047
(cherry picked from commit 70b8cd5737cdf2adfe69c0cea6859118c45ae878)

commit_message:
Disable the pip version check

In our logs it is frequent that the warning to upgrade the
pip version is present, but this warning is unnecessary as
we are always using a well tested version of pip.

To reduce noise, we set disable the version check. This has
the added benefit of not adding more internet access to every
pip task than is necessary.

In the template we ensure that the var is interpreted as a
boolean (in case of user error), then force it to lower case
as that's what pip prefers in pip.conf.

We also now remove the test for the self check file, as it
will no longer be present with this option implemented.

Change-Id: Ie0427d3435270836302441b92eaff7e7980d7047
(cherry picked from commit 70b8cd5737cdf2adfe69c0cea6859118c45ae878)

commit_message:
Add the service_config_settings from {{service-name}} base

Some container yaml file does not get the
service_config_settings from the base file.

This patch makes for the following docker yaml files get
the service_config_settings:
 docker/services/neutron-l3.yaml
 docker/services/neutron-metadata.yaml
 docker/services/neutron-ovs-agent.yaml

Related-Bug: #1757066

Change-Id: Ifc8def10da0b10decd12efaab4452ff46f3c685b
(cherry picked from commit 51269a1e22793d858dca56fd7f362efc2c387f55)

commit_message:
Split up neutron-lbaas service plugin and agent

Splitting up service plugin and agent allows operators to deploy
neutron-lbaas with greater granularity over what one wants to get
installed configured. For example, one may want to configure only one of
the two.

Closes-Bug: #1766278

Change-Id: If3af333b34d2af764d111d49e981f9d3a170d803
(cherry picked from commit b93250af11682075d91bf2cd0accd7e4171219c5)

2018-01-29 22:06:27.421 8322 INFO oslo_service.service [-] Starting 8 workers'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-02-12 00:14:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Patch Set 1 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-02-25 07:11:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-15 08:02:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-15 08:11:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

2018-04-15 08:04:02.245 36 INFO oslo.service.wsgi [req-571d4257-0d53-4fdf-9515-1657038389b3 - - - - -] Mistral API server listening on 0.0.0.0:8989
2018-04-15 08:04:02.246 36 INFO oslo_service.service [req-571d4257-0d53-4fdf-9515-1657038389b3 - - - - -] Starting 8 workers
2018-04-15 08:04:04.154 36 INFO mistral.service.base [-] Event engine server started.
2018-04-15 08:04:04.342 36 INFO mistral.service.base [req-9e033269-9f09-49d0-91b8-fd50be1c6c12 - - - - -] Engine server started.
2018-04-15 08:04:04.346 36 INFO mistral.service.base [-] Executor server started.
2018-04-15 08:04:04.351 36 INFO mistral.service.base [-] Notification server started.

Renat, please leave a comment :)'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-15 17:20:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 15895, 'date': '2018-04-16 07:25:27.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-17 07:05:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-20 21:13:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-04-23 08:23:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

I think the started logging is obvious enough with these changes.

http://logs.openstack.org/02/538602/4/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario003-multinode-oooq-container/781e124/logs/undercloud/var/log/mistral/api.log.txt.gz#_2018-04-20_22_30_32_264'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-04-24 05:11:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

I can't support the idea of this patch.

Look, the intention was to print these messages into standard output so that we could see them when we start a service no matter how our logger is configured.

Instead of changing it to LOG.info() I'd come up with an idea how to print this message for the API service only once plus how many workers it started. That would be good."}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-24 07:38:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> I can't support the idea of this patch.
 > 
 > Look, the intention was to print these messages into standard
 > output so that we could see them when we start a service no matter
 > how our logger is configured.

Or I can't see because I doesn't collect logs from stdout. When I configured my logs I expect that all logs will be written, for example, in a file. And I expect that all logs will have one format to parse their for example.

 > Instead of changing it to LOG.info() I'd come up with an idea how
 > to print this message for the API service only once plus how many
 > workers it started. That would be good.

It already works. Please, take a look Dougal comment http://logs.openstack.org/02/538602/4/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario003-multinode-oooq-container/781e124/logs/undercloud/var/log/mistral/api.log.txt.gz#_2018-04-20_22_30_32_264"}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-04-24 07:52:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> > I can't support the idea of this patch.
 > >
 > > Look, the intention was to print these messages into standard
 > > output so that we could see them when we start a service no
 > matter
 > > how our logger is configured.
 > 
 > Or I can't see because I doesn't collect logs from stdout. When I
 > configured my logs I expect that all logs will be written, for
 > example, in a file. And I expect that all logs will have one format
 > to parse their for example.

It's not meant to be a regular logging. It's just a welcome-kind message that says "everything is ok" when you boot up a Mistral process. Why do you necessarily try to interpret it as logging. Whether you see it or not, of course, depends on you env but, again, this was never meant to be modified by a logging configuration.

 > > Instead of changing it to LOG.info() I'd come up with an idea how
 > > to print this message for the API service only once plus how many
 > > workers it started. That would be good.
 > 
 > It already works. Please, take a look Dougal comment
 > http://logs.openstack.org/02/538602/4/check/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario003-multinode-oooq-container/781e124/logs/undercloud/var/log/mistral/api.log.txt.gz#_2018-04-20_22_30_32_264

This is related to the previous point: this is not meant to be a regular log message. So this line doesn't count.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-24 08:16:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

> It's not meant to be a regular logging. It's just a welcome-kind
 > message that says "everything is ok" when you boot up a Mistral
 > process. Why do you necessarily try to interpret it as logging.
 > Whether you see it or not, of course, depends on you env but,
 > again, this was never meant to be modified by a logging
 > configuration.

How I should understand that "everything is ok" when I don't see stdout in my case? Why do you want to depend from stdout? 
If everything is not ok that I should look logs anyway.
My point if everything is ok that Mistral process is running.

Now I understand your point of view, but I disagree. I see no reason to argue. If other mistral people agree with you, okay, I abandon this patch. :)'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-04-24 09:25:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

I don't have strong feelings about this one, but Renat's concern seems valid enough and changing it makes little difference. So lets leave it."}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-04-24 09:28:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I just mean that 99% of people that are not experienced in Mistral and just decided to play with it (and running nodes from shell) should be seeing those messages.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-24 11:19:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Ok. Thanks for reviewing :)'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-24 11:19:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Minor improvements of logging

* remove "API server started" message which appears N times where N
 is number of workers
* pretty name of "mistral-api" service like other service names
* replace "print" by logging

Change-Id: Ied610e99159c7b016cc134017e0a32b678728c15
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-24 08:43:10.000000000', 'message': 'Minor fix to internal client loading test

Some test systems might have the internal client config file at the
default path so use a file that definitely does not exist when
testing.

Change-Id: Ia5c3c8499e7da8350ff740dd82cc74c7e4e61a40
'}]
commit_message:
Minor fix to internal client loading test

Some test systems might have the internal client config file at the
default path so use a file that definitely does not exist when
testing.

Change-Id: Ia5c3c8499e7da8350ff740dd82cc74c7e4e61a40

commit_message:
Remove DataCentred from list of vendors

DataCentred's cloud service was shut down late 2017, and so this vendor
should be removed from the list.

Change-Id: Id10cbed6eaa02cafaf5d220032014b2a3f58ad82
Signed-off-by: Nick Jones <nick@stackhpc.com>

and fix typos in existing test names.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-03-29 19:22:19.000000000', 'message': "rehome model_query and its dependencies

This patch rehomes neutron_lib.db._model_query into neutron-lib. While
our longer term goal to use OVO rather than queries and tables, this
module is provided as a stepping stone (as mentioned in release note
herein). The patch also includes a few other APIs that are required for
the rehome including some utils and an exception class.

For more details see the spec on [1].

Also a sample consumption patch can be found on [2]. While won't work
as-is with the depends on approach (it needs to be rebased on multiple
other DNMs in neutron) I tested in locally. In addition this change
was tested locally with a sample vmware-nsx consumption patch [3].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/473531/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557786/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557788/

Change-Id: I3e4b38aa3b6460ce916091c020adedd4ed2c4d26
"}, {'created': '2018-04-02 15:17:00.000000000', 'message': "rehome model_query and its dependencies

our longer term goal to use OVO rather than queries and tables, this

the rehome including some utils and an exception class.

module is provided as a stepping stone (as mentioned in release note
herein). The patch also includes a few other APIs that are required for
the rehome including some utils and an exception class.

For more details see the spec on [1].

Also a sample consumption patch can be found on [2]. While won't work
as-is with the depends on approach (it needs to be rebased on multiple
other DNMs in neutron) I tested in locally. In addition this change
was tested locally with a sample vmware-nsx consumption patch [3].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/473531/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557786/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557788/

commit_message:
rehome model_query and its dependencies

This patch rehomes neutron.db._model_query into neutron-lib. While
our longer term goal is to use OVO rather than queries and tables, this
module is provided as a stepping stone (as mentioned in release note
herein). The patch also includes a few other APIs that are required for
the rehome including some utils and an exception class.

For more details see the spec on [1].

Also a sample consumption patch can be found on [2]. While it won't work
as-is with the depends on approach (it needs to be rebased on multiple
other DNMs in neutron) I tested it locally. In addition this change
was tested locally with a sample vmware-nsx consumption patch [3].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/473531/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557786/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/557788/

Change-Id: I3e4b38aa3b6460ce916091c020adedd4ed2c4d26

commit_message:
Install reno to venv for creating release note

Although reno was once moved from test-requirements to doc/requirement
for introducing the new TPI, it is also necessary for creating a
releasenote with 'tox -e venv'. This patch adds doc/requirements to
venv for installing reno.

Change-Id: Ic9c755ef98b71448457560c78ae69571d1f4bd00

subject: Fix W503 warnings
messages:
[{'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-11 10:26:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8478, 'date': '2018-04-12 07:04:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8648, 'date': '2018-04-12 11:54:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Normally I would advice against following such willy-nilly changes in the style guide, but since you already did all the work, we can as well merge it.'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2018-04-12 13:27:48.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Radomir Dopieralski wrote:

> Normally I would advice against following such willy-nilly changes
> in the style guide, but since you already did all the work, we can
> as well merge it.

Honestly I had similar feeling when I hit this error. On the other hand, I noticed we use both versions (binary operators at EOL and at BOL) so far, so I think it is a good chance to use either way. That's the only reason I am not against this check."}, {'account_id': 1736, 'date': '2018-04-24 09:21:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 10:26:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix W503 warnings

W503 line break before binary operator

Looking at the code base, it sounds okay to follow this check.

Change-Id: Id511e0104dc6de5b204021661d4a8776ca6d3658
'}]
commit_message:
Fix W503 warnings

W503 line break before binary operator

Looking at the code base, it sounds okay to follow this check.

Change-Id: Id511e0104dc6de5b204021661d4a8776ca6d3658

(1 comment)

Nova already sends instance.update when instance metadata is updated. So I think this patch is not needed.

Cheers,
gibi'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-04-23 12:45:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

> (1 comment)
 > 
 > Nova already sends instance.update when instance metadata is
 > updated. So I think this patch is not needed.
 > 
 > Cheers,
 > gibi

Thanks, but didn't saw metadata field in the versioned notification?"}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-04-24 01:29:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

@gibi, in the paste you provide, there is no metadata field in the versioned nofification, maybe a bug?'}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-04-24 08:47:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> @gibi, in the paste you provide, there is no metadata field in the
 > versioned nofification, maybe a bug?

It was the journalctl that decided to cut the log messages into two log lines. I reproduced the situation and found that there is a second line continuing the instance.update log. 

http://paste.openstack.org/show/719802/

Cheers,
gibi'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-04-24 09:45:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Got it, I thought it was non-versioned notification and versioned notification :)'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-04-24 09:46:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Oh, I was correct, the first line was non-versioned :)'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-04-24 09:47:41.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

As Gibi mentioned, instance.save() will trigger instance.update notification which includes metadata updates.'}]

commit_message:
Send out notification when instance metadata updated

Instance metadata could be very useful for services
like monitoring, so it could be better if we can
send out notifications when instances' metadata got
changed.

Closes-Bug: #1764927

Change-Id: Ic51edd1e51abc0204c19e7050bd1392de4853fb4

commit_message:
Deprecate os_region_name option

Option "os_region_name" from group "placement" is deprecated. Use
option "region_name" from group "placement".

Change-Id: I4a07a47adaa7b15a3e081bb2869218adc427111e
Closes-Bug: #1762106

commit_message:
Add better octavia coverage at the gate

This patch moves kuryr-kubernetes-tempest-daemon-containerized-lbaasv2
from experimental to check and gate jobs as it has been stable for
enough time.

In addition, to improve the octavia coverage, this patch adds two
new tests to the experimental gate, both of them for testing octavia
with kuryr containerized deployments. One uses octavia in L3 mode and
the other in L2 mode.

Change-Id: I67867a40bf64aa5a08ca22bb980cd9d6c9b03ebf

commit_message:
Add stable jobs to the gate

Since neutron-tempest-plugin is branchless, it is necessary to gate
againest all stable branches to avoid breakage in stable branches.

Related-Bug: #1765008

commit_message:
Remove the sample .conf file

The sample configuration file is almost never up to date as it has to
be updated by a person submitting a patch.

The implementation of published autogenerated sample config files in
documentation was done in I88a2429dd3cacd1d014b5b441b98fbfee7e1e208
and in If00cd3bcc654a45944c0bc8b3f146c75bd970f9a. These generate
sample configuration files and publish them in the documentation on
every commit, ensuring that they are always up to date, and not
requiring human intervention to be updated.

As has been done with nova (in Mitaka), cinder (in Newton), and
neutron (in Newton) this patch removes the sample config file from the
git tree and replaces it with a README file explaining how to generate
them, or where to find the latest published versions in the online
documentation.

This commit also breaks a related testcase into two distinct tests for
easier readability, making it clearer what the behavior is through one
assertion/concept per test.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562007/
Change-Id: Ic4d6a98035f59b6ebe48d9c85af50fc9408fc3ab

Fluentd monitoring interface

This patch enables deploying fluentd service with enabled REST API
interface for monitoring purposes, which we will then use for container
health check.

commit_message:
Only update plan on upgrade converge

The intention for Queens+ is to upgrade Ceph in a separate step, out
of the main upgrade workflow. This approach would break if we do an
actual Heat stack update during converge, we should only update the
plan.

Change-Id: I503c5aa548d9d3b5a10eb329272d4a3eac90695b
Closes-Bug: #1764996
(cherry picked from commit f2affa0e64f6666672000e12f005609a67753860)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 05:04:57.000000000', 'message': "Modify libvirt port range for live-migration

By default, libvirtd uses ports 49152 to 49215 for live-migration,
as specified in qemu.conf

Since these ports is subset to ephemeral port range, which is from
32768 to 61000 for linux, it can be consumed by any other service
as well. It causes live-migration to fail, with below error:

Live Migration failure: internal error: Unable to find an unused

commit_message:
Modify libvirt port range for live-migration

By default, libvirtd uses ports 49152 to 49215 for live-migration,
as specified in qemu.conf

Since these ports is subset to ephemeral port range, which is from
32768 to 61000 for linux, it can be consumed by any other service
as well. It causes live-migration to fail, with below error:

Live Migration failure: internal error: Unable to find an unused
port in range 'migration' (49152-49215)

Using port range out of ephemeral port range.

Change-Id: I2039eca87c11638faf6262259b7bcface982f5c6

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: I9d5b2d5139ed61ff9d7f116c33e3e145362b46e1

commit_message:
Make charm agnostic of underlying init system

Replace charm custom init control functions with `service_pause`
and `service_resume` functions from charm-helpers.

Change-Id: I235af30a19294316f65fba0e13fe10ae50164a42
Closes-Bug: #1765215

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720


Change-Id: I9320820838085b34e3958eca262c5281157a3c93
(cherry picked from commit 95d76dffc5e7040bd32aaa3215f04f8f5f678c3b)

commit_message:
Adjust shard ranges sort order to prefer more useful state

Change shard range sort order so that a cleaved sub-shard
sorts ahead of its sharding parent shard.

Change-Id: Iee02b34fc0067036f736d79d63c8c78e5be2c235

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 13689, 'date': '2018-03-20 01:58:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review-1

Thank you for updating. This is a breaking change for an environment with direct deploy + whole disk image + netboot + neutron network interface. A node cannot boot with PXE as an instance because the node cannot connect a provisioning network. This causes a failure in the gate tests. Actually, a node couldnt connect a provisioning network, then failed PXE boot.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/50/499050/10/check/ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-wholedisk-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa-multinode/24579c3/logs/ironic-bm-logs/node-2_no_ansi_2018-03-19-10:46:12.txt.gz'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-03-20 10:46:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> Thank you for updating. This is a breaking change for an
 > environment with direct deploy + whole disk image + netboot +
 > neutron network interface. A node cannot boot with PXE as an
 > instance because the node cannot connect a provisioning network.
 > This causes a failure in the gate tests. Actually, a node couldnt
 > connect a provisioning network, then failed PXE boot.
 > 
 > [1] http://logs.openstack.org/50/499050/10/check/ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-wholedisk-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa-multinode/24579c3/logs/ironic-bm-logs/node-2_no_ansi_2018-03-19-10:46:12.txt.gz

Having a node configured with netboot + neutron the network interface is a misconfiguration of the node or ironic, and we should make sure we state that in the docs because we know netboot is never going to work for the neutron network interface.

Perhaps we could add an 'if node.network_interface != "flat": boot from disk' clause in there somewhere for backwards compatibility with a deprecation warning stating that the node is misconfigured and we're falling back to old behaviour for one cycle, and this behaviour will be removed in S* ???'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-03-20 15:41:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> Perhaps we could add an 'if node.network_interface != "flat": boot from disk'

Can we make it part of NetworkInterface.validate instead of hardcoding interface names?'}, {'account_id': 6637, 'date': '2018-03-20 15:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> > Perhaps we could add an 'if node.network_interface != "flat":
 > boot from disk'
 > 
 > Can we make it part of NetworkInterface.validate instead of
 > hardcoding interface names?

I think that would be best long term'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-03-20 15:57:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

+1 to making it part of the network interface validate, and then keeping it there moving forward, which will enable more concise failure feedback to operators that have done things like FFUs.'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2018-03-21 05:30:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

Thank you all. Will post the patch shortly.'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2018-03-22 08:20:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 14629, 'date': '2018-03-22 08:53:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

This results in a deprecation warning in our own CI job: http://logs.openstack.org/50/499050/14/check/ironic-tempest-dsvm-ipa-wholedisk-agent_ipmitool-tinyipa-multinode/4803da7/logs/screen-ir-cond.txt.gz?level=WARNING#_Apr_02_05_54_31_005011. Which makes my wonder, again, if we should switch to local boot by default *before* making this change.

Also due to the deprecation this change is not backportable to stable/queens, where we also need to fix rescue. I suggest we land this change without the deprecation, just keeping the current state of things. Then we iterate on deprecating it separately, ideally, after switching to local boot by default.'}, {'account_id': 11076, 'date': '2018-04-03 10:23:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2018-04-03 10:29:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15:

``agent`` deploy interface do not call ``boot.prepare_instance``
if image being provisioned is whole disk image. This commit fixes
that issue.

Note: Few jenkins failure are expected for test scenarios wherein
whole disk image being provisioned on a node with capability
`boot_option` set to `netboot` and has 'agent' and 'pxe' as its
'deploy' and 'boot' interfaces respectively. These failures would
persist till corresponding changes in IPA gets merged and released.

Closes-Bug: #1713916

Depends-On: I89597fe4a704686fe31c064c3443fd8404a300e5
Change-Id: Ibd49d65f4512f2fa417794b66f4007d82f02e2ac

commit_message:
Fix ``agent`` deploy interface to call ``boot.prepare_instance``

``agent`` deploy interface do not call ``boot.prepare_instance``
if image being provisioned is whole disk image. This commit fixes
that issue.
It also updates ``validate`` method of neutron network interface
module to validate if it can support boot options requested for
instance image.

Change-Id: Ibd49d65f4512f2fa417794b66f4007d82f02e2ac
Story: 1713916
Task: 9259
Story: 1750958
Task: 9288

commit_message:
fluentd: Fix plugin dependency

The current fluent-plugin-kubernetes_metadata_filter plugin
needs ruby version 2.1.0 or higher.

This patch uses the fluent-plugin-kubernetes_metadata_filter:1.0.2 plugin
which only requires ruby version 2.0.0 or higher.

Change-Id: I5067e7f7c71db7405c99913009aef1cfaa3fce20
Closes-Bug: #1766195
Closes-Bug: #1766274

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: Id08a9dd5096afa9e6d7fe811e53c4d9d83247cac
(cherry picked from commit e251aec359e840545059e44b2b1171c37cf8f449)

commit_message:
Make first GET to root return objects or shard ranges as appropriate

Before the first backend container GET request was always for
objects. The proxy then deduced the container's sharding state from
the response headers and if appropriate made a second request for
shard ranges. This was inefficient.

With this patch the first backend container GET request has
X-Backend-Record-Type set to 'auto' which causes the container server
to return shard ranges if it is sharding or sharded, or objects
otherwise. The proxy can deduce which record type it has received from
the response header X-Backend-Record-Type and behave accordingly.

Change-Id: If507d5b5d3e315007bf78f38ebdda8580cbc45cc

messages: [{'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-04-23 11:50:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-04-23 14:16:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9545, 'date': '2018-04-24 06:10:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 11:50:00.000000000', 'message': '[docs] fix invalid "rst" usage

* Fix an issue while splitting docstring to description of parameters
  and the description of the plugins itself. Method 'trip' uses the
  second line of docstring to identify the intend to cut. This logic
  bases on the fact that the first line of docstring doesn't have intend
  at all. Unfortunately, python docstring objects start with empty line
  which moves the actual first line to the second position.

* We do not use definitions in any existing plugins docstrings.
  Existance of such nodes while parsing text means that there is an
  issue with intend (redundant spaces) or missed new line between list
  title/description and actual list items. (the proper test is added)

* rst parser adds "system_message" nodes for any kind of warnings and
  errors. This behaviour can be used in our test to find all "invalid"
  things.

Change-Id: I348ccf140458b604a8cc29053d166c1610ad807d
'}, {'created': '2018-04-23 14:16:33.000000000', 'message': '[docs] fix invalid "rst" usage

* Fix an issue while splitting docstring to description of parameters
  and the description of the plugins itself. Method 'trip' uses the
  second line of docstring to identify the intend to cut. This logic
  bases on the fact that the first line of docstring doesn't have intend
  at all. Unfortunately, python docstring objects start with empty line
  which moves the actual first line to the second position.

* We do not use definitions in any existing plugins docstrings.
  Existance of such nodes while parsing text means that there is an
  issue with intend (redundant spaces) or missed new line between list
  title/description and actual list items. (the proper test is added)

* rst parser adds "system_message" nodes for any kind of warnings and
  errors. This behaviour can be used in our test to find all "invalid"
  things.

Change-Id: I348ccf140458b604a8cc29053d166c1610ad807d
'}]
commit_message:
[docs] fix invalid "rst" usage

* Fix an issue while splitting docstring to description of parameters
  and the description of the plugins itself. Method 'trip' uses the
  second line of docstring to identify the intend to cut. This logic
  bases on the fact that the first line of docstring doesn't have intend
  at all. Unfortunately, python docstring objects start with empty line
  which moves the actual first line to the second position.

* We do not use definitions in any existing plugins docstrings.
  Existance of such nodes while parsing text means that there is an
  issue with intend (redundant spaces) or missed new line between list
  title/description and actual list items. (the proper test is added)

* rst parser adds "system_message" nodes for any kind of warnings and
  errors. This behaviour can be used in our test to find all "invalid"
  things.

Change-Id: I348ccf140458b604a8cc29053d166c1610ad807d

commit_message:
Make peakmem tracker run under devstack python

Add an environment variable to service files that gives the configured
python environment for the service.  Use this in the peakmem tracker
service to ensure we run under the right python.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/561426
Change-Id: I0993b9ca65cfb0ae1d243308871d5aebbf0bca72

commit_message:
api-ref: document sorting for qos resources

API users can use the 'sort_key' and 'sort_dir' to do the sorting
on list result. This patch adds documentation of these two parameters
for QOS related endpoints, including QoS policy and various
qos rules.

Change-Id: I8d85b986effce59cfaae248aa95a95e9fc5db88a
Partial-Bug: #1749024

commit_message:
Move config 'base_url' to controller node

In before, this config is located on compute node. This results
in repeated configuration in each compute node which is unnecessary.
This patch move this config to controller node.

Change-Id: I3c210d5c8d899a2478dd9d107b0c4a097c8178cc

-1 because I don;t see where the option to run stackviz is ever switched to true. Also see comment in the commit message.'}, {'account_id': 8367, 'date': '2018-04-24 07:00:38.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-01-08 17:35:44.000000000', 'message': "Skipping stackviz generation by default

The stackviz data founded in logs/ is generated by devstack-gate code,
and it's the one generaly used by developers to check tempest data. The
tqe code to generate stackviz, is only usefull when you're not running
the job upstream. Skipping it by default will allow us to save some
precious minutes downloading code, installing, etc.

Change-Id: Idda730631f505ece738ccc225f4e64d7d2035e0d
"}]
commit_message:
Skipping stackviz generation by default

The stackviz data founded in logs/ is generated by devstack-gate code,
and it's the one generaly used by developers to check tempest data. The
tqe code to generate stackviz, is only usefull when you're not running
the job upstream. Skipping it by default will allow us to save some
precious minutes downloading code, installing, etc.

Change-Id: Idda730631f505ece738ccc225f4e64d7d2035e0d

commit_message:
Remove the usage of WSME library

WSME is deprecated [1]. This patch removes its usage in code and
also remove it from requirements/lower-contraints.

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129206.html

Change-Id: I74c6b76d71d5dc05825a1a6f69bf2c09e84dee51

subject: Fix backup/restore error for ceph rbd backend
messages: [{'account_id': 26155, 'date': '2018-04-20 22:21:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 26155, 'date': '2018-04-20 22:22:40.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}, {'account_id': 24921, 'date': '2018-04-24 06:31:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\n* Hedvig-CI http://os-logserver.hedviginc.com/refs/changes/28/563328/1 : SUCCESS'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 22:21:48.000000000', 'message': 'Fix backup/restore error for ceph rbd backend

If a large volume is backed up or a lot of concurrent backups happen,
the cinder-backup service goes offline since a lot of these operations
have calls to the C code which are not run on native threads.

When many concurrent backup create/restore operations happen, then
if all of them are greenthreads, and since, when there is a call to the
C code, monkeypatching does not happen by eventlet. Hence, there is no
context switch to other threads until the call to the C library is
completed. This will block context switching to other green threads.
As a result, some of the backup create/restore operations might go to
error state.

The objects on which read/write operations or C function
calls are done are wrapped in Proxy objects so that they run as native
threads.

Change-Id: I71b9bb0f12ff52bd4fb9c1a9a4f4ef6aa8b411f1
Closes-Bug: #1745435
'}]
commit_message:
Fix backup/restore error for ceph rbd backend

If a large volume is backed up or a lot of concurrent backups happen,
the cinder-backup service goes offline since a lot of these operations
have calls to the C code which are not run on native threads.

When many concurrent backup create/restore operations happen, then
if all of them are greenthreads, and since, when there is a call to the
C code, monkeypatching does not happen by eventlet. Hence, there is no
context switch to other threads until the call to the C library is
completed. This will block context switching to other green threads.
As a result, some of the backup create/restore operations might go to
error state.

The objects on which read/write operations or C function
calls are done are wrapped in Proxy objects so that they run as native
threads.

Change-Id: I71b9bb0f12ff52bd4fb9c1a9a4f4ef6aa8b411f1
Closes-Bug: #1745435

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 13:43:33.000000000', 'message': 'Remove pycodestyle version pin. Add E402 and W503 to ignore.

Rather than pinning pycodestyle, ignore the E402 and W503 error. Fix
issue with E731 (Do not assign a lambda expression, use a def).

W503 is something we will likely never enable as it is a personal
style decision and can change depending on the code. There is no one
right answer. Interestingly there is also a W504 which is the opposite
check.

E402 is one we should most likely fix. But it can be done in a follow
patch or patches.

List of various error codes:
https://pycodestyle.readthedocs.io/en/latest/intro.html#error-codes

Change-Id: Ie2c31a8a3c75beeef22453cab5878cf0094bdf3f
(cherry picked from commit ca91d4d871bae437da2c6173e7a0aad5c3b44532)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove pycodestyle version pin. Add E402 and W503 to ignore.

Rather than pinning pycodestyle, ignore the E402 and W503 error. Fix
issue with E731 (Do not assign a lambda expression, use a def).

W503 is something we will likely never enable as it is a personal
style decision and can change depending on the code. There is no one
right answer. Interestingly there is also a W504 which is the opposite
check.

E402 is one we should most likely fix. But it can be done in a follow
patch or patches.

List of various error codes:
https://pycodestyle.readthedocs.io/en/latest/intro.html#error-codes

Change-Id: Ie2c31a8a3c75beeef22453cab5878cf0094bdf3f
(cherry picked from commit ca91d4d871bae437da2c6173e7a0aad5c3b44532)

commit_message:
Use publish-openstack-releasenotes-python3 for python3 release notes

Because publish-openstack-releasenotes is final we need to add a new
job to use when publishing release notes for projects using python 3
instead of being able to just use a variant with sphinx_python set.

Change-Id: Ib671f2c05a5e22d79cb6acc88e9c51e89132970f
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/563771
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Create scenario tests for members

This patch implements members tests for the Octavia
Tempest Plugin. This includes tests for creating servers
and making sure members are properly loadbalanced.

Story: 2001387
Task: 5970
Change-Id: Ib30ca1afd696ead7c0442070975c50b1176132f8

This patch adds script for docker health check of nova-metadata
service. The script checks API service using curl.

nova.objects.unit.notifications.objects.test_notification into
the more path-appropriate test_instance module. The test_notification
module should probably be renamed to test_base but that's left for
another day.

Change-Id: I1eda20634bd788bc892aaa312bafe87461eb4b4d
"}]
commit_message:
Move some tests into nova.tests.unit.notifications.objects.test_instance

This moves the tests which are specific to payloads defined in
nova/objects/notifications/objects/instance.py from the generic
nova.objects.unit.notifications.objects.test_notification into
the more path-appropriate test_instance module. The test_notification
module should probably be renamed to test_base but that's left for
another day.

Change-Id: I1eda20634bd788bc892aaa312bafe87461eb4b4d

commit_message:
Enable management network in network_data

This change enables the management network in network_data to allow
upgrading environments that were initially deployed with this optional
network enabled.

Change-Id: I39b1a70f0a27bdab4d6280d54107ff209d4bb67d
Closes-bug: 1765547
(cherry picked from commit 9932c2841cd37598b5407279f3eae80ad8e3bdea)

commit_message:
Update auth_uri option to www_authenticate_uri

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: Ie0d7c4268a49d3d3c6928b10987dd5eeede683d6

commit_message:
Fix lower constraints and uncap eventlet

Fix the lower constraints settings to match the expected values.

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: Ic44a750002943920c2f517f22df670989460dbc9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 07:38:02.000000000', 'message': 'Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..., None)

Change-Id: I5d59b159b3676a953e04dea20f377c665049fe01
'}]
commit_message:
Using assertIsNone() instead of assertEqual(None)

Following OpenStack Style Guidelines:
[1] http://docs.openstack.org/developer/hacking/#unit-tests-and-assertraises
[H203] Unit test assertions tend to give better messages for more specific
assertions. As a result, assertIsNone(...) is preferred over
assertEqual(None, ...) and assertIs(..., None)

Change-Id: I5d59b159b3676a953e04dea20f377c665049fe01

commit_message:
Replace assertRaisesRegexp with assertRaisesRegex

qinling don't use the unittest module directly, but using unittest2 instead
assertRaisesRegexp is deprecated in unittest2 by assertRaisesRegex, see:
https://hg.python.org/unittest2/rev/27d6829cd8fa#l1.213

Change-Id: I255e2c0453e76d6cb4dd2832d723b6c35241ca9d

commit_message:
Completely remove mox from Masakari unittest

This patch removes mox from masakari/tests/unit/test_service.py
and the base class. Also replaces mox stubs with stub_out in
masakari/tests/unit/api/openstack/test_wsgi.py

Change-Id: If62c43bcd4ff6da93db02c835a14f73ea11471fa
Implements: blueprint mox-removal

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-26 13:51:01.000000000', 'message': 'Add db purge support

Added db purge support to delete the soft-deleted records from tables.
In case of tables 'hosts' and 'failover_segments' the decision to purge
the record is made on the basis of 'deleted' and 'deleted_at' column's
value. However in case of 'notifications' table it is decided on the
basis of 'updated_at' column's value as notifications don't have
'delete' API.

Operator can use the below command to purge the records:

"masakari-manage db purge --age_in_days <days> --max_rows <rows>"

Implements: blueprint Add database purge support

Co-author: Pooja Jadhav <pooja.jadhav@nttdata.com>
Change-Id: Id959b0e2b84d5d2587d6b70b8f695f69634a1d17
'}, {'created': '2017-07-26 13:52:59.000000000', 'message': 'Add db purge support

commit_message:
Add db purge support

Added db purge support to delete the soft-deleted records from tables.
In case of tables 'hosts' and 'failover_segments' the decision to purge
the record is made on the basis of 'deleted' and 'deleted_at' column's
value. However in case of 'notifications' table it is decided on the
basis of 'updated_at' column's value as notifications don't have
'delete' API.

Operator can use the below command to purge the records:

"masakari-manage db purge --age_in_days <days> --max_rows <rows>"

Implements: blueprint db-purge-support

Co-author: Pooja Jadhav <pooja.jadhav@nttdata.com>
Change-Id: Id959b0e2b84d5d2587d6b70b8f695f69634a1d17

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

Uncap eventlet at the same time to make the requirements match the
global list.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I3d4c66be32a7e5f1bae11fcba9491f9e26b59bb6
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Support Service Queue in Client

Introduce X-Service-Token and X-Service-Delegated-Project-ID
in client to support service queue when posting messages.

Change-Id: Ia9ebea798ade7b16c613b57f61729dc73af103c8

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-05-31 06:46:45.000000000', 'message': "[POC]Service Queue In Zaqar

1.Implement the listing service queues with
  HTTP Header: 'Managed-Type: service'.

2.Implement the getting messages from service queue
  with service queue's name and HTTP Header: 'Managed-Type: service'.

When creating service queue, user need to set new metadata in
request body: 'allowed_projects: project_id1,project_id2,...,project_idn'.

Change-Id: I3d55a72c4a1ba4f9012e5c13a6efd1dd71119c2d
Implements: bp service-queue-in-zaqar
"}, {'created': '2017-06-01 09:10:21.000000000', 'message': '[POC]Service Queue In Zaqar

Implement OpenStack Service can post messages

to service queue with service token and X-Service-Delegated-Project-ID.

Change-Id: I3d55a72c4a1ba4f9012e5c13a6efd1dd71119c2d
Implements: bp service-queue-in-zaqar
'}, {'created': '2017-06-01 09:48:40.000000000', 'message': '[POC]Service Queue In Zaqar

commit_message:
Support hostname in show, update and delete host operations

The Blazar CLI doesn't support show, update and delete host operations
with hostname. It only accepts id because host uses a key called
hypervisor_hostname, rather one called name like for leases.

This patch enables the Blazar CLI to support hostname as well.

Change-Id: I3a7a3307099ed518d89de37039f9366770a21ce2
Closes-Bug: #1702266

commit_message:
Narrow race in _replicate_object

We use an optimistic "lock" to make the state of the broker we're
replicating hasn't changed since we started replicating before deleting.

There's still a small window after the final check for max_row and
delete_db but it's much better than the unguarded window for the
entirety of replication to all nodes.

If the replicator starts into a db while the sharder is still pumping it
full of cleaved objects we'll skip the delete at the end and pick it up
on the next pass.

Co-Authored-By: Alistair Coles <alistairncoles@gmail.com>

Change-Id: I8ac8552a317fe6b492870f4a5fa83f20428e8e6c

commit_message:
Stop removing root uuid in vendor interfaces

Now that driver_internal_info.root_uuid_or_disk_id is removed by the
conductor when tearing down a node, it is no longer necessary to
remove it in each vendor interface.

Change-Id: I7a6a41cda4d009e077261b3fee707cd601142f86

[{'created': '2018-04-06 11:24:32.000000000', 'message': "Fix error handling in set_provision_state/set_power_state workflows

Currently these workflows succeed in any case, since we don't have
any condition to fail. This change makes them fail if the resulting
state does not match the expected one.

It also handles the case when a node goes into one of the failure
states, so that we don't wait until timeout. Proper error message
is returned to avoid confusing operators.

Finally, it reduces the traffic between mistral and ironic by only
requesting the required fields.

Conflicts:
	workbooks/baremetal.yaml

Partial-Bug: #1755754
Closes-Bug: #1667776
Change-Id: Ice19306d4c4a2080b0337bc02a6ccee4a81411b5
(cherry picked from commit d97cd4a00556457914b783282c544b5233af0260)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix error handling in set_provision_state/set_power_state workflows

Currently these workflows succeed in any case, since we don't have
any condition to fail. This change makes them fail if the resulting
state does not match the expected one.

It also handles the case when a node goes into one of the failure
states, so that we don't wait until timeout. Proper error message
is returned to avoid confusing operators.

Finally, it reduces the traffic between mistral and ironic by only
requesting the required fields.

Conflicts:
	workbooks/baremetal.yaml

Partial-Bug: #1755754
Closes-Bug: #1667776
Change-Id: Ice19306d4c4a2080b0337bc02a6ccee4a81411b5
(cherry picked from commit d97cd4a00556457914b783282c544b5233af0260)

Change-Id: Ife3436a1fc451974f80893c69f087eca839b2d03
"}]
commit_message:
Remove TODO re find_local_handoff_for_part returning None

find_local_handoff_for_part() returning None implies that no mounted
local device is currently in the ring. There's not much more we can do
than raise an exception.

Change-Id: Ife3436a1fc451974f80893c69f087eca839b2d03

subject: ovn: Mount /run instead of /run/openvswitch when starting ovn-controller container
messages: [{'account_id': 10237, 'date': '2018-04-19 10:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-04-19 10:38:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2018-04-19 10:38:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: -Workflow'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-04-23 16:42:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 10:32:54.000000000', 'message': 'ovn: Mount /run instead of /run/openvswitch when starting ovn-controller container

Presently ovn-controller container is started with "-v /run/openvswitch:/run/openvswitch".
The openvswitch systemd script deletes the /run/openvswitch folder when stopping it in the host.
/run/openvswitch path inside the ovn-controller container becomes a stale directory.
And when the service is started again, it creates the folder again. In order for ovn-controller
to access again, the folder has to be remounted or the ovn-controller container should be
restarted.

As a temporary fix, this patch mounts /run so that when /run/openvswitch is created again, it will
get reflected inside the ovn-controller container. The proper fix has to come from openvswitch
systemd script to not delete /run/openvswitch when stopping the service. This is presently
discusses in OVS mailing list [1], but no proper solution has been arrived yet.

[1] - https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-dev/2018-March/345589.html
Closes-bug: #1764745
Change-Id: I032571cec49537cac972ebbbb44733ea17c299fa
(cherry picked from commit - 49963bc180139300afc1a968bfab3f2904f2c09d)
'}]
commit_message:
ovn: Mount /run instead of /run/openvswitch when starting ovn-controller container

Presently ovn-controller container is started with "-v /run/openvswitch:/run/openvswitch".
The openvswitch systemd script deletes the /run/openvswitch folder when stopping it in the host.
/run/openvswitch path inside the ovn-controller container becomes a stale directory.
And when the service is started again, it creates the folder again. In order for ovn-controller
to access again, the folder has to be remounted or the ovn-controller container should be
restarted.

As a temporary fix, this patch mounts /run so that when /run/openvswitch is created again, it will
get reflected inside the ovn-controller container. The proper fix has to come from openvswitch
systemd script to not delete /run/openvswitch when stopping the service. This is presently
discusses in OVS mailing list [1], but no proper solution has been arrived yet.

[1] - https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-dev/2018-March/345589.html
Closes-bug: #1764745
Change-Id: I032571cec49537cac972ebbbb44733ea17c299fa
(cherry picked from commit - 49963bc180139300afc1a968bfab3f2904f2c09d)

commit_message:
Abort rsync_then_merge if destination db has started sharding

If a container db starts to shard, or even completes, while an rsync
then merge is in process to that db, then try hard to abort the
rsync_then_merge.

Check for abort before starting to merge from existing db to the rsync
db, then again before renaming the rsync db.

Change-Id: Ib285efbadb222b7c843fc212e5ae912ccd7b7ead

messages: [{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-23 19:36:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-23 19:38:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]

The PUT referred to by the inaccurate TODO statement is only for shards
in sharding state, and not for deleted shards. It is ok to push
*sharding* shard range state from the root to the shard container
early, rather than waiting for the shard to discover the state change
during the audit function.

Change-Id: I5de3335d0b98511b7c84f5a94c0619b82ffff429

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary TODO re pushing shard range state from root

The PUT referred to by the inaccurate TODO statement is only for shards
in sharding state, and not for deleted shards. It is ok to push
*sharding* shard range state from the root to the shard container
early, rather than waiting for the shard to discover the state change
during the audit function.

Change-Id: I5de3335d0b98511b7c84f5a94c0619b82ffff429

subject: Remove a won't-fix TODO
messages: [{'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-23 19:29:56.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7847, 'date': '2018-04-23 19:39:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1 Code-Review+2'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 19:29:56.000000000', 'message': "Remove a won't-fix TODO

When creating shard ranges, a shard will update root with summary of
all newly created sub-shard containers.  There does not seem to be any
need to prevent progress if this summary update fails. The sharder
will atempt to update the root at the end of each visit to a
container, and any successfully created containers will also begin to
notify the root of their existence.

Change-Id: Idaba5384a8fe47dbb072bc0e2b679360691c6cfc
"}]
commit_message:
Remove a won't-fix TODO

When creating shard ranges, a shard will update root with summary of
all newly created sub-shard containers.  There does not seem to be any
need to prevent progress if this summary update fails. The sharder
will atempt to update the root at the end of each visit to a
container, and any successfully created containers will also begin to
notify the root of their existence.

Change-Id: Idaba5384a8fe47dbb072bc0e2b679360691c6cfc

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-23 15:53:55.000000000', 'message': "fix vpnaas subnet_list_or_none type

The validate_subnet_list_or_none validator was rehomed into lib as part
of [1] and registered with the type of 'subnet_list_or_none'. While this
is a good type name, vpnaas already adds a validator with that type in
their master branch today [2]. As a result, running with neutron-lib
master can fail due to re-registration [3]. The way we've addressed this
in the past is to use a new type name in neutron-lib and then just
ensure the new type is used upon consumption.

This patch renames the validation type subnet_list_or_none to
list_of_subnets_or_none to address the issue [3].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/439972/
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/blob/master/
neutron_vpnaas/extensions/vpnaas.py#L177
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/
vmware-nsx/master/openstack-tox-py35-with-neutron-lib-master/227d2f0/
job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-23_06_17_55_841555

Change-Id: If1713edb26fd923047f2f6c022f0557b2f3ec41e
"}]
commit_message:
fix vpnaas subnet_list_or_none type

The validate_subnet_list_or_none validator was rehomed into lib as part
of [1] and registered with the type of 'subnet_list_or_none'. While this
is a good type name, vpnaas already adds a validator with that type in
their master branch today [2]. As a result, running with neutron-lib
master can fail due to re-registration [3]. The way we've addressed this
in the past is to use a new type name in neutron-lib and then just
ensure the new type is used upon consumption.

This patch renames the validation type subnet_list_or_none to
list_of_subnets_or_none to address the issue [3].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/439972/
[2] https://github.com/openstack/neutron-vpnaas/blob/master/
neutron_vpnaas/extensions/vpnaas.py#L177
[3] http://logs.openstack.org/periodic/git.openstack.org/openstack/
vmware-nsx/master/openstack-tox-py35-with-neutron-lib-master/227d2f0/
job-output.txt.gz#_2018-04-23_06_17_55_841555

Change-Id: If1713edb26fd923047f2f6c022f0557b2f3ec41e

commit_message:
Stop using slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh

Migrate the legacy job to start using our bindep role from zuul-jobs.
This will allow openstack-infra to delete
slave_scripts/install-distro-packages.sh in the future.

Change-Id: Iffb98325afcabe73655e4d608ff15976000c3629
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Put the interop repo back in the interop SB group

Change I949e17351ce5f9ea5f12120c2599d725eda6dcc1 seems to have
inadvertently removed the openstack/interop repo from the interop
project group on storyboard.openstack.org when the repo was renamed
from defcore. Reestablish its membership in that group now.

Change-Id: I9bff89c5d7e27c906a879c2709675660b525c24d

commit_message:
Rename API WG -> SIG on specs.openstack.org and in projects.yaml

The repo where the specs live is still labeled 'api-wg' (and there's
no compelling reason to change), but the link on specs.openstack.org
will make more sense for contemporary users with 'API SIG'.

Also update the group's name in projects.yaml

Change-Id: I427267cb0c1a57b56a3d092158d2b4906e096440

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-20 13:45:23.000000000', 'message': 'Remove pycodestyle version pin. Add E402 and W503 to ignore.

Rather than pinning pycodestyle, ignore the E402 and W503 error. Fix
issue with E731 (Do not assign a lambda expression, use a def).

W503 is something we will likely never enable as it is a personal
style decision and can change depending on the code. There is no one
right answer. Interestingly there is also a W504 which is the opposite
check.

E402 is one we should most likely fix. But it can be done in a follow
patch or patches.

List of various error codes:
https://pycodestyle.readthedocs.io/en/latest/intro.html#error-codes

Change-Id: Ie2c31a8a3c75beeef22453cab5878cf0094bdf3f
(cherry picked from commit ca91d4d871bae437da2c6173e7a0aad5c3b44532)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove pycodestyle version pin. Add E402 and W503 to ignore.

Rather than pinning pycodestyle, ignore the E402 and W503 error. Fix
issue with E731 (Do not assign a lambda expression, use a def).

W503 is something we will likely never enable as it is a personal
style decision and can change depending on the code. There is no one
right answer. Interestingly there is also a W504 which is the opposite
check.

E402 is one we should most likely fix. But it can be done in a follow
patch or patches.

List of various error codes:
https://pycodestyle.readthedocs.io/en/latest/intro.html#error-codes

Change-Id: Ie2c31a8a3c75beeef22453cab5878cf0094bdf3f
(cherry picked from commit ca91d4d871bae437da2c6173e7a0aad5c3b44532)

Just wondering what we should do about the fact that we'll skip over the call to encryptor.detach_volume() if guest.detach_device_with_retry() raises exception.DeviceNotFound

I wonder if we could move that call down to just above the call to self._disconnect_volume()?  That would be very similar to what ends up happening in master.  The difference would be that we'd call it for the exception.InstanceNotFound and libvirt.libvirtError/libvirt.VIR_ERR_NO_DOMAIN cases."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-12 02:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I still think this is okay for backport. It fixes a problem users are having with retrying a heat stack delete that has previously failed because of a busy device. This allows a heat stack delete to be retried and succeed later when the device is no longer busy.

The deviations from the original patch are because: 1) we had encryption-related refactoring on master that we did not backport and 2) we could not bump upper-constraints on stable, even though the relevant os-brick changes to handle exit code 4 were backported to stable/pike for os-brick.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-19 19:58:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> 2) we could not bump upper-constraints on stable, even though the relevant os-brick changes to handle exit code 4 were backported to stable/pike for os-brick.

Slight correction: we can't bump the lower constraint on stable branches, but we can (and sometimes do) bump upper-constraints. We just don't touch lower-constraints because we assume that once GA a branch the minimum requirements are frozen."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-19 19:59:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

> > 2) we could not bump upper-constraints on stable, even though the
 > relevant os-brick changes to handle exit code 4 were backported to
 > stable/pike for os-brick.
 > 
 > Slight correction: we can't bump the lower constraint on stable
 > branches, but we can (and sometimes do) bump upper-constraints. We
 > just don't touch lower-constraints because we assume that once GA a
 > branch the minimum requirements are frozen.

Argh, right -- I don't know why I keep making that mistake. I keep saying upper-constraints when I really mean lower-constraints. Sorry."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-19 20:02:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck bug 1761798'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-19 20:04:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

Overall I'm OK with this backport for the reasons melwitt pointed out. -1 is for an issue in the warning message."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-19 20:04:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Published edit on patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-04-19 20:04:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2018-04-19 20:28:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-19 21:55:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-11 23:30:45.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: disconnect volume from host during detach

Under certain failure scenarios it may be that although the libvirt
definition for the volume has been removed for the instance that the
associated storage lun on the compute server may not have been fully
cleaned up yet.

In case users try an other attempt to detach volume we should not stop
the process whether the device is not found in domain definition but
try to disconnect the logical device from host.

This commit makes the process to attempt a disconnect volume even if
the device is not attached to the guest.

Closes-Bug: #1727260
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

(cherry picked from commit ce531dd1b763704b9043ddde8e80ac99cd193660)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE: The conflicts were due to the newer testcase mocking
'nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host._get_domain' where the older code calls
'nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host.get_domain', and also dealing with the
fact that the older code doesn't pass 'encryption' to
self._disconnect_volume().

This latter issue means that we won't call encryptor.detach_volume()
if we hit exception.DeviceNotFound when detaching the device from
the guest.  For that we'd need something similar to commit cd3eb60c.

Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I4182642aab3fd2ffb1c97d2de9bdca58982289d8
"}, {'created': '2018-04-12 16:50:01.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: disconnect volume from host during detach

NOTE: The conflicts were due to the newer testcase mocking
'nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host._get_domain' where the older code calls
'nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host.get_domain', and also dealing with the
fact that the older code doesn't pass 'encryption' to
self._disconnect_volume().

This latter issue means that we need to move the call to
encryptor.detach_volume() to ensure it gets called if we hit
exception.DeviceNotFound when detaching the device from
the guest.  This is similar to the original code proposed
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515008/9/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py

Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I4182642aab3fd2ffb1c97d2de9bdca58982289d8
"}, {'created': '2018-04-12 20:39:30.000000000', 'message': "libvirt: disconnect volume from host during detach

Under certain failure scenarios it may be that although the libvirt
definition for the volume has been removed for the instance that the
associated storage lun on the compute server may not have been fully
cleaned up yet.

try to disconnect the logical device from host.

This commit makes the process to attempt a disconnect volume even if
the device is not attached to the guest.

Closes-Bug: #1727260
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

(cherry picked from commit d6a072b5c5a3ff9de7f4b42cda517ead17efe561)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE: The conflicts were due to the newer testcase mocking
'nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host._get_domain' where the older code calls
'nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host.get_domain', and also dealing with the
fact that the older code doesn't pass 'encryption' to
self._disconnect_volume().

This latter issue means that we need to move the call to
encryptor.detach_volume() to ensure it gets called if we hit
exception.DeviceNotFound when detaching the device from
the guest.  This is similar to the original code proposed
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515008/9/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py
but it requires special handling for the scenario where cryptsetup
tries to destroy a dm-crypt device that has already been destroyed.

Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I4182642aab3fd2ffb1c97d2de9bdca58982289d8

fact that the older code doesn't pass 'encryption' to
self._disconnect_volume().

This latter issue means that we need to move the call to
encryptor.detach_volume() to ensure it gets called if we hit
exception.DeviceNotFound when detaching the device from
the guest.  This is similar to the original code proposed
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515008/9/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py
but it requires special handling for the scenario where cryptsetup
tries to destroy a dm-crypt device that has already been destroyed.

Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I4182642aab3fd2ffb1c97d2de9bdca58982289d8

commit_message:
libvirt: disconnect volume from host during detach

Under certain failure scenarios it may be that although the libvirt
definition for the volume has been removed for the instance that the
associated storage lun on the compute server may not have been fully
cleaned up yet.

In case users try an other attempt to detach volume we should not stop
the process whether the device is not found in domain definition but
try to disconnect the logical device from host.

This commit makes the process to attempt a disconnect volume even if
the device is not attached to the guest.

Closes-Bug: #1727260
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@redhat.com>

(cherry picked from commit ce531dd1b763704b9043ddde8e80ac99cd193660)
(cherry picked from commit d6a072b5c5a3ff9de7f4b42cda517ead17efe561)

Conflicts:
	nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py

NOTE: The conflicts were due to the newer testcase mocking
'nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host._get_domain' where the older code calls
'nova.virt.libvirt.host.Host.get_domain', and also dealing with the
fact that the older code doesn't pass 'encryption' to
self._disconnect_volume().

This latter issue means that we need to move the call to
encryptor.detach_volume() to ensure it gets called if we hit
exception.DeviceNotFound when detaching the device from
the guest.  This is similar to the original code proposed
in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/515008/9/nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py
but it requires special handling for the scenario where cryptsetup
tries to destroy a dm-crypt device that has already been destroyed.

Signed-off-by: Chris Friesen <chris.friesen@windriver.com>
Change-Id: I4182642aab3fd2ffb1c97d2de9bdca58982289d8
