commit_message:
Refactor publish-openstack-releasenotes

Create an abstract base job, and then two final versions of it
for python2 and python3.

This removes duplication and hopefully makes the resulting jobs
easier to maintain.

Change-Id: Ie2d4b45e6fc7cc7165e064669b8304914399c15e

Because publish-openstack-releasenotes is final we need to add a new
job to use when publishing release notes for projects using python 3
instead of being able to just use a variant with sphinx_python set.

See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2018-April/000854.html
for a failure message.

Change-Id: I453b053f6ea670a841b55c93fe1995a0395403ab
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
add publish-openstack-releasenotes-python3

Because publish-openstack-releasenotes is final we need to add a new
job to use when publishing release notes for projects using python 3
instead of being able to just use a variant with sphinx_python set.

See
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/release-job-failures/2018-April/000854.html
for a failure message.

Change-Id: I453b053f6ea670a841b55c93fe1995a0395403ab
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Enable tempest tests for application credentials

In Queens and later, the application credentials feature is available on
keystone and enabled by default. It should be tested in devstack.

Depends-on: https://review.openstack.org/545627
Change-Id: I4b0dc823487e79df16e1e603012ba4a7dc438389

commit_message:
Add identity API version discovery

This patch adds a utility to the keystone API manager to retrieve the
identity endpoint's version data and retrieve the current version as a
tuple. As part of this work, this patch converts the deprecated usage of
keystoneclient alone to using keystoneclient in combination with a
keystoneauth session.

Change-Id: I37031b67ab2681e81022a75afcb4f41c5700c47b

commit_message:
Add tests for application credentials

Application credentials were implemented in keystone in Queens. This
patch adds test for create, retrieval, and deleting application
credentials and ensures that application credentials that are created
can be used for authentication. Updating application credentials is not
supported.

bp application-credentials

Change-Id: I3272fee2881fb918fe83961774f4bd27e30cee02

commit_message:
Handle libvirt/cpu_model_extra_flags option

This allows for specifying granular CPU feature flags when specifying
CPU models.
It should be set only if 'cpu_mode' and 'cpu_model' attributes are set
and cpu_mode attribute value is set to "custom".

NOTE: The related nova changes are done in change:
I6bb956808aa3df58747c865c92e5b276e61aff44

Change-Id: Id4f2cad2e0b0c34a7a68d0b3a6f69b44816f4cd9
(cherry picked from commit c12e3580287911a355de8bdf2fdd4c37c38d7fec)

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com//nova/521875/3/ : FAILURE in 6h 29m 36s'}, {'account_id': 7634, 'date': '2017-11-27 07:42:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Just a question.
Why is comma-separated values used in one parameter ('include')?

* GET /resource_providers?include=aggregates,inventories,traits

It can be separated query parameters as follows.

* GET /resource_providers?aggregates=True&inventories=True&traits=True"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-23 21:38:32.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Folks have expressed a preference for lots of smaller calls and reduced API complexity/breadth, until and unless a serious performance problem can be demonstrated that would be assuaged by something like this.  Will resurrect this idea if that happens.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-21 15:00:35.000000000', 'message': "WIP: placement: GET /RPs with aggs, inventories, traits

In a new microversion, the GET /resource_providers API accepts a new
`include` query parameter, whose value is a comma-separated list of
any of the keywords `aggregates`, `inventories`, `traits`.  Each keyword
causes the respective information to be included in the response payload
for each resource provider under a key of the same name.

The immediate motivation for this is SchedulerReportClient, which is
retrieving and caching provider information via ProviderTree.  Currently
it must do this via many separate API calls.  Roughly:

 all_rps = api.get('/resource_providers?tree=%s' %
                   rp.uuid)['resource_providers']
 for one_rp in all_rps:
     if one_rp.parent_provider_uuid:
         prov_tree.add_root(...)
     else:
         prov_tree.new_child(...)
     aggs = api.get('/resource_providers/%s/aggregates' % one_rp.uuid)
     prov_tree.update_aggregates(one_rp.uuid, aggs)
     invs = api.get('/resource_providers/%s/inventories' % one_rp.uuid)
     prov_tree.update_inventories(one_rp.uuid, invs)
     traits = api.get('/resource_providers/%s/traits' % one_rp.uuid)
     prov_tree.update_traits(one_rp.uuid, traits)

So for T providers in the tree, we're doing 3T+1 calls to the placement
API.  With this change set, we bring that down to one:

 all_rps = api.get('/resource_providers?tree=%s&'
                   'include=aggregates,inventories,traits' %
                   rp.uuid)['resource_providers']
 for one_rp in all_rps:
     if one_rp.parent_provider_uuid:
         prov_tree.add_root(...)
     else:
         prov_tree.new_child(...)
     prov_tree.update_aggregates(one_rp.uuid, one_rp['aggregates'])
     prov_tree.update_inventories(one_rp.uuid, one_rp['inventories'])
     prov_tree.update_traits(one_rp.uuid, one_rp['traits'])

(IRL we'll also need to pull the providers associated with the
aggregates, and their inventories and traits; for simplicity, I omitted
that from the example.)

WIP: Gabbits

Change-Id: I1724fbd0bab4e927f5af43385efefee6f2df166d

commit_message:
placement: GET /RPs with aggs, inventories, traits

In a new microversion, the GET /resource_providers API accepts a new
`include` query parameter, whose value is a comma-separated list of
any of the keywords `aggregates`, `inventories`, `traits`.  Each keyword
causes the respective information to be included in the response payload
for each resource provider under a key of the same name.

The immediate motivation for this is SchedulerReportClient, which is
retrieving and caching provider information via ProviderTree.  Currently
it must do this via many separate API calls.  Roughly:

 all_rps = api.get('/resource_providers?tree=%s' %
                   rp.uuid)['resource_providers']
 for one_rp in all_rps:
     if one_rp.parent_provider_uuid:
         prov_tree.add_root(...)
     else:
         prov_tree.new_child(...)
     aggs = api.get('/resource_providers/%s/aggregates' % one_rp.uuid)
     prov_tree.update_aggregates(one_rp.uuid, aggs)
     invs = api.get('/resource_providers/%s/inventories' % one_rp.uuid)
     prov_tree.update_inventories(one_rp.uuid, invs)
     traits = api.get('/resource_providers/%s/traits' % one_rp.uuid)
     prov_tree.update_traits(one_rp.uuid, traits)

So for T providers in the tree, we're doing 3T+1 calls to the placement
API.  With this change set, we bring that down to one (i.e. a minimum 4x
reduction in the number of API calls):

 all_rps = api.get('/resource_providers?tree=%s&'
                   'include=aggregates,inventories,traits' %
                   rp.uuid)['resource_providers']
 for one_rp in all_rps:
     if one_rp.parent_provider_uuid:
         prov_tree.add_root(...)
     else:
         prov_tree.new_child(...)
     prov_tree.update_aggregates(one_rp.uuid, one_rp['aggregates'])
     prov_tree.update_inventories(one_rp.uuid, one_rp['inventories'])
     prov_tree.update_traits(one_rp.uuid, one_rp['traits'])

(IRL we'll also need to pull the providers associated with the
aggregates, and their inventories and traits; for simplicity, I omitted
that from the example.)

Change-Id: I1724fbd0bab4e927f5af43385efefee6f2df166d

Ah, the scripts-library stuff should all be || true - so yeah, checking for the binary presence would be better as it won't always apply. revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-17 17:46:41.000000000', 'message': "Ensure zfsutils-linux is installed by default

zfs is called in scripts/scripts-library.sh and if zfs isn't
used, the package isn't installed and the script fails.  This
moves zfs to be installed along with other filesystem tools.

Change-Id: I2ecfd4bac657f3bd2d901b85909e73f77e39e510
"}, {'created': '2018-04-23 17:45:43.000000000', 'message': 'Only run zfs command if command is present

zfs package is only installed under certain options, so
only run the zfs command in scripts-library if the command is
installed

Change-Id: I2ecfd4bac657f3bd2d901b85909e73f77e39e510
'}]
commit_message:
Only run zfs command if command is present

zfs package is only installed under certain options, so
only run the zfs command in scripts-library if the command is
installed

Change-Id: I2ecfd4bac657f3bd2d901b85909e73f77e39e510

commit_message:
Remove deprecated [placement] opts

[placement]os_region_name has been deprecated in favor of
[placement]region_name [1], and other usages removed [2].

[placement]os_interfaces has been deprecated in favor of
[placement]valid_interfaces.

This change removes the deprecated options, for the requisite time hath
elapsed.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/492247/
[2] Iea7d5d0d6907adbcb236dc43b5af7469de2ba78b

Change-Id: Ide57fecf92a22c13884b872b3007e77a059e8b08

[{'created': '2018-04-23 14:21:07.000000000', 'message': "Move the tests around so pcmk_resource_has_changed? does not get triggered

There is likely a bug lurking in how we do deep_compare of
pacemaker_remote resources. This should not even have been
triggered unless the deep_compare parameter is set to true.
Let's move the tests around so, as per design, we do not
even invoke the functions to compare resources in depth.

"}]
commit_message:
Move the tests around so pcmk_resource_has_changed? does not get triggered

There is likely a bug lurking in how we do deep_compare of
pacemaker_remote resources. This should not even have been
triggered unless the deep_compare parameter is set to true.
Let's move the tests around so, as per design, we do not
even invoke the functions to compare resources in depth.

Change-Id: I5e7c28794db8b8b60d9d7598a1bb9f8b758484e0

commit_message:
Slighty widen race in _replicate_object

Take out check for new shard range rows.

Make DatabaseBroker.is_reclaimable() more efficient
by avoiding unnecessary db hits.

Drive-by: tweak to debug message and add extra unit
test assertion.

Change-Id: Iefbf6e3d80f697b282fd08cb54eac61f55d1e849
Related-Change: I8ac8552a317fe6b492870f4a5fa83f20428e8e6c

commit_message:
Firewall: NOT persist ephemetal ironic-inspector rules

When Ironic Inspector is configured to use the iptables
pxe_filter driver it uses ephemeral firewall rules. This
change ensures that these rules are not persisted.

Ironic Inspector iptables filter driver does not set
comments on it's rules. This patch use the string:
'-m comment --comment' to ensure rules created by
puppet-tripleo firewall is not accidentally removed from
the persisted firewall rules.

Change-Id: Ic90804db8dd74fce78169d9857a150d5ebf40cbb
Related-Bug: #1765700

commit_message:
Telemetry services need to access to Storage

Gnocchi stores data in Swift or Ceph. So when composable roles are used
it needs to access to the Storage network to connect to them.

Change-Id: I11f4ec4a91a9240bde6d504a84351185ed5a6997

* include instance id in dataplane instance logs:
  have self._run_command use instance logger in a dataplane

* rename _log_output_error into _log_stdx_if to avoid
  matching _log_output_error when grepping for errors

* improve API error messages on IP/MAC inconsistencies

* have classes used as singleton use a short __repr_
  so that method call DEBUG logs are shorter

* have route table manager log more details in case

commit_message:
bagpipe-bgp: API error reporting and logging improvements

* include instance id in dataplane instance logs:
  have self._run_command use instance logger in a dataplane
  instance, so that instance id is present in logs.

* rename _log_output_error into _log_stdx_if to avoid
  matching _log_output_error when grepping for errors

* improve API error messages on IP/MAC inconsistencies

* have classes used as singleton use a short __repr_
  so that method call DEBUG logs are shorter

* have route table manager log more details in case
  of an already advertized route

* have method call logger decorator be a little less
  versbose (ommit module)

Change-Id: I6be08e84bd8ffa458cb44a7de800706a191b38d4

bagpipe-bgp: improve API error reporting

Change-Id: Ie40d742604e0474e00fd813dd4ff7d0bf1f52658

commit_message:
Add network_mode for image building

Add the ability to specify a different network_mode when running the
image builds. Under the covers the default is to use bridge networking
but if that is unavailable or a user would like to specify a different
networking  method they can now do so using the [DEFAULT]\network_mode
configuration.

Change-Id: I1d2398273b57ca4d52bbfacbc896ffecc58bc54b

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-04-19 17:08:18.000000000', 'message': "Leave a hint when populate_schema fails

While writing a test I was hitting DB failures in populate_schema
because the test was using the NoDBTestCase but a field was
getting lazy-loaded on the object which failed, but I couldn't tell
what field it was failing on without this.

Change-Id: I9b8b0e3b4c77acca57c4adc40bec4f4638253308
"}]
commit_message:
Leave a hint when populate_schema fails

While writing a test I was hitting DB failures in populate_schema
because the test was using the NoDBTestCase but a field was
getting lazy-loaded on the object which failed, but I couldn't tell
what field it was failing on without this.

Change-Id: I9b8b0e3b4c77acca57c4adc40bec4f4638253308

(1 comment)

So the neutron postgres job succeeded... but it also succeeded in the previous patch, which means we're not hitting this path.  It would be nice to have that happening, but I don't know that we should hold up merging this one while we wait for that to be done.

IOW, if you rebase this one to get the predecessor out of the way, I'll still be in favor of merging it."}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2018-04-19 12:59:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Build succeeded.

- nova-dsvm-full-tempest http://cloudbase-ci.com/nova/562379/6/ : SUCCESS in 3h 24m 25s'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:06:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

> So the neutron postgres job succeeded... but it also succeeded in
 > the previous patch, which means we're not hitting this path.  It
 > would be nice to have that happening, but I don't know that we
 > should hold up merging this one while we wait for that to be done.

As I commented in the previous patch, the tempest coverage doesn't exercise the exact database conditions that cause postgres to complain. We could add a failing functional test somewhere that (probably) does it, but that won't change the fact that we want the experimental job around anyway, so what difference does changing the parent of this patch make. We still want it for future uses."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:29:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)

> we want the experimental job around anyway

Okay, I wasn't sure about that - thought it might have just been thrown up there for a look-see.

But the parent patch has now been abandoned (FYI, last time I saw this situation the "orphaned" patch refused to merge until it was rebased) so it's moot.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:32:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:35:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Matt identified that we already had a postgres job in the experimental queue. Neither it nor the newer job failed without this change, but that's because there's no tempest test that re-creates the conditions where this is a failure. If we really wanted to we could create a tempest test that did that, but it seems excessive, at least in the short term. What I'd prefer to do in the long term is make it possible to run a functional testing environment that uses postgres instead of sqlite. I made a pass at this last night and was too tired to get it to work. 

Then the  specific scenario [1] that produced the problem could be used directly.

[1] https://github.com/cdent/placecat/blob/master/gabbits/two-computes.yaml"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2018-04-19 13:37:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-04-19 14:30:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

[{'created': '2018-04-18 20:29:45.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add root provider uuid to group by clause

Without the group by, postgres complains with:

  column "root_rp.uuid" must appear in the GROUP BY clause or be
  used in an aggregate function

which is a common complaint between mysql and postgresql.

This problem was discovered using my placedock container[1] with
a postgres database. The change that causes this to be necessary
must be relatively recent as this wasn't happening last week.

Pushing this up in case we can figure some easy way to test and
bisect (for edification). Also so we can debate if we're database
independent or not.

Change-Id: I9fb3db0d7e025fff8836d01f60bb035fb1c59758

commit_message:
Add root and parent provider uuid to group by clause

Without the group by, postgres complains with:

  column "root_rp.uuid" must appear in the GROUP BY clause or be
  used in an aggregate function

which is a common complaint between mysql and postgresql. After
that is fixed, it complains about parent_rp.uuid.

This problem was discovered using my placedock container[1] with
a postgres database. The change that causes this to be necessary
must be relatively recent as this wasn't happening last week.

The problem can show up when the outer join to the root_rp and
parent_rp copies of the resource_providers table can only produce
a single row. The joins to those aliased tables are what is
upsetting postgresql.

[1] https://hub.docker.com/r/cdent/placedock/

Closes-Bug: 1765204
Change-Id: I9fb3db0d7e025fff8836d01f60bb035fb1c59758

commit_message:
Add job to run tempest-full with Python 3.6

We use Ubuntu Bionic (18.04 LTS) as it has got python3.6 as default
python3 interpreter.

Change-Id: Ie86e3fe6c84cb8d6f1915f302976d472461ed678

At PTG we have discussed something like if scrubber is already running in the background then we should exit with error. In this patch you are only checking that srubber should not be launched as daemon if you want to restore the image.

I guess you need to add this check as well.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-19 06:19:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> At PTG we have discussed something like if scrubber is already
 > running in the background then we should exit with error. In this
 > patch you are only checking that srubber should not be launched as
 > daemon if you want to restore the image.
 > 
 > I guess you need to add this check as well.

oh, yeah. I forget that. Thanks for reminding.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-19 10:44:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7:

> > At PTG we have discussed something like if scrubber is already
 > > running in the background then we should exit with error. In this
 > > patch you are only checking that srubber should not be launched
 > as
 > > daemon if you want to restore the image.
 > >
 > > I guess you need to add this check as well.
 > 
 > oh, yeah. I forget that. Thanks for reminding.

yeah, it is. But after deep thinking, I find it's hard to check the scrubber running because the scrubber process may be started in many ways.
1. Use glance-control, in this way, there is a pid file exist when the scrubber is running. Then we can check this file here, but it's hard to know where is the pid file, by default, it is in /var/run/glance/glance-scrubber.pid, but it can be changed by "glance-control <pid-file>", then it's hard to find the pid file.

2. If the scrubber is started in other way, such as: "glance-scrubber --daemon" or "python -m glance.cmd.glance" or even the downstream use it own tools, it's hard to check the which process is glance-scrubber.

I can write some checks, but we should know that it's hard to cover all cases.

So should we add a simple reference check or just leave as it is?'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-19 12:35:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 15054, 'date': '2018-03-20 06:48:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2018-03-20 07:35:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

commit_message:
Pending-delete rollback ability

Now there is no way to revert the pending-delete images. Once the
admin operators want to revert the delete action, Glance should
give them this kind of ability.

This patch will enhance the glance-scrubber tool to support restoring
the image from pending-delete to active.

Change-Id: I11fe58403e3af102b63d15b3cc702e567e526bad
blueprint: pending-delete-rollback

commit_message:
Add 'inspect wait' as a valid state

ironic-inspector checks node provision state before starting hardware
introspection, to allow inspection for node at inspect wait state,
this state has to be added to ironic-inspector.

Story: #1725211
Task: #11372
Change-Id: I89d9dfb85e191e781d869374911950d322fc227e
Partial-Bug: #1725211

commit_message:
Fix graphite queries for neutron-lib periodic dashboard

This patch updates the graphite targets queried for the neutron-lib
grafana dashboard. These targets are important for understanding our
pre-release health. For more details see discussion started at [1].

[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-infra/
%23openstack-infra.2018-04-23.log.html#t2018-04-23T16:16:44

Change-Id: Ie0ef7102c20b60558cb758aff607e87e5bbb9047

commit_message:
xenapi: Documents update for XAPI pool shared SR migration

xenapi is going to support pool-based multi-hosts OpenStack
environments, aggregate-based-pools support was removed in
change I2c492c46e85c1df96aa7fdc12cdee0b1c7ba775e.
This patch is used to update related OpenStack documents.

Change-Id: I9a1244fb23aea99eb246325d5655ab005dca42b4
Implements: blueprint live-migration-in-xapi-pool

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720


Change-Id: I9320820838085b34e3958eca262c5281157a3c93

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-11-30 15:09:13.000000000', 'message': 'Simplify BDM boot index checking

The previous code had a complex check which asserted that:

1. the boot index list contains 0
2. every element in the boot index list is 1 less than its successor

The second check was in a method called _subsequent_list, which I
assume was intended to be _sequential_list.

However, combined with the constraint that the boot index are >= 0,
the above 2 constraints are the same as asserting that each element in
the boot index list has the same value as its index in the list. This
is also much simpler to understand.

Change-Id: I8a3e7e6c4b72eb1c3707d54049d18dc29f606fe5
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify BDM boot index checking

The previous code had a complex check which asserted that:

1. the boot index list contains 0
2. every element in the boot index list is 1 less than its successor

The second check was in a method called _subsequent_list, which I
assume was intended to be _sequential_list.

However, combined with the constraint that the boot index are >= 0,
the above 2 constraints are the same as asserting that each element in
the boot index list has the same value as its index in the list. This
is also much simpler to understand.

Change-Id: I8a3e7e6c4b72eb1c3707d54049d18dc29f606fe5

commit_message:
Update tox.ini to stop using unverified package

As of pip 10.0, --allow-unverified is not permitted.

Use of the flag in this repo was previously used to force
installation of python-apt to accommodate certain unit tests.

The unverified package, python-apt, is no longer necessary
for test execution.

Related-Bug: #1760720

Change-Id: Id08a9dd5096afa9e6d7fe811e53c4d9d83247cac

commit_message:
API attribute processing: allow to populate dict attribute default values

Currently, the neutron-lib API code fills defaults values for the
attributes defined in a resource map, but does not fill defaults inside
the attributes that are dictionaries.

This change introduces a 'dict_populate_defaults' flag that allows the
defaults to be filled inside dictionary attributes (attributes of any
dictionary type).

This is useful to incorporate networking-sfc APIs and avoid using
the specific normalize_* converter methods [1] (see follow-up changes).

[1] https://github.com/openstack/networking-sfc/blob/master/networking_sfc/extensions/sfc.py#L226-L239

Change-Id: I0d7ff1981aa92d17811233e29a6ca7264a9ddb6c

commit_message:
Add support for keystone options to wsgi::apache

This patch adds the params that keystone currently
supports to openstacklib::wsgi::apache so we can move
keystone::wsgi::apache to using this and not drop
any existing available options.

Change-Id: Ifb988fedce958d2607365634efeccf2d7b88d073

commit_message:
Use --roles in overcloud upgrade run.

Once [0] got merged, it's possible to specify
a set of hosts (--nodes) or TripleO roles
(--roles) when calling 'overcloud upgrade run'.
Therefore, according the way tripleo-upgrade
obtains the elements to run the upgrade into,
this parameter should be --roles.

[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550099/4/

Change-Id: I4c32d7c10ae368f1d0833eb282d26f3232ea7355

commit_message:
Pass environment files to upgrade converge step.

We stop persist env files and the most safest option
is to pass all the env files used during initial deployment
to the 'upgrade converge' command.

Change-Id: Ia47293e1a3e1323a5a8801bf564fad529329d015
(cherry picked from commit 2717fb765974aae2809f73220b3775ed1146c856)

commit_message:
Add overcloud update converge tasks.

After merging [0] it will be needed an
'overcloud update converge' command to remove
no-ops set during 'update prepare'.

This patch includes all the tasks and templates
to run it.

[0] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558536/

Change-Id: Ibfc52bc2338dca9c4be2f78e381d90b28626a833

commit_message:
Avoid mixing pip and distribution packages.

The hosts may end up in a rather messed up state when mixing
distribution and pip packages. The python MySQL bindings are already
provided in the distro repositories so we can simply use these in order
to keep the host as clean as possible.

Implements: blueprint openstack-distribution-packages
Change-Id: Ic8c7f642378536d79d763625451ec267c2a108fd

subject: Rename the variables that were shadowed with python builtin
messages:
[{'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-03-10 09:28:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-03-10 09:31:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-03-13 08:44:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

We can't use this new requirement unless it is added to https://github.com/openstack/requirements

That is why the requirements-check CI job failed."}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-15 08:13:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-15 09:06:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-15 09:07:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-20 17:21:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-20 21:09:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-21 06:32:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 8731, 'date': '2018-04-23 08:15:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

(19 comments)

Most of the changes are fine to me but some are not. I'm really against of renaming 'id' everywhere although I know that it shadows a built-in function id(). My point is that it's such a widely used variable name that we'd better keep it short (more convenient for both programming, maintaining and reading IMO). We very very rarely (if ever) use id() function in the code base so I'm not concerned at all that we shadow it. I see no issue here. But making the code more verbose where not necessary is indeed a bad thing to me."}, {'account_id': 9712, 'date': '2018-04-23 08:39:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 7: Code-Review-1

I mostly agree with Renat and I'm not sure this change is really worth it. There is lots of code churn here for little advantage.

If we decide we can shadow some builtins (like "id") but not others, it will be difficult to lint. I think we would need to add the "#  NOQA" comments everywhere we use "id"'}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-23 17:23:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

Guys, I agree with you. When i did this fix, i didn't expect so much changes
I think that I should abandon this patch.
Sorry guys that I waste your time :("}, {'account_id': 27008, 'date': '2018-04-23 17:24:02.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

commit_message:
Rename the variables that were shadowed with python builtin

* Remove pep8 validation in PostgreSQL and MySQL tests
* Replace assign a lambda expression with def func
* Line break before binary operator

Change-Id: Id2223afd61bfd14feb8c6ddfa702e0686fd409d4
Signed-off-by: Vitalii Solodilov <mcdkr@yandex.ru>

commit_message:
Deprecate auth_uri option

Option auth_uri from group keystone_authtoken is deprecated[1].
Use option www_authenticate_uri from group keystone_authtoken.

[1]https://review.openstack.org/#/c/508522/

Change-Id: I35fd2cc9b91148ab23793075862483940d92798e
Depends-On: I4c82a63baabd6b9304b302c97cd751a0103d8316
Closes-Bug: #1759098

commit_message:
use environment variable to control file location probing

If OSLO_CONFIG_SHOW_CODE_LOCATIONS is set to any non-empty string it
will turn on the ability to see which file has the definition of an
Opt or where set_default() was invoked.

Change-Id: Ie705014dcf331e3c6b3367d2fefbfb9acc091799
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
[types] Remove redundant function

Function `rally.task.convert` is designed to specify which arguments of
scenario plugin should be preprocessed. It accepts keyword arguments
where key is a argument name and value is options for processing.

This function also includes a logic for postponing the loading of
ResourceType plugins to the place where they are actually executed.

I do not know historical reasons, but as for currect code place, we just
can call for obtaining the right ResourceType plugin in the right place
without any wrappers and so on.

Change-Id: Ide57d48301eba7022f2365b2d68615e5431a4c11

commit_message:
add an update non-voting job to mimimal check

Goal: in two diff commits.
Use the update job to gate:
- tripleo-quickstart
- tripleo-quickstart-extras
- tripleo-upgrade

Use the update job to check non-voting
- tripleo-$other repos

At the moment tripleo-upgrade is ungated.
To properly protect against changes in tripleo
repos it is useful to run the update job as
non-voting to help detect if a tripleo change
caused the update job to fail.

Change-Id: I9b47093fc7fc9397a5058f80d954e730304cf12f

commit_message:
Use ansible_queue_name only for upgrade/update

For upgrade and update nodes with ansible, we do not
need to play with both queue: tripleo and upgrade queue.
If we use both, we can have race where the both can have
different status and we enter in an infinite loop while
reading the socker.

Change-Id: I484a3af4a830af3b97231558876d9a6c0a31e603

commit_message:
fix URI type equality comparison

It does not make sense to compare the value of two URIs for equality
when trying to determine if the *types* are equal, so change __eq__ to
look at the max_length and schemes, which do describe the type instead
of an instance of a URL.

Since the value property is not used for anything else, it is marked
deprecated so we can remove it in a future version.

Change-Id: Ia5ba7d13a0b46b357c9225d4f71f770642c14f61
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Currently source based balancing is used for both opendaylight and
opendaylgiht_ws which results in the load being spread across only 2
bacnekds instead of 3 (as confirmed by scale tests). This commit changes
the haproxy configuration for opendaylight and opendaylight_ws to use

(cherry picked from commit 8bb4af7329074b7d19052b8708474c8f132ff864)
'}]
commit_message:
Changing opendaylight loadbalancing alogirthm

Currently source based balancing is used for both opendaylight and
opendaylgiht_ws which results in the load being spread across only 2
bacnekds instead of 3 (as confirmed by scale tests). This commit changes
the haproxy configuration for opendaylight and opendaylight_ws to use
roundrobin which is the default.

Change-Id: Idb4fe3803f69ab7440aaa2997cc4de46c9ac5458
Closes-Bug: 1762518
(cherry picked from commit 8bb4af7329074b7d19052b8708474c8f132ff864)

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at

commit_message:
fix lower constraints and uncap eventlet

Fix the lower constraints settings to match the expected values.

We will manage the eventlet version using constraints now. See the
thread starting at
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-April/129096.html
for more details.

Change-Id: If7314a88a57bdd8db9bfa090e5e46c09c37a5087
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
bionic: ensure crmsh package is installed

pacemaker no longer Recommends crmsh so explicitly install it
for all Ubuntu series as its required for charm operation.

Also enable bionic amulet test as part of a full gate recheck.

Change-Id: I06e0dcfec0a787f85655c89bf36e18253c75de2e

commit_message:
add lower-constraints job

Create a tox environment for running the unit tests against the lower
bounds of the dependencies.

Create a lower-constraints.txt to be used to enforce the lower bounds
in those tests.

Add openstack-tox-lower-constraints job to the zuul configuration.

See http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-March/128352.html
for more details.

Change-Id: I8835451b431d29ff2a4d8eb965e8684c4499e9e8
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/555034
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
